loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité La Esperanza esta constituido por 12 miembros mujeres que se dedican a actividades varias siendo la actividad de la mayoría las ventas de distintos productos como ropas, bebidas, comestibles, mercería, etc.Los créditos solicitados son muy importante para las integrantes ya que les permite mejorar la calidad de vida de ellas y de sus familias. 
Una de las integrantes la señora Gloria es quinielera, se dedica a la venta de juegos de azar de forma ambulante. Su ocupación le exige mucho sacrificio ya que todos los días sin importar el clima, el horario, debe ir al centro de ventas a retirar sus cartones para luego venderlos y con eso generar un poco de ingresos para ella y su familia. 
El crédito solicitado sería para mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su familia.
texts.en:
The "La Esperanza" communal bank is made up of 12 members; women who do various kinds of work. The majority sell various products such as clothing, drinks, foodstuffs, sewing supplies, etc.

The requested loans are very important for the members, allowing them to improve quality of life for themselves and their families.  

Gloria, one of the members, sells lottery tickets. She sells tickets for games of chance, as a street vendor. 

Her occupation demands a great deal of sacrifice. Each day, no matter what the weather or her hours of work, she must go to the sales center to collect her cards to then sell them, and that way generate a bit of income for her and her family.

The requested loan would improve quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: To set up a space to sell lottery tickets.

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita enjoys the daily activities in her life.She has been involved in food sales and the buying and selling of pigs in the village where she lives. Marita lives with her longtime partner and their two children. She and her partner work together in order to make a living. While she is busy selling frozen foods, her partner works at a slaughterhouse, where he is the butcher. According to Marita, her partner is able to earn about 400 Philippine pesos (PHP) daily as his compensation for being the butcher. Her partner also buys and sells pigs, earning about 2,500 PHP a week.

Marita's children go to school already, so she needs to work hard in order to send them to a higher level of education. She's hoping that her food sales business will continue to grow so she can obtain greater income for the bright future of her two children. With her determination to succeed, she is requesting additional working capital of 10,000 PHP to allow her to stock frozen foods and be able to buy more pigs. She believes that this loan has something to offer in the attainment of her goals in life.

loans.use: to stock frozen foods and buy pigs

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 29 years old. She is married and has 2 children who are in school.

Jacqueline is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Jacqueline has been raising pigs for 4 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jacqueline would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: And now, for her seventh cycle loan, Jennifer is requesting a loan of 18,000 PHP to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs. The Abaca weaving business that she previously funded through NWTF and Kiva partner continues to provide Jennifer and her family with increaseing income and improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 51 years old and married with four children. Janet works very hard to provide for them.

Janet runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of grocery items to sell. She has been in this business for 25 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar, and other groceries. 

In the future, Janet would like to renovate her house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Wendelin

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Wendelin works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from jewelry. Wendelin is borrowing 11500 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients and utensils for her local eatery business.

Wendelin has been sustaining her business activities with her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her realize her dream to save enough so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and utensils for her local eatery.

loans.name: Wencelma

texts.en:
Wencelma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business making and selling coconut juice in the Philippines. She is borrowing 22,000 PHP through NWTF to buy buko (coconut) and plastic cups for making buko juice. Wencelma has been in this business for 1 year. She earns more income from fruit vending.

Wencelma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy buko (coconut) and plastic cups for making buko juice.

loans.name: Charminda

texts.en:
Charminda is 27 years old and married with 1 child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Charminda has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from clothing sales. Charminda aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 59 years old and widowed with 3 children. Angelina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy grocery items such as canned goods, soap and other groceries. Angelina has been in this business for 22 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Angelina aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as canned goods, soap and other groceries.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Aida requested a 17000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall. She has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Aida would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Mike

texts.en:
Mike is a 34-year-old single man. He is pleased with his business, where he sells a variety of products to meet each customer’s demands. He has been running his store for six years, and he is able to earn about 3000 PHP a month. 

Mike would like to request an additional capital amount of 19000 PHP to purchase additional stock such as breads, canned goods and noodles. He knows that the loan will be of great help to increase his sales and therefore allow him to offer a better living for his parent and nephews.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock such as breads, canned goods and noodles.

loans.name: Byambajargal

texts.en:
Mrs Byambajargal lives with her two daughters, in a ger, in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband is deceased. Her older daughter, Byambatogtoh, is 24 years old and works in a private company. Her younger daughter, Bayartogtoh, is 17 years old, and a secondary school student. 

Mrs Byambadolgor started her business in 2002 selling organic dairy products, which she purchases from herders, in the black market. Her products sell well, and she is planning to increase her product line. She has many years experience and is a friendly person. She needs 2,100,000 MNT to purchase more organic dairy products.

loans.use: To purchase more organic dairy products

loans.name: Anabella

texts.en:
Anabella is married with 3 children, 2 are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Anabella is 37 years old.

Anabella has a house rentals business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years. She requested a 14,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for renovation of her house. In the future, Anabella would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy materials for renovation of her house

loans.name: Charmie

texts.en:
Charmie is 30 years old and married with one child.

Charmie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 11000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy grocery items like sugar, snack foods, canned goods and school supplies.

Charmie has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from a bakery.

Charmie aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items like sugar, snack foods, canned goods and school supplies.

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
Carina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 14000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store.

NWTF is relisting Carina's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Angelina is 26 years old, and is married with one child. Angelina is busy managing her general store because she wants to provide the needs of her family. As of now, she wants to re-stock her sari-sari (variety) store, but she lacks the necessary capital. In this regard, Angelina is asking for a loan in the amount of 25,000 PHP to buy canned goods, soft drinks, biscuits, candies, soap and so on. She hopes to expand her business to continuously support her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, biscuits, candies, soap and so on

loans.name: Alelp Anthony

texts.es:
Alelp es un joven de 19 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de chincha, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo es la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano, asimismo sus pobladores tienen un don en la preparación de platillos típicos ya que lo hacen de manera deliciosa es un joven muy entusiasta y por ello se esfuerza cada día para poder salir adelante, estudia la carrera de Medicina veterinaria, ya va por el segundo año y a pesar de que le es poco cansado estudiar y trabajar a la vez, siempre se da ánimos para continuar. Vive al lado de sus padres a quienes apoya mucho con el fruto de su trabajo.

Con mucho entusiasmo Alep tiene su pequeño negocio de venta y crianza de gallinas ponedoras y venta de huevos, él le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 9 horas al día ya que por las noches va a sus clases; él cree que el va bien en su negocio porque tiene mucho empeño y sobre todo porque es amable con los clientes.

Alep está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar más gallinas y también acondicionar un corral más amplio, de esta manera su negocio podrá crecer más y podrá mejorar sus ingresos, asimismo el seguirá luchando cada día para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar su carrera y hacer crecer su negocio”.
texts.en:
Alep is a young man of 19 years who lives in the city of Chinca, which is known for having a hot and cozy climate. It is also the cradle of Peruvian sports victories, and its inhabitants have a gift for preparing local dishes, which they make deliciously. 

He is a very enthusiastic young man and that is why he works hard each day to get ahead. He is studying to be a veterinarian and is right now going into his second year, and even though he is a little tired from studying and working at the same time, he always summons the energy to keep going. He lives next to his parents, who help him a lot with his work. 

Alep is very excited to have his own small business selling and raising laying hens and selling eggs. He devotes about nine hours a day to his business, then goes to class at night. He thinks that the business will go well because he has a lot of determination and, above all, because he is friendly with his customers. 

Alep is very grateful for the Kiva loans, since thanks to their help he has been able to buy more hens and prepare a larger corral . In this way, his business has been able to grow more and he has been able to improve his profits. At the same time, he will continue fighting each day to make his dream come true - to finish his education and grow his business.

loans.use: to purchase laying hens.

loans.name: Battsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Battsetseg is 32 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in a small house in Huvsgul Province, Mongolia. Her husband, Bayarmagnai, is 46 years old. He works for a construction company. Her older daughter, Tseveenjaw, is a 21-year-old college student. Her younger daughter, Enhjin, is an 18-year-old secondary school student. 

Mrs. Battsetseg started her business in 2004 by renting a commercial space at the local market and offering hair care services. She already has many regular clients. Her husband is planning to have his own business selling clothes, besides his other work. Their income can't cover their family's needs and soon their younger daughter will join the university. Therefore, Battsetseg would like to help her husband. She is an open-minded and hardworking person. She is asking for 2,500,000 tugriks to purchase inventory for her husband's new business.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her husband's new clothing sales business

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en: Yolanda is 58 years old and is engaged in a hog-fattening business as a source of livelihood. With this occupation, she provides for her family’s needs and wants. For the 6 years she has been working in this business, Yolanda has worked patiently due to her love for her family. Right now, to satisfy also the needs of her hogs, Yolanda is asking for a loan of 13,000 PHP to buy feed, vitamins, and medicine. She is looking after her hogs so well because they will provide her with a high income after 5 or 6 months. Hopefully, with her unending hard work she will achieve her dream profit.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and medicine

loans.name: Eunice Joy

texts.en: Eunice Joy is 36 years old, and is married with two children. To make a living, she and her husband work together managing their welding shop. They have been in this business for 10 years and earn about 4,500 PHP a month. At this moment, Eunice Joy is asking for a loan in the amount of 7,000 PHP to buy welding equipment such as metal, iron and welding rods for the maintenance of her business. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested to further develop her business.

loans.use: to buy welding equipment such as metal, iron and welding rods for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a married woman with four children. She is 47 years old and has had a food-selling business for many years. She sells fruits and vegetables like ripe mangoes, string beans, squash, cabbage and a lot more to the people in her community. She earns approximately 3,000 PHP monthly. 

Right now, Nida is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase different varieties of vegetables such as tomatoes, squash, string beans and "petchay" in order to increase her income. In the future, Nida hopes to attract more customers and have a big business to make her family more economically stable.

loans.use: to purchase different varieties of vegetables such as tomatoes, squash, string beans and "petchay"

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Running a sari-sari (variety) store occupies the daily schedule of Sharon. She is 32 years old, married and has two children. 

Sharon usually generates an income of about 2500 PHP a month. She utilizes it for the business, meals and to pay monthly electric bills. 

She is now asking for a loan of 15000 PHP to buy canned goods and bottled beverages to sell in her store. She is hoping to meet her customers' demand for affordable prices on merchandise she offers. She also would like to save funds to use in times of emergency.

loans.use: to buy canned goods and bottled beverages to sell in her store.

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: Tina is a hog-raiser. She has been in this kind of business for 4 years. She is now already 45 years old, and is married with four children. Tina wants to have more hogs to raise, but she lacks the necessary capital. To make it possible, Tina is requesting a loan in the amount of 7,000 PHP to buy feed, vaccines and an additional hog to raise. She believes that through her loan she will be able to sustain the proper growth of her hogs.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and an additional hog to raise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es: Manuel de Jesús de cuarenta y uno años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos, el posee una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad, huevos, leche, pan, jabones, etc., tiene varios años con el negocio y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en las ventas la cual le permite obtener siempre las mejores ganancias, es muy conocido, pues su tienda es de las mas surtidas, la clientela lo prefiere porque vende producto de calidad y a precios bajos además, de un buen servicio; Manuel es un hombre decidido, dedicado a su labor y muy perseverante, quiere ganarse un futuro mejor y esta trabajando duro para perseverar en el camino, sabe que el éxito no llega por si solo, en los últimos meses aumento la demanda y aprovechando el momento quiere acrecentar el negocio por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, pan, huevos, producto instantáneo, bebidas, etc. Manuel de Jesús tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que saldara la deuda y a la vez confía en que su familia podrá recibir una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Manuel de Jesus is forty-one years old and lives with his life partner and their children.  He owns a shop selling basic products: eggs, milk, bread, soap, etc. He has been with the business for several years and has become very experienced in sales which always allows him to get the most profit.  He is well known because their shop is the best stocked, and the clientele prefers his high quality products which they sell at low prices in addition to providing good service.  Manuel is a determined man, dedicated to his work with a great deal of perseverance.  He wants to make a better future and is working hard to persevere along the way.  He knows that success does not come by itself.  In recent months, the demand has increased and to take advantage of this he now wants to make his business grow.  For this reason he has asked for a loan from INTEGRAL which will permit him to purchase grains, candy, bread, eggs, instant products, beverages, etc. Manuel de Jesus has good payment references and excellent moral character.  He says that he will settle his debt and is very confident that his family will receive a better quality of life.

loans.use: to sell basic grains, candy, bread, eggs, instant foods, and beverages.

loans.name: Loyda

texts.es:
La Señora Loyda es muy emprendedora dedicada a su negocio propio a pesar de su edad ya que es una adulto mayor, actualmente ella vive con sus hijas y nietos es viuda y vive con su familia en Choluteca el sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la venta de artículos de plástico.
Doña Loyda el préstamo lo necesita para la compra productos de plástico como Valdez, pailas, tazas, sandalias y sombrías. Ella espera que con este préstamo tener más ventas.
Doña Loyda sus sueños es de graduar a sus nietos, y también poner otro negocio del mismo y poder ayudar a su familia.
Choluteca, Honduras - Agosto del 2012
texts.en:
Señora Loyda is very entrepreneurial and dedicated to her own business, in spite of her age. She is a senior citizen and currently lives with her daughters and grandchildren. She is a widow and resides with her family in Choluteca in southern Honduras. Her business is the sale of plastic items. 

Loyda needs a loan to buy plastic products like buckets, dishes, cups, sandals and umbrellas. She hopes that with this loan she will make more sales. 

One of Loyda's dreams is for her grandchildren to graduate, and also to open another business of the same type and be able to help her family. 

Choluteca, Honduras - August 2012

loans.use: to buy buckets, dishes, cups, sandals and umbrellas for her business.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña Aty cuenta con 11 integrantes todas mujeres de la misma comunidad, éstas señoras son humildes y con muchas responsabilidades ya que muchos de sus familiares dependen de sus ingresos. El objetivo de las mujeres es la superación personal y económico  por el bienestar de sus familias, están convencidas de alcanzarlo ya que poseen la voluntad necesaria para trabajar juntas por un  mismo objetivo.Están muy agradecidas a  la Fundación Paraguaya por  la oportunidad que brinda a las mujeres de crecer económicamente y personalmente.
Una de las integrantes, la señora Gladys se dedica a la venta de leche de vaca fresca todos los días, éste es un trabajo que debe realizar todos los días a tempranas horas, prepararlo ponerlo en los envases y salir a vender. La señora ya cuenta con una clientela frecuente pero la competencia es muy fuerte por ello la calidad y el precio es lo fundamental. 
El crédito sería utilizado para comprar mayor cantidad de envases para llegar a mas clientes y tambien para mejorar la calidad del producto.
texts.en:
The communal bank Kuña Aty has 11 members, all of whom are women from the same community.  These women are humble and very responsible since many of their relatives depend on their incomes.  These women's goal is to succeed personally and financially for the well-being of their families.  They know they can reach this objective because they possess the willpower necessary to work together for a common goal.  They are very appreciative of the "Fundación Paraguaya" (Paraguayan Foundation) for the opportunities they have given women to grow financially and personally.  

One of the members, Gladys, sells fresh cow's milk everyday.  This is a job which she must do very early, everyday as she must prepare the milk, bottle it and then go out to sell it.  She has a dedicated clientele but competition is fierce therefore price and quality are fundamental.  This loan would be used to purchase more bottles in order to expand her client base, and to improve the quality of her product.

loans.use: to purchase bottles and other instruments for the sale of milk.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Raising hogs has been the business of Nenita. She is married to a farmer and has four grown-up children. She is currently fattening two hogs. She has been in this line of business for more than 20 years now. Her main goal is to increase her income and have improved living conditions.

Nenita would like to buy two sacs of hog feed and vitamins for her hogs, but her income is not sufficient due to rising household expenditures and expenses for her ducks and chickens. So, with regards to her situation, she is asking for a loan of 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). She hopes that her business will continue to grow so there is a stable source of income for the family.

loans.use: to buy two sacs of hog feed and vitamins for her hog raising business

loans.name: Flor Maria

texts.es:
Flor es una joven de 20 años de edad, es un joven muy entusiasta y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, asimismo posee playas hermosas y sobre todo atractivos turísticos muy bonitos y muy visitados por muchos turistas en todo el año. Flor es muy alegre y cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho jugar vóley con sus amigas y vecinas de su barrio, así como también poder disfrutar de uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pato”.

Día a Día Flor trabaja muy duro en su pequeño negocio de venta de productos de belleza, ella trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 clientes al día; es muy amable y sobre todo carismática y por ello cee que le va bien en su negocio.

Flor está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como labiales, cremas, perfumes, sombras, asimismo comprar mostradores para poder exhibir sus productos de mejor manera y aumentar sus ventas, de esta manera Flor podrá seguir trabajando y luchar por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propis y tener un local propio para su negocio”.
texts.en:
Flor is a 20-year-old young woman.  She is very enthusiastic and is very eager to get ahead in life.  Her home is located in the city of Pisco, a city characterized by having a warm and welcoming climate, beautiful beaches, and above all very pretty tourist attractions that are visited by many tourists throughout the entire year.  Flor is very cheerful and when she has free time available she really likes to play volleyball with her friends and neighbors in the neighborhood, as well as being able to enjoy one of her favorite dishes which is the flavorful "arroz con pato" (duck and rice).

Day to day Flor works very hard in her small business of selling beauty products. She works about 10 hours a day and can care for up to 20 customers per day.  She is very friendly and especially charismatic, and for this reason she believes her business is going well.

Flor is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they have offered her she will be able to buy goods for her business like lip balm, creams, perfumes, shadows, and also counters so she can display her products in a better way and increase her sales.  In this way Flor will be able to continue working and fight to make her greatest dream a reality - to have her own house and her own store for her business.

loans.use: to buy goods like lip balms, shadows, and creams, among others.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 30 años, está casada Luis, con quien tiene cinco hijos. La casa donde viven es propia, la compraron hace un año.  
Desde niña aprendió lo necesario sobre la agricultura, cuando conformó su familia empezó a sembrar en terrenos arrendados, todavía no compra unos propios, pero espera muy pronto poder tenerlos. Sus principales productos son: papa, alverja y habas, las cuales cuida día a día; “tengo que levantarme temprano, pues mis terrenos quedan a 20 minutos caminando”, menciona. En cada cosecha comercializa sus productos en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad, a donde viaja una vez por semana. Ahora tiene para cosechar papa, está segura que obtendrá buenas ganancias, pues el precio se encuentra alto en el mercado.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Los ángeles de Ccano” y este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por lo que espera continuar con este apoyo financiero. Gusta de trabajar en su asociación, donde cada día aprende nuevas cosas sobre su negocio, asimismo promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Carmen invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir en su siembra de papa.
texts.en:
Carmen is 30 years old and is married to Luis, with whom she has five children. They own their home, which they bought a year ago.
Since childhood she has learned a lot about agriculture.  When her family settled down they began planting on leased land since they still haven't bought their own, although they hope to soon.  The main products are: potatoes, peas and beans, which they must care for daily. "I have to get up early because my land is a 20 minute walk away" she says. With each harvest she markets her products in the city's wholesale market, where she travels once a week. Now she has enough to harvest potatoes and is sure she'll get a good profit because of the high market price.

She belongs to the group solidarity "The Angels of Ccano" and this is her third loan with MFP, so she hopes to continue with this financial support. She likes to work in partnership, where everyday she learns new things about her business.  She also promises to be timely with their payments.
Carmen will invest the money from this loan to buy natural fertilizer to spread on her potato seed planting.

loans.use: to purchase natural fertilizers to spread out on her potato seed planting.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia is 58 years old and married with one child. She is engaged in raising hogs. Delia has been in this business for ten years. She earns about 2,500 PHP for every piglet she sells. Delia is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy feed and vaccines for her pigs. She hopes that she use this loan to further develop her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines to sustain her pigs.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn 34 years old and married with three children. She lives in the village of Gattaran. She has a small sari-sari store where she sells a variety of products to meet the demands of her customers. Marilyn is requesting a loan of PHP 14,000 to purchase more groceries, such as biscuits, pasta, sardines and pancit canton, to stock her store. In the future, she plans to start a hog-fattening business as an additional source of income. She hopes that her requested loan will be approved.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries, like biscuits, pasta, sardines and pancit canton, to stock her store.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita is a responsible mother of three children who aims to become successful in the future. She is 53 years old and married to Domingo. She raises hogs to help satisfy their family's needs. Rosita has been in this business for six years and usually earns a profit of PHP 8,000 for every two pigs she sells. Rosita planned to buy more pigs to raise but she didn't have enough capital. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. She mentioned that this loan will help her to improve her business and hopes that she will be able to grow her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Prach

texts.en:
Prach is 41 years old and an industrious woman who is engaged in a rice farming business from Ang Snoul district, Kandal province. She is married but she doesn’t have any children. She and her husband wish to have one. 

Due to the high cost of commodities, Prach also weaves bamboo baskets and other containers to sell to supplement her main income. Her husband provides motorcycle transportation service around their commune to satisfy the needs of the family. Despite their hard work, they aim to elevate their living standard in the years to come. 

At present, Prach is asking for a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase a cow to fatten for the future purpose of farming. This animal will help with the maintenance of the rice field and help the family avoid spending much money on plowing fees. Someday, with stable businesses, the family will achieve better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to fatten for the future purpose of farming (plowing the rice field).

loans.name: Tchocho

texts.fr: Célibataire sans enfant  de 28 ans, Tchotcho est une vendeuse de glaces alimentaires telles que les jus naturel, glaçon, eau glacé. Elle à entamé cette activité en 2007 et le poursuit à son domicile et de façon ambulante. Elle sollicite son Second prêt auprès de notre institution pour acheter un nouveau congélateur et des accessoires. Elle souhaite développer une seconde activité de vente des bazins avec le profit de son activité principale.
texts.en:
A 28-year-old single woman with no children, Tchocho sells frozen products such as natural frozen juices, ice cubes and frozen water.  She started this activity in 2007 and works at home and as an itinerant seller.

She is requesting a second loan from our institution.  This loan will be used to buy a freezer and accessories.

With the profits from this main activity, she would like to develop a second business and start selling "bazin" (damask) fabrics.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and accessories.

loans.name: Selvin Mauricio

texts.es:
El señor Selvin de 38 años de edad, es casado, vive con su hijo menor en su casa ubicada en la comunidad de el comercio San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace ya unos años al negocio del transporte el tiene un taxi donde presta un servicio a sus cliente de la zona de San Lorenzo.
Don Selvin esta solicitando el préstamo de 12,000.00 lempiras para comprar llantas y reparación de la unidad.
Don Selvin con el apoyo de este préstamo el desea suplir la necesidad de financiamiento que necesita para llevar a cabo  su proyecto.
El sueño de Don Selvin es comprar el numero para su unidad de transporte ya que el que el anda trabajando es rentado.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Agosto del 2012.
texts.en:
Mr. Selvin is 38 years old, married, and lives with his youngest son in his house located in the commercial district of the community of San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras.  He has been working for some years in the transportation business.  He has a taxi and he provides service to his customers in the San Lorenzo district.  

Mr. Selvin is asking for a loan of 12,000 lempiras (Honduran currency) in order to purchase tires and to repair his taxi.  Mr. Selvin, with the help of this loan, wishes to receive the necessary financing in order to complete his project.  His dream is to buy the car that he uses for transport since the one that he drives is rented.

loans.use: to purchase tires and to repair his taxi

loans.name: Genora

texts.en: Genora is a responsible mother who raises hogs. She is 55 years old and has two children. Genora is married to Chito. Genora works hard to give her children a better quality of life by doing something that brings additional income. She has been involved in buying and selling hogs for over five years and has extensive experience in this business. Genora dreams of lifting her children from poverty, and she also wants to provide for her hogs, thus she wants to take a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins for her hogs. She hopes this will make them fit and nourished, and earn higher prices when it is time for them to be sold.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins for her hogs.

loans.name: Cherryl

texts.en: Cherryl is 33 years old. She is married to a tricycle driver and blessed with two children. She hopes that someday, through this business and the direction of God, they will able to send their children to school and college. To attain this dream, they need to grow their business. But Cherryl needs funds to overhaul their tricycle. For this reason, she is requesting for a loan of PHP 13,000. She prays to maximize their income in order to save for their children’s education as well as to start her dream store.

loans.use: to repair her tricycle.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José tiene 40 años, está casado con Julia, fruto de su amor, nacieron tres hijos, quienes son aún pequeños y los cuidan en su casa propia, la que compraron hace 10 años. 
Una de sus actividades es la agricultura, ambos aprendieron el oficio de sus padres y abuelos. “Ella se encarga de cuidar los sembríos, cuando tengo tiempo le ayudo también”, afirma José, quien se dedica a la crianza de animales, posee cuatro vacas lecheras, produce varios litros de leche al día, lo que le genera ingresos permanentes para cubrir los gastos del hogar. Por esa razón José cuida mucho de la alimentación y estado de salud de sus vacas. Ahora desea comprar comida balanceada, en gran cantidad, pues de esa manera le sale más económico.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Los ángeles de ccano” y este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por lo que espera continuar con este apoyo financiero. Gusta de trabajar en su asociación, donde cada día aprende nuevas cosas sobre su negocio, asimismo promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
José invertirá este dinero en la compra de varios sacos de comida balanceada para alimentar a sus animales.
texts.en:
José is 40 years old and married to Julia. From the fruit of their love three children were born, who are still young. They care for them in their own home, which they bought ten years ago. 

One of their activities is agriculture, a trade both learned from their parents and grandparents. "She is in charge of caring for the fields. When I have time I help her too," says José. He focuses on raising animals. He owns four dairy cows and produces several liters of milk a day, which generates a permanent income to cover household expenses. That's why José takes a lot of care with the nutrition and health of his cows. Now he wants to buy feed in large quantities, as this is the most economical for him. 

He belongs to the solidarity group "Los ángeles de cano" [Cano's Angels] and this is their third loan with MFP; they hope to continue with this financial support. He likes working with his association, where every day he learns new things about his business. He also promises to make his payments on time. 

José will invest this money in the purchase of several sacks of feed to nourish his animals.

loans.use: to buy several sacks of feed for his animals.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La joven Ana Maria de  27 años de edad, es madre de tres hijos y vive en su casa con su conyugue en una aldea, en la parte turística de el sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 3 años al negocio de pulpería.
Ana María esta solicitando 15,000.00 lempiras para compra de pollo, maíz, frescos, lácteos y agua, ya que necesita surtir su pulpería.
Ana María espera que con esta capital pueda surtir su negocio y aumentar sus ventas ya que tendrá más producto a sus clientes.
Ana María Su sueño es construir su propia  casa y surtir mas su negocio.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Agosto  del 2012.
texts.en:
Ana María is a young woman of 27.  She is the mother of three children and lives with her husband in a small village in the tourist district of South Honduras.  She has been running her grocery store business for three years.

Ana María is requesting a loan for 15,000 lempiras to buy chicken, corn, soft drinks, dairy products and water because she needs to stock her grocery store.

Ana María hopes to use this money to stock her business and increase her sales so that she can offer her customers more products.  Her dream is to build her own home and further stock her business. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - August 2012.

loans.use: to buy chicken, corn, soft drinks, dairy products and water for her business

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Unidas  se denomina el excelente grupo de 12 mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Guarambare quienes  se encuentran trabajando muy felices en el 1° ciclo del programa en forma conjunta y solidaria.Todas las integrantes son muy unidas, todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos para ayudarse mutuamente y así llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo y con la Fundación Paraguaya.
Una de las integrantes la señora Liz es la tesorera del grupo y se dedica a decorar acontecimientos como fiestas de quince años, aniversarios, cumpleaños infantiles, y otros. 
Para continuar con el negocio, la señora pidió el crédito para comprar mayor cantidad de materiales decorativos como globos, figuras decorativas, telas, tortas y demás elementos que le ayudarían a crecer como decoradora.
texts.en:
Mujeres Unidas (Women United) is the name of the excellent group of 12 women formed in the city of Guarambare, where they can be found happily working in their first cycle of the program in a united and mutually supportive way.  All of the members are very close, they all work to raise funds to help each other and thus reach the goals that they all have in common within the group and with Fundación Paraguaya.

One of the members is Señora Liz, the treasurer of the group, who makes a living by decorating events like 15th birthday parties, anniversaries, children's birthdays, and others.  In order to continue with her business, she asks for the loan to buy larger quantities of decorative materials like balloons, decorative figures, fabrics, cakes, and other elements that would help her to grow as a decorator.

loans.use: to buy decorative materials like flowers, balloons, fabrics, cakes, etc.

loans.name: Mahima Prasanna

texts.en:
Mahima Prasanna is a 34-year-old physically challenged man living with his family in the small village of Odisha, India. His family consists of his parents, younger brother and his wife. His father is engaged in farming, his mother and his wife are homemakers and his younger brother works as a blacksmith. Whatever they earn from these activities is used for consumption purpose and is not sufficient for them to live happily and afford all the necessities of life.

Mahima Prasanna belongs to a blacksmith family, but as a physically challenged person, he is unable to do this activity. So to support his father financially, he started a grocery shop in his village four years ago. His village has a population of 95 families and there are only two grocery shops. People depend on these two shops for grocery items and snacks. He sells food items like rice, cooking oil, lentils, spices, packaged food items like biscuits, cake etc. in his shop. His father and his brother help him in purchasing the items for his shop. But due to lack of funds, he is not able to meet the growing demand of the customers and compete with his competitors.

He has requested a loan of 20,000 INR to purchase what he sells in bulk, including snacks like varieties of chocolates, wafers and bakery items for his shop so that he can meet the market demand and compete with his competitors. He hopes to enlarge his business and construct a concrete house for his family.

loans.use: to purchase rice, cooking oil, lentils, spices, and packaged foods like biscuits, cake etc. for his grocery shop.

loans.name: Angela Ramona

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, ciudad hermosa de verdes montañas y paisajes  encantadores, conocida desde hace muchos años como la Ciudad Del Valle encontramos el lugar donde se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal La Frontera De Urvavisa.

La señora  Angela es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos para salir adelante en su negocio y mejorar su situación económica. Tiene 57 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció pero de  esa relación tiene tres hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad e independientes.

Ella  para salir adelante junto a su familia, tiene una tienda general en su casa,  allí vende todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y carne,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, ella también vende ropa y zapatos, ventas que realiza en su tienda o en ciertas ocasiones también las realiza puerta a puerta, a ella le encanta estar en su negocio ya que allí además de ganarse la vida se entretiene y se entera de las novedades que pasan a su alrededor. Tiene más de 15 años con su negocio y le va muy bien.

Está repitiendo el crédito ya que gracias a lo que le quedo de ganancias pudo tratarse  de unas dolencias que tenia pero actualmente ya está mucho mejor, ahora espera emplear crédito para surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, ropa, zapatos y otros productos de primera necesidad. 

Su meta es seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'La Frontera de Urvavisa' community bank meet in the city of Portoviejo.  This beautiful city of green mountains and  beautiful landscapes has been known for many years as 'The City of the Valley'.

Angela is a founding member of her community bank.  She likes it because of the help that they provide in the form of loans.  This helps her to make progress in her business and improve her financial situation.  Angela is 57 years old.  Her husband died several years ago.  She has three children from her marriage who are all now grown up and independent.

In order to make progress, together with her family, Angela has a general store in her home where she sells all kinds of products such as rice, sugar, oil, detergents, vegetables, greens and meat.  She works every day, from 6.00am to 8.00pm, and sometimes until even later.  She also sells clothing and shoes.  She makes these sales from her store and also door to door.  She enjoys being in this business because, in addition to making a living, she also enjoys herself and keeps up to date with what is going on in the local area.  Angela has been working in her business for more than 15 years and is doing very well.

Angela is taking out a new loan because she was able to use some of the profits that she previously made to treat and recover from some ailments that she was suffering from.  She is now enjoying much better health and hopes to use this loan to further stock her store.  She will buy rice, oil, clothing, shoes and other products.

Angela's goal is to continue making progress in her business and to further grow her store.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, clothing, shoes and other products

loans.name: Martha Alicia

texts.es: LA SRA. MARTHA TIENE 50 AÑOS DE EDAD ELLA ES MADRE SOLTERA Y TIENE UN HIJO. DESDE HACE ALGUNOS AÑOS MARTHA SE DEDICA  A TRABAJAR EN SU NEGOCIO, ELLA REALIZA VENTA DE BEBIDAS NATURALES Y DE NUTRICION. EL NEGOCIO LO TIENE UBICADO EN SU MISMO DOMICILIO Y ES SU PRINCIPAL FUENTE DE INGRESOS. EL MOTIVO POR EL CUAL MARTHA SOLICITA UN PRESTAMO ES PARA PODER REALIZAR LA COMPRA DE UNA CANTIDAD MAYOR DE LA MERCANCIA QUE ELLA VENDE, ASI COMO DE NUEVOS PRODUCTOS QUE PUEDA OFRECER A SUS CLIENTES. CON LO CUAL ELLA VE LA POSIBILIDAD DE CRECER EN SU NEGOCIO Y EN SUS VENTAS Y ASI PODER OBTENER UN MEJOR INGRESO QUE LE BENEFICIE A ELLA Y SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Martha is 50 years old. She is a single mother and has one son. For some years she has worked at her business where she sells natural and nutritional drinks. The business is located in her home and is her primary source of income. 

The reason Martha is requesting a loan is to be able to buy a large quantity of the products she sells, as well as new items that she can offer to her customers. With this she sees the possibility of growing her business and her sales, and so will be able to receive a better income which will benefit her and her family.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise, such as natural and nutritional drinks.

loans.name: Manas Ranjan

texts.en:
Manas Ranjan is a 29-year-old disabled person staying in the village of Odisha, India with his parents. He is the only child of his parents. As a physically challenged person, he is unable to do hard work, so his father has established a grocery shop for him in his village. He has four years of experience in this grocery shop. He is the only person in his family earning an income. This business is helping him to run his family.  He sells rice, edible oil, grains, sugar, soap, hair oil and spices in his shop and earns 4,000 INR per month.

There are 70 families living in his village and they are dependent on his shop for daily household necessities but he is unable to meet the customers' demands as his shop is small and has limited stock. He wants to enhance his business by stocking more of what he sells and adding some more goods like detergents, toothbrushes, toothpaste, electric bulb etc. in his shop. He has a plan to purchase the goods in bulk so that it will reduce his transportation and buying cost. He has requested a loan of 20,000 INR to purchase these goods.

He hopes to build a house for his family and save some money for his future and his marriage.

loans.use: to purchase rice, edible oil, grains, sugar, soap, hair oil, spices, detergents, toothbrushes etc for his grocery shop.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is known as hardworking mother of two children. She endures hardship in managing her piggery business for the bright future of her children and  wishes to have a greater income through her business. 

For this purpose, she is applying a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy feed, medicines, and vaccines. Through the loan, she hopes to improve her business as well as to acquire an improved income.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicines, and vaccines

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en:
Melodina is from Dalapang, Ozamiz City. She is 43 years old and married, with seven children. 

To make a living, Melodina plants and harvests corn for sale. She's been in her business for 13 years and earns PHP 6,000 a month for these activities. In 2008, Melodina joined GDMPC. 

Melodina is requesting a loan of PHP 12,500 that will be used to obtain seedlings and pay for labor costs in weeding. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to obtain seedlings and pay for labor cost in weeding.

loans.name: Teko

texts.fr: Têko, âgée de 38 ans est mariée à un gérant et mère de 03 enfants dont 02 scolarisés. L’ainé a 8 ans et le dernier à 10 mois. Sa seule activité génératrice de revenu est la commercialisation du charbon de bois. Elle sollicite son premier prêt à WAGES pour s’acheter du charbon de bois qu’elle commercialise à son domicile. Elle compte utiliser  le revenu qu’elle obtiendra pour devenir un grossiste et élevé le niveau de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Têko, age 38, is married to a manager and the mother of three children, two of whom are in school.  Her oldest child is 8 years old, the youngest is 10 months old.

Têko's only income-generating activity is charcoal sale.  She is requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy some charcoal that she will resell from home.

She is planning to use the income that she will generate to become a wholesaler and raise her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Korandebe/gtng Group

texts.fr:
Ramadhan fait partie du groupe Korandebe /Gtng. Il a 35 ans, il est marie avec 1 enfants de 13 ans et il est scolarise. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Ramadhan est agriculteur de riz. C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.

Pour accroitre son agriculture du riz, il planifie de demander d’autres prêt pour accroitre se activités agricole. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait être un meilleur producteur de riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer les frais scolaire et médicaux pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ramadhan is a member of the Korandebe /Gtng group. He is 35 years old and married, with one 13-year old child who attends school. Ramadhan’s educational level is six years of primary school.

Ramadhan is a rice farmer. This is his third loan cycle with ACB. He will use his  loan to purchase chemical fertilizers and  pay the cost of labor.
His growth strategy is to keep requesting loans in order to expand his agricultural business. In the years to come, he would like to become one of the best rice producers in the region. He plans to use the revenues to pay for the education and healthcare of his [child].
.

loans.use: to purchase chemical fertilizers and to pay labourers.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Prakas Chandra

texts.en:
Prakash Chandra is a physically challenged person who is 35 years old and living with his wife, son aged 14 and his daughter aged 10. The children are continuing their schooling. Prakash Chandra manages his family by running a variety store where he has seven years of experience. He earns 3,000 INR per month from his variety store, which is not enough for him to control his cash flow.  His variety store is 1 kilometer from his home. He operates his store from 7 am to 9.30 pm every day. He wants to grow his business but he can’t because of his poor financial condition. He sells betel, biscuits, coconuts, incense sticks, toffees, lentil, flour etc.

He has requested a loan of 20,000 INR to purchase more goods (noodles, chocolates, tooth paste, tooth brush etc.) for his variety store so that he can earn 4,000 to 4,500 INR per month from this business and capture the customers according to their demand. He hopes to provide a better education for his children.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, chocolates, tooth paste, tooth brushes, coconuts etc. for his variety store.

loans.name: Nabin

texts.en:
Nabin is a 36-year-old physically challenged person. He lives with his wife who is 31 and his son who is 6 years old. He has a variety shop at a local market that is 500 meters from his home. He has eight years of experience in this field. He earns 5,000 INR to 6,000 INR from this variety store. In his shop, he sells soap, shampoo, potatoes, onions, cooking oil, toothpaste, toothbrushes etc. and he wants to purchase a refrigerator so that he can sell soft drinks. He also wants to add some new items like detergent, toffees, biscuits, chocolates etc.

He has requested a loan of 20,000 INR to purchase a refrigerator and the above items so that he can meet the customers’ demands and create an  attraction for his shop. He has a dream of constructing a house for him and sending his son to school.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, potatoes, onions, cooking oil, toothbrushes, detergents and a refrigerator for his variety shop.

loans.name: Yolanda Marisol

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, ciudad hermosa de verdes  montañas y paisajes  encantadores, conocida desde hace muchos años como la Ciudad Del Valle  encontramos el lugar donde se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal La Frontera De Urvavisa.

En este lugar vive la señora Yolanda, tiene 32 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos de 17, 15, 12, 9 y 5 años de edad, los mayores estudian en colegio y los menores en escuela. El marido es maestro constructor.

Ella trabaja en una casa en la ciudad realizando quehaceres domésticos pero en sus ratos libres se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y realiza sus ventas puerta a puerta, una vez que sale de su trabajo ella visita a sus clientes para cobrar y ofrecer sus productos ya que  vende a crédito y cobra por semanas, lleva más de 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, la mercadería se la envían de quito cada vez que necesita.

Está repitiendo el crédito ya que con el crédito anterior ella pudo financiar su negocio porque no tenía capital para invertir  y con las ganancias que tuvo pudo ayudar a su marido con los gastos que generan los estudios de sus hijos. Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas, entre otras prendas. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ella ha podido financiar su negocio y ganarse algo por su cuenta para ayudar a sus hijos.
 
Su sueño es que sus hijos sean personas de bien y profesionales.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, a beautiful city of green mountains and enchanting landscapes, known for many years as the City of the Valley, we find the place where the members of the “La Frontera De Urvavisa” communal bank meet every 15 days.

This is the place where Yolanda lives. She is 32 years old and lives in a common-law relationship from which she has five children, who are 17, 15, 12, 9, and 5 years old. The oldest ones study in high school, and the younger ones in grade school. Her husband is a master builder.

She works at a house in the city where she does the domestic chores. In her free time she works in commerce. She sells clothing of all kinds door-to-door. Once she leaves work, she visits her clients to charge them and to offer her products, which she sells on credit and then charges for each week. She has been in this business for more than 5 years and it is going very well for her. She is sent merchandise from Quito whenever she needs it. 

She is requesting a new loan. With the previous loan she was able to finance her business, because she didn’t have the capital to invest in it. With the earnings she was able to help her husband with her children’s school expenses. This loan will be used to buy pants, shirts, and blouses, among other clothing items. She has been with the communal bank since it started and she likes it because she has been able to finance her business and earn something on her own so that she can help her children. 

Her dream is for her children to be successful and professional people.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, blouses, and other garments.

loans.name: Clara Eufemia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, ciudad hermosa de verdes  montañas y paisajes  encantadores, conocida desde hace muchos años como la Ciudad Del Valle  encontramos el lugar donde se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal La Frontera De Urvavisa.

En este lugar vive la señora Clara, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad, una de ellos aun vive con ella es discapacitada. Su esposo es maestro albañil.

Ella para salir adelante junto a su familia y con esto ayudar a  su esposo ya que el a veces no tiene trabajo seguro se dedica al comercio, tiene una tienda en su casa  donde vende todo tipo de productos como: arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y carne, además de ciertas productos de bazar, allí trabaja con la ayuda de su hija que es la que siempre le acompaña. Tiene más de 4 años con su negocio y le va muy bien, gracias a esto ellos están saliendo adelante.

Este crédito es para surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, entre otros productos de primera necesidad. Lleva 4 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos está aumentando su negocio.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, a beautiful city of green mountains and charming landscapes known for many years as the City of the Valley, one finds the place where the members of communal bank La Frontera de Urvavisa meet every 15 days.

This is where Señora Clara lives.  She is 45, married, and from this relationship has four children, all of whom are older. One of them still lives with her and is disabled.  Her husband is a master bricklayer.

In order to get herself and her family ahead in life and to help her husband who sometimes does not have work she makes a living through trade.  She has a small store in her house where she sells all types of products like rice, sugar, oil, detergents, vegetables, greens, and meat, in addition to some second-hand items.  She works there with the help of her daughter who is the one who always accompanies her.  She has spent more than four years in this business and it is going very well, thanks to those who are successful.

This loan is to stock up her store.  She is going to buy rice, sugar, and oil, among other basic products.  She has had four cycles in her communal bank and she likes it because thanks to the loans she is growing her business.  Her goals are to continue getting ahead in her business and to give the best to her family.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, and other basic products.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro tiene 34 años, es un hombre trabajador, vive en la casa que compró junto a su esposa, Donatilda de 35 años, con sus tres hijos.
Tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa, la cual, normalmente atiende su esposa, pues él se dedica al cuidado de sus cultivos de café y cacao, ya que gracias a la venta de sus cosechas logró abrir su tienda, hace 2 años. La dificultad es cuando la mercadería que tiene se le agota y no puede suplir las necesidades de sus clientes, por ello acude a MFP.

Este es su segundo crédito y agradece por el apoyo y la confianza que una vez más le brindan. Asimismo, se siente contento de formar parte de su banco comunal, ya que los socios son activos y responsables. 
Con estos 1,000 nuevos soles comprará un saco de arroz, azúcar y algunas conservas necesarias para abastercer su tienda.
texts.en: Alejandro is 34 and is a hard-working man.  He lives in the house that he bought with his wife, Donatilda, 35, and their 3 children.  He has a grocery store in his home, to which his wife usually attends.  He is dedicated to caring for his coffee and cacao fields.  Thanks to the sales of his harvests, he was able to open the store 2 years ago.  The difficulty he has with his business is when his merchandise runs out, and he cannot meet his customers' needs.  This is why he turned to Microfinanzas Prisma.  This is his second loan, and his is thankful for the support and confidence that they are offering him again.  He is also happy to be a part of his communal bank.  Its members are active and responsible.  With these 1,000 PEN, he will buy a sack of rice, sugar, and some canned goods to stock his store.

loans.use: to buy a sack of rice, sugar, and some canned goods necessary to stock his store.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia tiene 49 años, está casada con Mauro, de 44 años. Gracias al trabajo de ambos, lograron construir su casa propia, donde viven junto a sus seis hijos.
Ella es agricultora, se dedica a cultivar cacao y café desde hace 16 años. En tiempos de cosecha tiene que contratar jornaleros para extraer con rapidez los frutos de las plantas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar de sus cultivos, ya que depende de eso el ingreso de su economía. Por otro lado, considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde su chacra hasta los centros de acopio de su localidad, lugar donde le   ofrecen los mejores precios. Para más adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar su producción.

Este es su crédito número 10 con MFP, ella ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida por el resto de los integrantes.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles de este préstamo comprará fungicidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades en sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Antonia is 49 years ol, and is married to Mauro, who is 44.  Thanks to the work of both, they were able to build their own home, where they live together with their 6 children.  She works in agriculture, raising cacao and coffee, work that she has done for the past 16 years.  During harvest time she has to contract laborers in order to quickly extract the fruit from the plants.  What she likes most about her work is taking care of the fields, since her economic income depends on that.  On the other hand, she considers transport of her products the most difficult part of her work, moving product from her field to the center of town, where they offer the best prices.  In the future, she hopes to buy new land in order to increase production.

This is her 10th credit with MFP.  She has been very punctual with previous loans and she hopes to perform similarly this time.  In her communal bank she is a very beloved associate for the other group members.

With 1000 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) from this loan she will buy fungicides in order to avoid the plagues and sicknesses that can affect her crops.

loans.use: to buy fungicides in order to avoid the plagues and sicknesses that can affect her crops.

loans.name: Dasarathi

texts.en:
Dasarathi is a 31-year-old disabled man living with his parents, his wife and a 2-year-old son. He is the only person earning an income in his family. He owns and manages a variety store from which he earns 5,000 INR per month. He sells betel, biscuits, toffees, wafers, tobacco sachets, face cream, talcum powder and hair oil in his variety store. 

He has a plan to make his shop bigger and add more items like soft drinks and fashion accessories (earrings, bracelets, anklets, bangles, etc.). He says that by adding these items to his shop, his monthly income will increase and he can make his family live a better and happier life.

He has requested a loan of 20,000 INR to purchase more stock of what he sells, a refrigerator for keeping soft drinks and fashion accessories. 

He has a dream of making his son study in a good school and saving some money for a bright future.

loans.use: to purchase biscuits, wafers, face creams, fashion accessories and a refrigerator for keeping soft drinks

loans.name: Michael Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nabaguma est leader du groupe Michael. Elle est entrepreneur très ambitieuse, âgée de 47 ans, mère de 10 enfants. Son mari est un cultivateur. La cliente est vendeuse de denrées alimentaires. Elle expose ses articles à son domicile. Elle démarra son business avec son fonds propre, il ya 11 ans qu’elle fait cette activité. Le défi majeur pour cet entrepreneur est qu’elle vend parfois en crédit. Ce nouveau crédit lui servir d’acheter 1 sac de mais et un basin de tomates. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima et ses partenaires pour le soutien aux petits entrepreneurs non bancables.Il sied de signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en:
Nabaguma is the leader of the "Michael" group.  She is 47 years old, the mother of ten children and a very ambitious entrepreneur.  Her husband is a farmer.

Nabaguma sells food products, displaying them at her house.  She started this business 11 years ago using her own funds.  Her main challenge is that she sometimes has to sell on credit.

With this new loan, she will be able to buy one sack of maize and a bowlful of tomatoes.

She thanks Hekima and its partners for the support they provide to small-scale entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system.

It should be noted that, (in the photo), some of the borrowers are carrying their babies.

loans.use: to buy one sack of maize and a bowlful of tomatoes.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Epa Furaha Group

texts.fr: Le client Rumbo, est un enseignant carriériste, directeur d’une école primaire d’application Furaha,  expérimenté dans la gestion des établissements scolaires. Il est marié et père de 13 enfants qui étudient et d’autres ont déjà leurs propres foyers. Son épouse est vendeuse de denrées alimentaires. Ce crédit de Hekima doit lui servir de payer la scolarité de ses enfants universitaires, et le reste d’argent sera affecte dans les travaux de finissage de sa maison en dur et dans l’achat de meubles. Le client reconnaît qu’il prépare déjà sa retraite car, il est actuellement âgé de 65 ans. Ainsi, dit-il, le client remercie Hekima et ses partenaires pour le soutien aux enseignants non bancable faute de garantie de sureté.
texts.en: The client Rumbo is a professional educator and director of Furaha, a primary school which is also a teacher training site. He is an experienced educational administrator. He is married and the father of 13 children, some of whom who study and others already have their own households. His wife sells food products. This loan from Hekima will allow him to pay for the university studies of his children and to use the rest of the funds for house repairs and  furniture purchases. The client acknowledges that he is already thinking about retirement as he is presently 65 years old. He thanks Hekima and its partners for supporting educators who are unable to get loans due to lack of collateral.

loans.use: to pay for the university studies of his children and his home repairs.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
EL  Banco Comunal 8 De Mayo se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad del Valle, ciudad de clima cálido de hermosas mujeres y con una gran variedad en su gastronomía.

La señora  Leonor, tiene 62 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció pero de esa relación tuvo seis hijos pero uno de ellos falleció, los cinco que aun tiene ya son mayores de edad y una hija aun vive con ella a pesar de que ya está comprometida.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y zapatos, vende en su casa donde tiene un pequeño local y hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan de algún producto, deja a crédito y sale a cobrar los fines de semana, casi nunca ha tenido problemas con esto ya que sus clientes son muy seguros y confiables, lleva más de 14 años en este negocio y gracias a esto ella puede obtener para sus gastos sin depender de nadie.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar  ropa y zapatos. Este es el segundo ciclo   en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos cada vez aumenta su negocio.

Sus metas son seguir adelante y gozar de buena salud.
texts.en:
The “8 de Mayo” communal bank meets every 15 days in the beautiful city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, known as the City of the Valley. It is a city with a warm climate, lovely women, and a great variety of food. 

Leonor is 62 years old. Her husband passed away several years ago, but they had six children together, one of whom died. Of the remaining five, they are all adults and one of her daughters still lives with her, though she is engaged. 

Leonor sells all types of clothing and shoes. She sells from her house, where she has a small store and where her customers come when they need something. She sells on credit and then goes out to charge on the weekends. She has almost never had problems with this because her clients are very safe and reliable. She has been in this business for more than 14 years. Thanks to her business she has been able to provide for herself and hasn’t depended on anyone.

She will use this loan to buy clothing and shoes. This is her second loan cycle with the communal bank and she likes it because the loans grow her business. 

Her goals are to continue working and to enjoy good health.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es:
Benedicta tiene 37 años, está casada con Gerardo, de 48 años. Viven en la casa que compraron gracias a sus esfuerzos, junto a sus tres hijos.
Esta pareja se dedica a la agricultura, tienen su parcela con cultivos de cacao, labor que llevan realizando hace 22 años y siempre, en las temporadas de cosecha, cuentan con el apoyo de peones para terminar de manera más rápida su cosecha. Posteriormente, los llevan a comercializar en las asociaciones acopiadoras de su localidad, donde les dan buenos precios por sus productos. Su mayor anhelo es terminar de construir su casa a base de material noble (ladrillo y cemento); pero lo que ahora prioriza es abonar sus cultivos para obtener una buena producción en su próxima cosecha. 

Este es su crédito número 4 con MFP y agradece, una vez más, el apoyo que le brindan. Asimismo, se compromete a ser puntual con sus cuotas de pago, como en sus anteriores créditos.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles que solicita comprará abono para sus cultivos de cacao.
texts.en: Benedicta is 37 and is married to Gerardo, who is 48.  They live in the house that they bought thanks to their efforts.  They live with their 3 children.  This couple makes a living through agriculture.  They have a piece of land with cacao crops, work that they they have done for 22 years and still do.  At harvest time, they have the help of day laborers so they can finish their harvest more quickly.  They then take their crop to sell to the crop storage associations in their area, where they are given good prices for their products.  Her biggest dream is to finish building her house with decent materials (brick and cement).  Now her priority is to fertilize her crops to obtain a better production at her next harvest.  This is her fourth credit with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she is thankful for the help that they are offering her again.  She promises to be punctual with her payments as with her previous loans.  She will use the 1,000 PEN that she is requesting to buy fertilizer for her cacao crop.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her cacao crop.

loans.name: Sonia Dellanires

texts.es:
EL  Banco Comunal 8 De Mayo se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad del Valle, ciudad de clima cálido de hermosas mujeres y con una gran variedad en su gastronomía.

La señora Sonia, tiene 59 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos todos mayores de edad,  dos de ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Ella es una mujer muy luchadora y que para ayudar con los gastos del hogar a su esposo que no gana mucho en sus labores en el campo puso un pequeño restaurante en su casa, de lunes a sábado la mayoría de los almuerzos que prepara es para entregar ya que le piden sus clientes con anticipación,  los días domingos  prepara para la venta en general ya que llegan muchas personas en ese dia al sector. Trabaja con la ayuda de sus hijos y en ciertas ocasiones también su esposo le ayuda. Tiene más de 8  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien  ya que su comida es deliciosa y la prepara con mucho cariño.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 14 años  y le gusta por la ayuda que le han brindado en todo este tiempo.
  
Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y tener buena salud ella y su familia.
texts.en:
The “8 de Mayo” communal bank meets every 15 days in the beautiful city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, and known as the City of the Valley. It is a city with a warm climate, lovely women, and a great variety of food. 

Sonia is 59 years old. She is married and has three adult children, two of whom still live with her. Her husband is a farmer.

She is a very hardworking woman. To help her husband with the household expenses, since he doesn’t earn much from his farming work, she started a small restaurant in their house. From Monday through Saturday, most of the lunches she makes are for pick-up, since her clients order ahead of time. On Sunday she makes food for general sale, since many people come to the neighborhood on that day. She works with her children’s help, and on some occasions her husband helps her too. She has had this business for more than 8 years and it is going very well for her because her food is delicious and she makes it with love.

She will use this loan to buy rice, meat, fish, and other ingredients for the preparation of her foods. She has been in the communal bank for 14 years and she likes it because it of the support it has provided during all this time.

Her dreams are to continue working in her business and to have good health, both for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, fish, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada is a 32-year-old young woman. She is divorced and has a 7-year-old son. She is a school employee who gets low salary, which is not enough to cover all the costs.

Recently, Ghada moved to her new house. She is requesting a loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing furniture for the living room and make her house more livable. With this loan, Ghada will be able to offer comfortable furniture to her son and they can enjoy living in their new house.

Ghada is photographed above in her new house.

loans.use: To purchase new living room furniture

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en: Catalina works hard to support her family. Catalina is single and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years now and also earns additional income from selling food. Catalina requested a 16,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell in her general store. In the future, Catalina would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina tiene 38 años, es esposa de Paulino, de 37 años, y madre de cuatro hijos. Su casa es propia, la compró gracias al trabajo de ambos.
Ella se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 16 años, normalmente trabaja con su esposo y su hijo mayor, pero en las temporadas de cosecha cuenta con jornaleros, ya que de esa manera logran culminar de manera rápida la recogida de los frutos. Este es el trabajo que le gusta realizar, pues cada año va mejorando la cantidad y calidad de sus cultivos. Sin embargo, las dificultades que tienen es por abatir las plagas que dañan sus cultivos, para ellos cuenta con los préstamos de MFP.

Este es su noveno crédito, por lo que se siente contenta de la oportunidad que le dan y se compromete a cumplir puntualmente con su cronograma de sus pagos.
Con estos 2,000 nuevos soles realizará la compra de fertilizantes para sus  plantas de cacao y café.
texts.en:
Catalina is 38 years old. Her husband is Paulino, of 37 years of age. She has four children. They have their own house which they bought thanks to their hard work.

For sixteen years she has been earning her living through agriculture. She works with her husband and oldest son, but during the harvest season they hire day workers, since this allows them to quickly finish collecting the fruits. 
She enjoys carrying out this work, since each year her crops are improving in quantity and quality. 

Nevertheless, they have difficulties in fighting the plagues that damage their crops. For this reason they rely on loans from MFP.

This is her ninth loan and she is happy she is being offered this opportunity and promises to make repayments punctually. With these 2,000 nuevos soles she will buy fertilizers for her cocoa and coffee plants.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her cocoa and coffee plants.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Farming has been the primary source of income for Delia's family. Delia is 30 years of age, married and has two children who currently go to school. Her spouse's occupation is a farmer, while she is involved in raising hogs. She is glad and thankful to Almighty God because she has been able to run her hog raising business for more than six years up to this time.

Delia's goal is to let her children finish their studies and be able to give them a bright future someday. So, this couple works hard in order to have a better way of life, meet their daily needs and save some money for their children's education. Delia hopes that she can make her business more profitable and be able to add more pigs to raise.

Delia would like to borrow additional working capital amounting to 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to be able to buy one piglet and two sacs of livestock feed. She's hoping that this loan will be granted so that her dreams in life will be fulfilled as soon as possible.
