loans.use: to buy one piglet and two sacs of livestock feed for the daily maintenance of her hogs

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 21-year-old single guy with three sisters and a brother. He is a university student majoring in accounting. As he is in the beginning of his path, he has decided to support himself. 

Mohammad is requesting a loan to pay his semester fees to get his bachelors degree.

loans.use: to pay his semester fees

loans.name: Lama

texts.en: Lama, a 23-year-old single lady living with her family, is the oldest among her siblings.  A third-year university student majoring in accounting, Lama is requesting this loan to pay for her semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees.

loans.name: Juan De Mata

texts.es: El señor Juan tiene 64 años de edad casado con la Sra. Rosa se dedican a la agricultura que es la fuente de sus ingresos económicos producen papa, haba, oca con rotación de cultivos en terreno de 2,13 Has en la actividad tienen bastante experiencia en cuanto manejo de los cultivos, tratamientos fitosanitarios, cosecha y mercadeo, ellos viven en la comunidad de Cotani Alto a 48 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba. Don Juan necesita dinero para reintegrar el terreno agrícola que estaba comprando, el ahorro que tenían le prestaron a su hermano para que compre un lote de terreno agrícola en trópico, Don Juan nos comenta con el préstamo comprara el terreno así aumentara su producción para garantizar la seguridad alimentaria de su familia.
texts.en: Juan is 64 years old and is married to Rosa. They work in agriculture, which is the source of their income. They farm potatoes, broad beans, and oca [a tuber similar to potatoes] using rotational planting on a 2.13 hectare piece of land. They have a lot of experience in the activity of managing crops, including pesticides, harvest, and marketing. They live in the community of Cotani Alto, 48 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba. Juan needs money to pay for a piece of land he was buying. The savings that he had, he lent to his brother so that he could buy a piece of land in the tropical region. Juan explains that with the loan he will buy the land and thereby increase his production so he can guarantee his family's food security.

loans.use: to buy agricultural land.

loans.name: Laura Magdalena

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, ciudad hermosa de verdes  montañas y paisajes  encantadores, conocida desde hace muchos años como la Ciudad Del Valle  encontramos el lugar donde se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal La Frontera De Urvavisa.

En este lugar vive la señora Laura, tiene 29 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 11 y 9 años los mismos que estudian en escuela. El marido es maestro soldador.
 
Ella es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa interior así como también productos de catalogo de varias marcas como Avon, Esika, Oriflame y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja de tres a cuatro días en sus recorridos y cobros ya que deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de 6  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son los perfumes y cosméticos ya que son muy buenos.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa interior. Lleva 4 años  en el Banco Comunal, es la presidenta y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido.
 
Su sueño es ser directora de cualquiera de las marcas que vende.
texts.en:
The members of the Community Bank, La Frontera de Urvavisa, meet every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo. Portoviejo is also called the Valley City, and is surrounded by green, lush mountains and beautiful scenery.

Laura is 29 years old, and lives in the city of Portoviejo with her husband and their two children, who are 11 and 9 years old, and who are both in school. Her husband works as a master welder.

Laura takes care of their home, and, in order to generate additional income to help with household expenses, she also has a retail business where she sells health and beauty products from catalogs. She sells products such from Avon, Esika, Oriflame and Yanbal, all of which are health and beauty lines for women. She travels door to door making sales, and she works on three to four day rotations, selling many of her products on credit and collecting payments from clients every 8 days. After more than six years in the beauty sales field, things are going really well for Laura. Her most popular items are perfumes and cosmetics.

She plans to use the support from this loan to purchase perfumes, creams, cosmetics and underwear to further stock her business. She has been a member of the Community Bank for four years, and is now the president of the group. She enjoys being a member, as she feels the group is very unified.
Her dream is to become a director for one of the brand names she currently sells.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, creams, cosmetics and other products.

loans.name: Clementina

texts.es:
Clementina tiene 35 años, es soltera, pero madre de cuatro hijos. Su casa es propia, la compró gracias a su trabajo y esmero de salir adelante. 
Su trabajo es labrar la tierra de su parcela donde tiene cacao, hoja de coca y café. Viene trabajando 20 años en esta actividad y su mayor dificultad es combatir los insectos que dañan los frutos de las plantas. Su deseo para el futuro es ahorrar lo suficiente para comprar nuevas tierras y aumentar su producción.

Este es su crédito número 6 con MFP, sabe que tiene la responsabilidad de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal siempre esta al tanto de todos los acuerdos a los que llegan, pues es un socio muy participativo.
Con estos 2,500 nuevos soles comprará injertos de cacao para seguir cultivando en su parcela.
texts.en:
Clementina is 35 years old, single, but has four children. She owns her house which she managed to buy through hard work and effort. She works on the land growing cocoa, coca leaves, and coffee, a job she’s been doing for 20 years. Her biggest problem is the insects which eat her crops. Clementina’s greatest wish for the future is to save enough money to buy new land and increase production.

This is her sixth loan with MFP. She knows that she is responsible for paying back the money on time and is happy to do this. In her community bank she is always welcoming to everyone who goes there because she is a very active member.

With the 2,500 soles, Clementina plans to buy cocoa grafts so she can continue growing cocoa on her land.

loans.use: buy cocoa grafts

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is 63 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Herminia runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell.

She has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, rice, laundry soap, and other miscellaneous items. 

Herminia would like to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items to sell

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn runs a sari-sari store in the village of Gattaran and requested a PHP 15,000 loan to buy items such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, breads and cooking oil to sell in her store.

She has been in this business for more than 11 years and is thankful for the improvement of her living conditions. She believes that the financial assistance will help her business. In the future she will be successful, as she continues to work hard.

loans.use: To buy items such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, breads, and cooking oil

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 41 years old and married with five children. She lives in Ozamis City. For the past nine years, Jocelyn has owned and operated a farm, planting and harvesting rice to sell. She earns 7,000 PHP each month and joined GDMPC in 2007.

Jocelyn is requesting a 10,500 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer such as manure. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
As a married mother of 2 children, Sylvia works hard to support her family.

She sells purified drinking water in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from a tricycle transportation business and a general store. Sylvia is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase more purified drinking water to sell to her customers.

Sylvia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more purified drinking water to sell to her customers

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: This time, Rosemarie is borrowing Php 29,000 to buy fishing gears and other equipment. The general store business that she previously funded through NWTF, a Kiva partner, continues to provide Rosemarie and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: To buy fishing gears and other equipment

loans.name: Fridalyn

texts.en:
Fridalyn is a housekeeper who is married with one child attending school. She also operates a small store where she sells grocery items to the people in her village. Her store is located in her house. Fridalyn wants to offer more products and increase her income but she has insufficient funds.

Fridalyn is requesting a 15,000 PHP to buy soft drinks, eggs, bread, and noodles to sell in her store. She promises to pay her loan on time and to keep improving her business sales to save funds for her child's education. Fridalyn also hopes to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, eggs, bread, and noodles

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 50 years old and married with four children. She is from Barangay 5, Tangub City. For the past 12 years, Angelita has owned and operated a business raising pigs to sell. She earns 3,000 PHP each month and joined GDMPC in 2010. 

Angelitia is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She will use the additional revenue generated from her loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 45 years old and married with two children.

Arlene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a grocery store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy more grocery items to sell in her store.

Arlene has been in this business for 16 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Arlene aspires to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items to sell in her store

loans.name: Myassar

texts.en: Myassar is a mother of four children. She lives in a rented home and works in a school. She started a small clothing-sales business at home to help in improving their living conditions. She applied for this loan to increase the amount of clothes she has and to add some variety to it.

loans.use: To increase the amount of clothes she has to sell

loans.name: Clemente

texts.es:
Clemente tiene 38 años. La casa donde vive es propia, está construida a base de madera, y la compró junto con su esposa Rosa, de 38 años. Ellos tienen tres hijos, a quienes desean brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
Hace 10 años compraron su propio terreno de cultivo, allí producen cacao, el cual ahora se encuentra en plena producción. Para los tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de jornaleros que contratan, luego llevan a vender sus sacos a los centros de acopio de su localidad, lo cual es muy difícil, por el peso que tienen. Para más adelante, Clemente desea comprar una moto de carga, por ello se esmera en tener una buena producción cada vez.

Este es su crédito número 6 con MFP y agradece el apoyo que le brindan, ya que así logrará con sus objetivos. En su banco comunal es un socio activo y responsable.
Con los 3,000 nuevos soles de este préstamo podrá comprar abono orgánico y fertilizantes para mantener en buena producción sus plantas.
texts.en:
Clemente is 38 years old. He lives in his own house, which is made of wood. He bought it with his wife, Rosa, who is 38 years old. They have three children, whom they want to provide with a better quality of life.

Ten years ago they bought their own farm land. They produce cacao, which is now in full production. At harvest time, they count on help from hired workers. Then they take their sacks of cacao to collection centers in their town, which is difficult because they are very heavy. In the future, Clemente wants to buy a cargo motorcycle. In order to do this, he puts in a lot of effort to have a good harvest every time. 

This is his 6th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and he is grateful for the support it has provided him, since he will be able to achieve his goals. He is an active and responsible member of his communal bank.

With the loan of PEN 3,000.00 (nuevos soles), he will buy manure and fertilizers to maintain his plants at a good level of production.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer to maintain his plants at a good level of production.

loans.name: Daysi

texts.es:
Daysi tiene 19 años, su pareja es Danny, de 24 años. Viven en la casa de sus padres y esperan que más adelante tengan un mejor futuro, pues su mayor anhelo es tener su cas propia.
Ambos se dedican a la agricultura, tienen campos de cultivo que sus padres le heredaron con plantas de cacao y hoja de coca. Su labor diaria es labrar la tierra, desyerbar las malezas y fumigar las plantas para que las plagas no causen ningún daño. Ya llevan 3 años trabajando en su propia parcela y hasta el momento han tenido una buena producción.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP. Daysi se siente muy contenta por el apoyo que le brindan, así como la acogida que le han dado en el grupo al que se acaba de integrar.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles realizará la compra de sacos de abono para la mejora su producción.
texts.en:
Daysi is 19 years old, and is married to Danny, who is 24 years old. They are presently living with her parents in their home, but she and Danny hope to build a better future for themselves, and to one day have their own house.

Both Daysi and Danny make a living as farmers, and have some land that Daysi's parents inherited, and on which they currently grow cacao and coca plants. They work every day tilling  and preparing the land, weeding out harmful pests and plants, and fumigating the plants so that plagues don't damage them. They have been farming for three years on their parcel of land, and have taken very good care of that land.

This is her first loan with MFP, and Daysi is very grateful for the support of the organization, as well as for the welcome she has received as a member of the solidarity group she has joined. With the support from this loan, Daysi plans to purchase sacks of manure for spreading on her crops and helping with the growing cycle.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of manure for cultivating her crops.

loans.name: Diome

texts.en:
Diome is a 54-year-old resident of Lupagan, Clarin. She provides for her three children's needs from the small amount of 8,000 PHP she earns monthly from her rice farming business. Diome has been in this business for the past eight years to supplement her husband's income and has been a member of GDMPC since 2005.

Diome is requesting a 14,500 PHP loan to buy fertilizer. She wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Maximo

texts.en:
Maximo is married with 3 children. Maximo is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Maximo provides transportation services to the local community to earn a living. He has been doing this for 8 years and every month he earns 5,000 PHP from this work. He has requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to repair an existing vehicle for better service.

Maximo has been a member of GDMPC since 2007. In the future, Maximo hopes that his children will finish their studies, and he hopes to double his income from his business.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Ep Rutoboko Group

texts.fr: La cliente Bwira, est une enseignante dans une école primaire Rutoboko depuis 2005. La cliente est âgée de 27 ans, très ambitieuse. Elle est encore célibataire. Outre ce statut d’enseignante, elle est aussi étudiante dans une université de la place, au département de développement communautaire. En plus, elle est fournisseur des produits alimentaires  (riz, farine, savons, etc.),a ses pairs enseignants, que ces derniers prennent en crédit pour payer  après. Elle avait pris cette initiative de lors, le besoin d’un  cantine scolaire se faisait sentir dans plusieurs écoles de la ville. Ce crédit de Hekima doit lui servir de payer les frais académiques  et de renforcer son projet de cantine. Ainsi, dit-elle, la cliente remercie Hekima et ses partenaires pour le soutien aux enseignants non bancable faute de garantie de sureté. Il sied de signaler au public, que ce profil appartient à la fille, portant les habits en couleur rouge et non le directeur de l’école qui lève sa main avec plus d’enthousiasmes.
texts.en:
This client, Bwira, has been a teacher at a Rutoboko primary school since 2005. She is 27 years old and very ambitious. She is still unmarried. Aside from being a teacher, she is also a student at a local university in the department of community development. In addition, she is a supplier of grocery items (rice, flour, soaps, etc.) for her teacher peers, who pay on credit. Bwira had undertaken this initiative at the time because of the need for a school shop in several schools in the city. This Hekima loan must serve to cover education costs and to bolster her plans for a shop.

Thus, she says thank-you to Hekima and its partners for supporting unbanked teachers who lack collateral. It is appropriate to indicate to the reader that this profile belongs to the girl wearing red and not to the school's director, whose enthusiastically raised his hand in the photo.

loans.use: to cover the cost of education and to bolster her plans for a shop

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Nancy Del Rocio

texts.es:
EL  Banco Comunal 8 De Mayo se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad del Valle, ciudad de clima cálido de hermosas mujeres y con una gran variedad en su gastronomía.

La señora Nancy tiene 33 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco  hijos de 17, 15, 11, 8 y 4 años de edad los mismos que estudian en colegio, escuela y jardín de infantes el último. El marido es comerciante.
 
Ella hace varios años aprendió corte y confección en una academia de la localidad y ahora con la finalidad de obtener sus propios ingresos y aprovechando sus conocimientos en corte y confección puso en su casa un pequeño taller de costura, allí  se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa pero solo en las noches y fines de semana ya que en los días laborables de lunes a viernes trabaja en un taller en el centro de la ciudad por lo cual recibe un sueldo semanal. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta 18h00 en el taller y de ahí en su casa hasta las 21h00 o 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar. Lleva 8 años dedicada a esta actividad que le deja sus propios ingresos útiles para ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar para pagar parte de una máquina de coser que compro hace tiempo atrás y para  telas y otros materiales para la costura. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y sin tantos requisitos.

Su sueño es tener su propio taller en el centro de la ciudad con operarias.
texts.en:
Sra. Nancy is 33 years old and lives in a common-law relationship. She has five children aged 17, 15, 11, 8, and 4, all of whom attend high school, primary school, or kindergarten. Her partner is a businessman.

Several years ago Nancy learned how to sew and make clothes in a nearby college, and now she uses her knowledge and earns her own money. She opened a small sewing workshop in her home and makes all kinds of clothing, but only in the evenings and at weekends as during the rest of the week she works as a seamstress in a workshop in the centre of town and receives a weekly wage. Nancy works every day from 6 am to 6 pm in the workshop and then at home  until 9 or 10 o’ clock at night, sometimes even later when she has orders to complete.  She’s been doing this for eight years so she can have money of her own which comes in handy to help with her children’s education.

This new loan will be used partly to pay for a sewing machine that Nancy bought some time ago, and partly for fabric and other sewing supplies. She is in her third loan cycle with her Community Bank and likes the system because the loans are made quickly and without too much red tape. Her dream is to have her own workshop in the centre of town with some employees to help her.

loans.use: to pay for a sewing machine, fabric, and sewing supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabrics and shoes to sell

loans.name: Gema Monserrate

texts.es:
EL  Banco Comunal San Gregorio se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad del Valle, ciudad de clima cálido de hermosas mujeres y con una gran variedad en su gastronomía.

En este lugar vive la señorita Gema, tiene 23 años de edad, está soltera y vive en casa de sus padres. Lleva cuatro ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la oportunidad que le dan para poder salir adelante junto a su familia.
 
Ella hace tiempo atrás aprendió belleza en una academia en la localidad, es una joven muy trabajadora que para ayudarse y ayudar a su papá realiza el crédito, ella realiza pintado de uñas a domicilio y es para eso que emplea una parte del crédito pues la otra parte se la da a su papá el cual tiene un negocio de venta de jugos naturales, ventas que realiza en un quiosco que tiene en la terminal terrestre de la ciudad, él lleva más de veinte años con este negocio con el cual aun saca adelante a su familia, ella mientras a tanto trabaja todos los días a domicilio cuando alguna cliente la llama, ella lleva tres años realizando esta actividad la cual le encanta.

Este crédito es para comprar cosméticos y varias herramientas de belleza que necesita así como también frutas para el negocio del papá.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran salón de belleza el cual espera poco a poco irle equipando.
texts.en:
The San Gregorio Community Bank meets twice a month in the beautiful town of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí province. It’s also called la Ciudad del Valle and is known for its warm climate, beautiful women, and a wide variety of wonderful food.

23-year old Sra. Gema lives there. She is single and lives with her parents. She’s had four loans with the Bank, and likes the system because of the opportunity it provides to help her and her family get ahead.

Some time ago Gema took beauty courses at a local college. She is very hardworking and is taking on this loan to help both herself and her father. She runs a nail salon out of her home and wants to use part of the loan for this business, and part to help her father with his business selling natural juices from a kiosk in the town bus terminal. He’s had this business for more than 20 years and the income from it still supports the family. 

Meanwhile Gema works both from her home or in her customers’ homes when they call her. She’s been doing this for three years and loves her job. 

The loan is to be used to buy cosmetics and various tools she needs for her salon. The money will also buy fruit for her father’s business. Gema’s dream is to own a large beauty salon which she hopes to equip over time.

loans.use: buy cosmetics, tools for her salon, and fruit

loans.name: Dieu Est Grand Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DIEU EST GRAND est formé de cinq personnes qui exercent la même activité. La représentante de ce groupe nommée Opportune, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Opportune est âgée de 41 ans et est mariée à un certain Valery. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Opportune a arrêté l’école au cours primaire. Il y a près de quinze ans que Opportune exerce comme activité, la vente de divers produits (conserves, savons et pâtes alimentaires) à son domicile ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Opportune désire renforcer et diversifier son activité. Pour ce faire, Opportune sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DIEU EST GRAND, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group DIEU EST GRAND comprises five persons who do the same work. The group's representative, called Opportune, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. This is the third time this group has requested financial support from ALIDé with the aim of boosting their business. 

Opportune is 41 years old and married to a man named Valery. The couple have two children, both in school and in their care. Opportune dropped out of primary school. For nearly fifteen years, she has had a business selling a variety of goods (canned foods, soaps, and pasta) out of her home. This enables her to meet her family's needs without much problem. 

Concerned about responding better to the requirements of her customers, Opportune would like to bolster and diversify her business. To do so, she is requesting, along with the other members of the group DIEU EST GRAND, a third loan from ALIDé. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods (canned foods, soaps, pasta) to sell from home

loans.name: Donatilda

texts.es:
Donatilda tiene 64 años, es viuda, tiene cinco hijos, quienes la apoyan en todo. Juntos viven en su propia casa, la cual compró cuando su esposo todavía vivía.
El trabajo es la agricultura, tiene plantas de cacao, hojas de coca y plantaciones de café. Viene trabajando en esto hace 36 años, y sabe que lo más rentable es el cacao y las hojas de coca, por lo que las empresas acopiadoras le dan mejores precios por esos productos. Su mayor problema es combatir los insectos que intentan dañar sus frutos, por ello está muy al pendiente de cuidar de sus plantas. 

Este es su crédito número 10 con MFP, sabe que tiene la responsabilidad de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesto a hacerlo, como anteriormente. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y responsable. 
Con estos 1,000 nuevos soles comprará fungicidas para prevenir las enfermedades de sus plantas.
texts.en:
Donatilda is a 64-year-old widow, with five children that she supports. Together they live in their own home, which she bought when her husband was still alive.

Donatilda works in agriculture and has cocoa plants, coca leaves and coffee plantations. She has been working for 36 years and knows that cocoa and coca leaves are more profitable because the the companies give better prices for these products. Her biggest problem is trying to combat damaging insects, so she is very aware of caring for her plants.

This is her 10th loan with MFP and she knows she has a responsibility to pay all her dues on time and is willing to do so, as she has done previously. In her communal bank she is a very participatory and responsible member.

With these 1,000 soles she will buy fungicides to prevent diseases of plants.

loans.use: to buy fungicides to prevent diseases of plants.

loans.name: Gmtb Group

texts.fr: Le groupement GMTB est composé de onze personnes qui exercent la même activité. Le représentant de ce groupement, du nom de Tadagbé Augustin est celui ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour une deuxième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Tadagbé Augustin a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Tadagbé Augustin est âgée de 47 ans et est mariée à une revendeuse du nom de Yvette. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Tadagbé Augustin vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Tadagbé Augustin assure ensemble avec sa femme, les diverses charges de la famille. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de sa famille, Tadagbé Augustin exerce depuis une vingtaine d’années environs, la maçonnerie. Parallèlement à cette activité, Tadagbé Augustin fait l’élevage des porcs. Tadagbé Augustin s'approvisionne auprès des grossistes. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Tadagbé Augustin et les autres membres du groupement GMTB sollicitent un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The group GMTB comprises eleven persons who do the same work. The group's representative, Tadagbé Augustin, is the one in the photo with his hand raised. With the goal of boosting their business to cope better with customer demands, this group is requesting financial support from ALIDé for a second time.

Tadagbé Augustin dropped out of primary school. He is 47 years old and married to a retailer named Yvette. The couple have four children, all in school and in their care. Tadagbé Augustin lives together with his wife and children. He and his wife jointly ensure that the diverse family expenses are covered. 

To help with diverse family needs, Tadagbé Augustin has been doing masonry for about twenty years. Parallel to this business, he raises pigs. He gets his supplies from wholesalers.

With the goal of bolstering their work and satisfying their customers further, Tadagbé Augustin and the other members of the group GMTB are requesting a second loan from ALIDé. Their ambition is to boost their businesses. The first loan was indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and some pigs

loans.name: Mercedes Elena

texts.es:
Mercedes es una mujer de 48 años, vive en la ciudad de Camaná con sus 3 hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, lamentablemente Mercedes sufrió la pérdida de su esposo, ella quedo viuda, desde entonces ha dedicado todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; ella siempre ha sido una persona muy alegre, trabajadora y entusiasta, trabajo desde muy joven para apoyar a sus padres, debido a ello no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver películas y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Saltado de Pollo para compartir con sus hijos.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, Mercedes puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de bollos, ella se dedica a la panadería de manera artesanal, todas los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y cree que le va bien porque sus clientes la recomiendan por sus deliciosos panes y por su trato amable.
Mercedes se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de insumos, tales como: harina, polvo de hornear, mantequilla, huevo, bandejas, moldes, entre otros, todo ello por cantidad; de esta manera Mercedes contará con los insumos necesarios para su panadería, con ello espera aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para más adelante poder ampliar su negocio, así ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose por que junto con su familia puedan salir adelante.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 48 years old. She lives in the town of Camaná with her 3 children whom she loves very much and who are her reason for living. Sadly, Merecedes lost her husband and became a widow. Since that time, she has dedicated all of her efforts to providing for her family. She has always been a very cheerful person, hardworking and enthusiastic. She worked from the time she was very young to help her parents. Because of this, she wasn’t able to study a professional career, but she would have liked to do so. In her free time, she likes to see movies and on special occasions she cooks a delicious “pollo saltado” [a Peruvian dish similar to stir-fried chicken] to share with her children.

With much effort and enthusiasm, Mercedes started a small business selling rolls. She makes bread by hand. Every day she starts her work in the very early hours of the morning. She works approximately 10 hours per day and she believes that business is going well because her clients recommend her because of her delicious breads and her friendly manner.

Mercedes is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because, due to the support they have provided, she will be able to buy ingredients such as: flour, baking powder, butter, eggs, baking sheets and molds, and other items, and in large quantities. Mercedes will have the necessary ingredients for her bakery, and with this, she hopes to increase her sales and her income, which will serve eventually to help her expand her business. This way she will continue working hard so that she and her family can get ahead.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as flour, baking powder, butter, eggs, baking sheets and molds, etc.

loans.name: Mercedes Fidelina

texts.es:
EL  Banco Comunal San Gregorio se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad del Valle, ciudad de clima cálido de hermosas mujeres y con una gran variedad en su gastronomía.

En este lugar vive la señora Mercedes. Tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y de esta  relación tienen dos  hijas de 9 y 3 años, la mayor esta en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en una institución pública.
 
Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que se  dedica al hogar, al cuidado de sus hijas y al comercio, vende ropa interior de damas  por catalogo de la marca Leonisa, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y trabaja tres o cuatro  días a la semana pero más que todo en las mañanas, también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes a comprar sus productos los mismos que deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Su mercadería la recibe en una distribuidora en Portoviejo.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar ropa interior de damas ya que tiene pedidos por entregar. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal, es la presidenta del Banco y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos sin tantos requisitos.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y darle lo mejor a sus pequeñas.
texts.en:
The "San Gregorio" communal bank gathers together every 15 days in the charming town of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí. The town is known as the City of the Valley and it has warm weather, beautiful women and a great variety in its gastronomy.
That's where Mercedes lives. She's 30 years old and married, and from this marriage she has two daughters aged 9 and 3. The older one attends school. Her husband works for a public institution.
She's a very good homemaker who's dedicated to her household, to taking care of her daughters and to sales. She sells ladies' undergarments by way of a catalogue from the Leonisa brand. She sells door-to-door and works three or four days a week, but mostly in the mornings. She also sells from home, where her customers come to buy her products, which she sells on credit and collects payment every eight days. She receives her merchandise from a distributor in Portoviejo.
She will use this loan to purchase ladies' undergarments, since she has orders to deliver. She's a founding member and the president of the communal bank, and she enjoys it because the loans come through quickly, without so many requirements.
Her dreams are to move forward with her business and to provide the best for her little girls.

loans.use: to purchase ladies' undergarments.

loans.name: José Felipe

texts.es: José Felipe  de sesenta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y su hija; el posee una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad, granos básicos, leche, pan, jabones, etc. tiene varios años con el negocio y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en las ventas  que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, la tienda esta ubicada en su domicilio y es la mas conocida de la zona, se ha hecho de mucha clientela fija pues la gente lo prefiere porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan a precios accesibles, con producto de calidad y por supuesto con buen servicio; José es un hombre dedicado a su labor, motivado y muy luchador, siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, como todo buen comerciante quiere hacer crecer el negocio pero para ello necesita de capital que lo respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, pan, producto instantáneo, bebidas, jabones, etc. José Felipe tiene buenas referencias de pago y se hace responsable de cancelar la deuda al mismo tiempo tiene la confianza que así podrá ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: José Felipe is sixty four years old. He lives with his life's companion and his daughter. He owns a store where he sells basic necessity products such as basic grains, milk, bread, soap, etc. He has had his business for several years and has a lot of experience in sales  which allows him to obtain better profits. The store is located in his home and is the best known store in the area. He has gained a lot of regular customers because people prefer him. He always has what they need at accessible prices, in quality products and of course, good service. José is a man who is dedicated to his work. He is motivated and a fighter. He is always awaiting new opportunities that will allow him to attain success. Like any good merchant, he wants to make his business grow but to do that he needs capital to back him up. That is why he is asking INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow him to buy basic grains, snacks, bread, instant products, beverages, soap, etc. José Felipe has good payment references and he is taking on the responsibility for paying off the debt. He also is confident that he can offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, snacks, bread, instant products, beverages and soap.

loans.name: Heidi

texts.en:
Heidi is a 29-year-old married woman with three children living in Gata Diot, Clarin. Her husband is a farmer. 

In order to add income to the family, Heidi started a food resale business (specifically hot dogs) two years ago. She usually gets 3500 PHP per month.

With the help of GDMPC microcredit, Heidi will now be able to buy more food items like sausage to sell because of the money amounting to 5000 PHP rendered to her. 

Heidi joined GDMPC just recently. Someday, she’s hoping for much greater revenue so she can expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more food items like sausage to sell.

loans.name: Ep Furaha Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kubuya, est une enseignante dans une école primaire Furaha. La cliente est âgée de 38 ans, tres ambitieuse. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants qui étudient. Son époux est chômeur. Ce crédit de Hekima doit lui servir de payer la scolarité de ses enfants  et de lancer le projet de construction de sa maison. Dans le futur proche, la cliente espère commencer les études supérieures  pour compléter sa formation. Ainsi, dit-elle, la cliente remercie Hekima et ses partenaires pour le soutien aux enseignants non bancable faute de garantie de sureté.
texts.en:
This client, Kubuya, is a teacher in a Furaha primary school. She is 38 years old and very ambitious. She is married and the mother of two children, who are students. Her spouse is unemployed. 

This Hekima loan must serve to cover the cost of schooling for her children and to launch plans for building her house. In the near future, this client hopes to begin higher studies in order to complete her education. Thus, she is thankful to Hekima and its partners for supporting teachers who are unbanked and lack collateral.

loans.use: to cover the children's schooling and housing costs

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra tiene 34 años, está casada con Demetrio, de 37 años, con quien tiene cuatro hijos. 
Ella es agricultora, sus padres le enseñaron este oficio desde muy niña. Ahora, junto a su esposo, tiene su propia chacra desde hace 13 años donde cultiva cacao, café y coca.  En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de jornaleros que contrata para esa labor. Sus productos los comercializa en su misma localidad, puesto que obtiene los mejores precios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar, ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo valieron la pena, por otro lado, considera que lo más difícil es trasladar los productos desde su parcela hasta el punto de secado. Para más adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras para aumentar su producción.

Este es su crédito número 13, siente que el dinero del crédito le ayudara mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es muy querido por el resto de sus compañeros, ya que es muy solidario con ellos.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles que solicita realizará la compra de abono para fertilizar sus plantas de cacao y café.
texts.en:
Alejandra, 34, is married to Demetrio, 37, with whom she has four children.  She's a farmer.  Her parents taught her this work at a young age.  Now, she has had her own farm with her husband for 13 years where she grows cacao, coffee, and coca.  During the harvest she has the help of day laborers she hires for that job.  She sells her products in her own town because she gets the best prices.

What she likes most about her job is harvesting because that way she feels that the months of hard work were worth it.  On the other hand, she considers the most difficult thing to be moving the products from her plot of land to the place for drying.  In the future she hopes to buy new lands to increase her production.

This is her 13th loan.  She feels that the money from the loan will help her a lot to make progress in her work.  She is well loved by the rest of her companions in her communal bank because she is very supportive with them.

With the 1,000 nuevos soles [PEN] she is requesting she will buy fertilizer for her cacao and coffee plants.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her cacao and coffee plants

loans.name: Balabhadra

texts.en:
Balabhadra is a 28-year-old physically challenged person living with his parents and his elder brother. He has a variety shop in his village, which is 100 meters from his home. He has six years of experience in this business. His brother is helping him to purchase the goods for his shop. He sells betel, biscuits and wafers, spices, lentils, and cooking oil and earns 6,000 INR per month from this business. The total population of this village is 700, which depends on two shops for their household goods. He is not able to reach the growing demand in the present scenario.

There is another betel shop in his village. To compete with this shop, he wants to purchase more stock and a variety of spices, oil, personal care merchandise like the shampoos, detergents, and toothpaste he is selling right now and more variety of chocolates and wafers.  He has requested a loan of 25,000 INR to add more stock to his shop.

loans.use: to purchase spices, oil, personal care merchandise like shampoos, detergents, toothpaste, chocolates and wafers for his variety store.

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
El comité cuenta con catorce (14) integrantes  en donde todas tienen una pequeña actividad a la cual se dedique por mas pequeña que sea las señoras se sienten muy emocionadas, la ayuda mutua entre ellas es constante y por sobre todo las inspira las ganas de seguir luchando por sus familias, el trabajo en equipo y utilizando todos sus recursos disponibles hace que sus luchas sean su mayor fortaleza. 
Cada una de las integrantes han invertido su crédito en una actividad productiva generándoles una pequeña ganancia. 
Todas tienen la esperanza de seguir luchando por salir adelante, buscando el progreso de cada una de ellas y la de su comité. 
Aurelia, una de las integrantes del grupo, se dedica a la repostería con esta actividad ella genera ingresos para su familia y ella misma; deses agrandar el día de mañana su negocio y de esa manera tener mayor clientela.
Solicita el crédito para comprar productos como crema pastelera, chocolates, maizena, dulces de leches, etc. para poder preparar sus tortas y poderlas ofrecer a su clientela.
texts.en:
This committee has fourteen (14) members. All of them have a small activity that they work at, no matter how small. The women are very excited and the mutual help between them is constant. Above all, it inspires them to want ot get ahead and keep fighting for their families. The teamwork and using the available resources makes them fight even harder. 

Each of the members has invested her loan in a productive activity, generating a small product. They all hope to keep fighting to get ahead, seeking progress for each of them and for the committee. 
 
Aurelia, one of the members of the group, works masking pastries. With this activity she generates income for her family and for herself. Tomorrow, she wants to enlarge her business and in this way have more customers. 

She is asking for the loan to buy products such as pastry cream, chocolates, corn starch, dulce de leche, etc., to be able to make her cakes and be able to offer them to her customers.

loans.use: to buy products such as pastry cream, chocolates, corn starch, dulce de leche, etc.

loans.name: Adeluz

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Adeluz;La socia sigue dedicandose al negocio de llamadas telefonicas ,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio ,la socia sigue trabajando de forma ambulatoria por el centro de la ciudad,la socia realiza llamadas locales y nacionales,la socia trabaja desde las 07:00am hasta las 09:00pm aproximadamente,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de un par de equipos de celulares.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Adeluz, continues working in the telephone call business.  She's been in this business for some time.  It's going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her business.  She still works as a street vendor in the downtown of the city.  She makes local and national calls.  She works more or less from 7 a.m. until 9 p.m.  She's a responsible and hardworking person, which is how she gets her family ahead.

She's requesting the loan to buy some mobile phone equipment.

She's happy about the loan and promises to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone equipment

loans.name: Victoria Isabel

texts.es:
VICTORIA ISABEL tiene 43 años de edad es soltera tiene un hijo de 22 años de edad vive con el hijo en la ciudad de Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC 30 DE JULIO, se encuentra ubicada en Recinto Zapotal nuevo, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

VICTORIA ISABEL  se dedica  a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz, fréjol y maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, fertilizantes urea, abonos, líquido mata monte.

Las compras y las ventas de los productos las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas cada 8 días. Con La ayuda del crédito podrá invertir en los insumos.

Enfrenta desafíos cómo las plagas y la sequedad en los cultivos. El sueño es tener más éxito. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer quehaceres domésticos.
texts.en:
VICTORIA ISABEL is 43 years old. She is single and has a 22 year old son. She lives with her son in the city of Ventanas, province of  Los Ríos.

She is a member of the 30 DE JULIO rural bank, located in the community of Zapotal Nuevo, in the Ventanas canton. They work in agriculture.

VICTORIA ISABEL works in agricuture. She plants rice, beans, and corn. She is asking for the loan to buy materials, fertilizers, urea, and liquid weedkiller.

She buys and sells her materials and products in the city of Ventanas every week. With the help of the loan, she will be able to invest in the materials.

She faces challenges such as pests and drought with the crops. Her dream is to have more success. In her free time, she likes to do housework.

loans.use: to buy materials, fertilizers, urea, and liquid weedkiller.

loans.name: Usharani

texts.en:
Usharani is a 30-year-old disabled person. She is living with her mother and elder brother who is 32 years old. After realizing the family situation, she started a variety shop in her village in 2009. There is one more variety shop in her village. The total population of this village is more than 1,000 and they all are dependent upon these two betel shops. She sells betel, biscuits, chocolate, wafers, detergent, shampoo, toothbrushes and toothpaste etc. in her shop and earns 5,000 INR per month. She wants to purchase a refrigerator to sell soft drinks (soda) and water. With the remaining amount, she plans to buy more stock of grocery items like a variety of spices, cooking oil, sugar, rice, lentils etc.

She has applied for a loan of 20,000 INR to purchase the above-mentioned goods for her shop. She hopes this loan can help her to earn 6,000 to 6,500 INR per month so she can save some for her future. As a physically challenged female, she does not want to be a burden to her brother.

loans.use: to purchase spices, cooking oil, sugar, rice, lentils etc and a refrigerator for keeping soft drinks in his variety store.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita has operated a sari-sari store in the village for almost five years. Since the income of her husband is not enough to sustain their basic needs, Rosita started this small business as a way of earning extra income.  But she lacks financial support to make her business grow. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase additional stock such as noodles, cooking oil, detergent soaps and spices, which are in demand in their village. The loan will be of great help in achieving her high sales, enabling her to offer a better standard of living and to support her children's studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks such as noodles, cooking oil, detergent soaps and spices

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Chagali Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kafeka, présidente du groupe de crédit Chagali, Femme courageuse, entrepreneur, âgée de 38 ans, mère de 6 enfants qui étudient tous. Elle est vendeuse des petits articles devant son domicile notamment (Riz, sucres, Fanta, savons, sels, épisses, etc.) Son mari travaille dans une agence de transport. Elle commença son business avec le crédit de Hekima, de lors qu’elle fut informée par ses amis de ce programme de microcrédit. Les bénéfices de son activité servent d’épargne, d’alimentation et scolarité pour ses enfants. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser 7 cycle de crédit. Au cours de la période, cette cliente a vu ses affaires régressent suite à la crise et aux problèmes de l’insécurité de la région. Grace aux crédits de Hekima, elle a réalisé des équipements ménagers importants pour sa famille. Ainsi, ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 2 sacs de aies, 2 bidons d’huile de Rina, et autres divers. En plus, elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir en douceur. La cliente remercie Hekima et ses partenaires pour les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes à faible revenu.
texts.en:
The client, Kafeka, is the president of the loan group Chagali. A courageous woman entrepreneur, she is 38 years old and the mother of six children, who are all in school. Kafeka is a retailer of sundries in front of her home that include rice sugar, Fanta, soaps, salt, spices, etc. Her husband works at a transportation agency.

Kafeka started her business with a Hekima loan when she was informed by her friends of this microcredit program. The profits from her business go toward savings, food, and schooling for her children. However, she just completed seven loan cycles. Over that time, this client saw her business shrink following the crisis and the security problems in the region. Thanks to Hekima loans, she got important home supplies and equipment for her family.

So her new loan must serve to supply her with 2 sacks of garlic, 2 containers of Rina oil, and a variety of other goods. In addition, she would like to see her children grow up smoothly. 

This client thanks Hekima and its partners for their actions in supporting poor women with low incomes to become autonomous.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of garlic, 2 containers of Rina oil, and various other goods to sell

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
El grupo “SANTA LIBRADA” es un comité de 17 mujeres que están muy bien organizadas, unidas, trabajadoras y solidarias unas con otras. Estas señoras son de la ciudad de Mbocayaty ,todas son vecinas y amigas. Se reúnen quincenalmente para brindarse apoyo y ayuda unas a otras para seguir mejorando día a día.
La mayoría de estas microempresarias se dedican a la fabricación, compra y venta de productos comestible como: empanadas, milanesas, tortas, alfajores. También se dedican al bordado, encaje ju y crochet.
Estas señoras están animadas por seguir participando de este programa de microcrédito, para así mejorar sus actividades económicas y su calidad de vida.
El mayor anhelo que tienen es ver a sus hijos y nietos crecer en una ciudad donde haya fuentes de trabajo y un lugar donde ellos puedan recrearse sanamente y libremente.
La sra. Sebastiana tiene una pequeña mercería con la cual ayuda a la canasta familiar, le gustaría poder ofrecer mayores productos a sus clientes fijos y ocasionales.
Solicita el crédito para comprar agujas, encajes, cierres, botones, hilos, etc. y poderlos ofrecer a su clientela.
texts.en:
The "Santa Librada" communal bank is comprised of 17 women who are very organized, united, hardworking and supportive of each other. These ladies come from the town of Mbocayaty and they're all neighbors and friends. They gather together every 15 days to offer each other support and help in order to keep making progress on a daily basis.
Most of these entrepreneurs make, buy and sell foodstuffs such as empanadas, fried meats, pies and alfajores. They also do embrodering, lacework and crochet.
These ladies are excited to continue to participate in this microcredit programme so that they can improve their businesses and their living conditions.
Their biggest wish is to see their children and grandchildren grow up in a town where they can find job opportunites and a place where they can play healthily and freely.
Sebastiana owns a small grocery store in order to help with her family's expenses. She'd like to offer more merchandise to her regular and occasional customers.
She requests the loan in order to purchase needles, lace, zippers, buttons, thread, etc., so she can offer them to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase needles, lace, zippers, buttons, thread, etc.

loans.name: Angel Humberto

texts.es:
ANGEL HUMBERTO tiene 49 años de edad es soltero tiene cuatro hijos vive con los hijos en Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC 30 DE JULIO, se encuentra ubicada en Recinto Zapotal nuevo, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

ANGEL HUMBERTO se dedica  a la agricultura y a la artesanía. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, fertilizantes, ranger, urea, abonos, líquido mata monte.

Las compras y las ventas de los productos las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas cada 15 días. Con La ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura.

Enfrenta desafíos cómo las plagas, lancha en los cultivos. El sueño es comprarce un carro. En el tiempo libre le gusta trabajary jugar boly.
texts.en:
Angel Humberto is 49 years old and is single. He has four children. He lives with them in Ventanas, in the province of Los Ríos. 

He is a member of the “30 de Julio” communal bank, which is located in the rural town of Zapotal Nuevo, which belongs to the canton of Ventanas, where people work in agricultural activities. 

Angel Humberto works in farming and crafts. He is requesting the loan to buy inputs such as fertilizers, Ranger herbicide, urea, manure, and liquid herbicide.

He buys and sells products in the town of Ventanas every 15 days. With the help of the loan, he will be able to buy what he needs for his agriculture.

He faces challenges such as insects and late blight in his crops. His dream is to buy a car. In his free time, he likes to work and play volley ball.

loans.use: to buy inputs such as fertilizers, Ranger herbicide, urea, manure, and liquid herbicide.

loans.name: Lafortune Group

texts.fr: La cliente Bembeleza représentante du groupe de crédit Lafortune, Femme courageuse, entrepreneur, âgée de 40 ans, mère de 11 enfants qui étudient tous. Elle est vendeuse des petits objets de maquillage dames notamment (perruques, mèches, bijoux, bagues, gourmettes, rouge à lèvres, lotion de beauté, parfum, etc.) au marché central de Virunga. Son mari est un technicien soudeur. Elle commença son business avec le crédit de Hekima, de lors qu’elle fut informée par ses consœurs de ce programme de microcrédit. Les bénéfices de son activité servent d’épargne, d’alimentation et scolarité pour ses enfants. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir son 5eme cycle de crédit. Au cours de la période, cette cliente a vu ses affaires marchent positivement malgré la multitude des taxes aux quelles, elle est assujettie. Toute fois, Grace aux crédits de Hekima, elle a réalisé des équipements ménagers importants pour sa famille. Ainsi, ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 30 perruques et autres divers. En plus, elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir en douceur. La cliente remercie Hekima et ses partenaires pour les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes à faible revenu
texts.en:
The client, Bembeleza, is the representative of the loan group Lafortune. A courageous woman entrepreneur, she is 40 years old and the mother of eleven children, who are all in school. Bembeleza is a retailer of sundry cosmetic products, particularly wigs, hair extensions, beauty lotions, perfumes, etc. at the Virunga central market. Her husband is a welding technician.

Bembeleza started her business with a Hekima loan when she was informed by her friends of this microcredit program. The profits from her business go toward savings, food, and schooling for her children. However, she just completed her fifth loan cycle. Over that time, this client saw her business progress upward, despite the multitude of taxes to which she is subjected. In any case, thanks to Hekima loans, she achieved important home supplies and equipment for her family.

So her new loan must serve to supply her with 30 wigs and a variety of other goods. In addition, she would like to see her children grow up smoothly. 

This client thanks Hekima and its partners for their actions in supporting poor women with low incomes to become autonomous.

loans.use: to purchase 30 hair pieces and a variety of other cosmetics products to sell

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Zoila Dolores

texts.es:
EL  Banco Comunal San Gregorio se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad del Valle, ciudad de clima cálido de hermosas mujeres y con una gran variedad en su gastronomía.

En este lugar vive la señora Zoila, tiene 51 años de edad, está divorciada pero de esta relación tuvo 4 hijos todos  mayores de edad, la menor estudia en universidad y es la única que vive en su casa.

Ella trabaja en una institución pública pero también se dedica al comercio, vende productos de Avon y Esika (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), zapatos de la marca Rey, sabanas, edredones, entre otras cosas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y  trabaja todos los días y a toda hora ya que también vende sus productos donde ella trabaja, los fines de semana recorre ciertos lugares donde tiene mucha clientela,  deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días, su mercadería la compra en Quito y Guayaquil, lleva más de 12 años dedicada al comercio y le encanta lo que hace.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: zapatos, sabanas, perfumes, cremas, etc. Está en el Banco Comunal  desde el inicio y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos.
 
Su meta es tener un carro nuevo.
texts.en:
The communal bank San Gregorio meets every fifteen days in the beautiful city of Portoviejo, the capital city of the province of Manabi, which is known as the City of the Valley. It's a city of warm weather, lovely people, and a great variety of cuisine.

Zoila lives in Portoviejo. She is 51 years old, and is divorced but has four children from this relationship. All of her children are older: the youngest studies at the university and is the only one that lives at home. 

She works at a public institution but also makes a living in business, selling Avon and Esika products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for women), "Rey" brand shoes, blankets, sheets, and more. She makes sales by going door to door every day at any time and also sells products where she works. On weekends she travels to certain places where she has a lot of customers, lends credit and collects every 8 days. She buys her merchandise in Quito and Guayaquil [Ecuador's two largest cities]. Zoila has made a living for more than 12 years in business and she loves what she does.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise, like shoes, sheets, perfumes, creams, etc. She has been a member of the communal bank since it began and likes it because of the help the loans give her.

Her goal is to have a new car.

loans.use: to buy shoes, sheets, perfumes, creams, etc.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
El señor Javier de 29  años de edad, está casado con María de 23 años de edad, quien ayuda a su  a su cónyuge en la despensa, tienen una niña de 3 años de edad.
Javier gano experiencia en el campo del comercio gracias al trabajo anterior que realizaba como vendedor  en una empresa privada. Con ayuda crediticia  se hizo de capital e invirtió y actualmente cuenta con una despensa bien surtida   lo que más vende son alimentos de la canasta familiar.
Solicita este crédito para compra de mercaderías como  harina, azúcar, aceite, pollo, carne vacuna, bebidas, lácteos, etc.
texts.en:
Javier is 29 years old. He is married to María, 23 years old, who helps him in the grocery store. They have a daughter who is 3 years old.

Javier got experience in the field of commerce through his previous job as a salesperson at a private business. With the help of a loan, he invested. He currently has a well-stocked small grocery store. The items he sells the most are basic foods items.

He is requesting this loan to buy merchandise such as flour, sugar, cooking oil, chicken, beef, drinks, dairy products, etc.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as flour, sugar, cooking oil, chicken, beef, drinks, dairy products, etc.

loans.name: Tupendane Group

texts.fr: La cliente Furaha, membre d’une association de crédit Tupendane, femme courageuse, entrepreneur, âgée d'environ 31 ans. Son mari est un militaire, malheureusement, qui l'a abandonné depuis plus de 8 ans. Elle est vendeuse de biens d’occasion (second hand) dans un petit marché noir (informel) situé dans le camp militaire Munzenze. Elle fut initiée par ses pairs en 2009 dans cette affaire. Plus tard, elle fut informée de micro crédit qu’octroi l’IMF Hekima. Les bénéfices de son activité servent d’épargne, d’alimentation et d’appui à la scolarité de ses enfants. Au cours de la période, cette cliente a vu ses affaires ralentir suite à la crise que traverse la province du Nord Kivu. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir d’acheter de chaises, matelas, de télévision à revendre. En plus, elle souhaite voir ses 4 enfants grandir confortablement et acheter une parcelle dans le futur. La cliente remercie Hekima pour les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes à faible revenu.Il sied de signaler qu’une cliente porte son bébé au dos.
texts.en:
This client, Furaha, is a member of the loan association Tupendane. A courageous woman entrepreneur, she is 31 years old. Her husband is a soldier who unfortunately abandoned her over eight years ago. She is a retailer of secondhand goods in a small informal market located in the Munzenze military camp.

Furaha was introduced by her peers to this business in 2009. Later on, she was informed about micro-loans granted by the microfinance institution Hekima. The profits from her business go toward savings, food, and supporting her children's education. Over that time, this client saw her business shrink due to the crisis which covered the northern province of Kivu.

This new loan must serve to supply her with chairs, mattresses, and televisions to resell. In addition, she would like to see her children grow up comfortably and to purchase a parcel of land in the future. 

This client thanks Hekima and its partners for their actions in supporting poor women with low incomes to become autonomous. It is appropriate to note that one client in the photo is carrying her baby on her back.

loans.use: to purchase chairs, mattresses, and televisions to sell

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Miwononvi Group

texts.fr: MIWONONVI est un groupe de quatre personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Mariam (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 37 ans et est mariée à un frigoriste du nom de Marcel. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Mariam et son mari assurent ensemble les différentes charges des enfants. Mariam n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a une quinzaine d’année que Mariam vend des sachets, des condiments et du riz à son domicile et par le système de distribution. Mariam exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Mariam s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin et au Nigéria. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement, Mariam sollicite un crédit avec les autres membres du groupe MIWONONVI. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
MIWONONVI is a group of four persons whose members reside in the same district. The group's representative, Mariam (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 37 years old and married to a refrigeration specialist named Marcel. The couple have four children, not all in school but all in their care. Mariam and her husband jointly ensure that the different family expenses are covered for the children. 

Mariam did not attend school. For nearly fifteen years, she has been selling plastic bags, condiments, and rice out of her home and via the distribution system. She does her work with passion, and this enables her to meet her needs and those of her children. She gets her supplies  from a market in Benin and from Nigeria.

Seeking to satisfy her customers and with the aim of increasing her working capital, Mariam is requesting, along with the other members of the group MIWONONVI, a loan that will be used to respond better to customer demands and to make more profit.

loans.use: to purchase plastic bags, condiments, and rice to sell out of her home

loans.name: Angela Mercedes

texts.es:
EL  Banco Comunal 8 De Mayo se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad del Valle, ciudad de clima cálido de hermosas mujeres y con una gran variedad en su gastronomía.

La señora Angela tiene 44 años de edad, está divorciada y de esta relación tuvo dos hijos de  24 y 17 años, la menor estudia en colegio y la mayor ya es profesional, ambas aun vive con ella.
 
Ella es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder salir adelante sola con sus hijas se dedica al comercio, vende productos por catalogo ya sea ropa, zapatos o productos de Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Este tipo de actividad la viene realizando desde hace mas de 10 años y  hace seis meses con los ahorros que tenia instalo una pequeña distribuidora de gaseosas y  bebidas. Trabaja todos los  días en todas sus actividades y  le va muy bien, con eso ella ha logrado salir adelante.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y gaseosas para surtir su depósito. Lleva 13 años en el Banco Comunal, es la tesorera del grupo y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy cumplidas.
 
Su sueño es tener un camión para realizar las entregas de sus productos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Eighth of May" meets every two weeks in the beautiful city of Portoviejo, the capital of the province of Manabi and known as the City of the Valley, a city with a warm climate, beautiful women, and a widely varied gastronomy.

Señora Angela is 44 years old. She is divorced, and from her marriage she has two children, ages 24 and 17. The youngest is in secondary school, and the older one has a careen. Both still live with her.

She is a housewife who, in order to obtain her own resources and use them to advance alone with her daughters, works in commerce. She sells products by catalog, such as clothing, shoes, or products from Avon or Yanbal (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for women). She has been working in this type of business for more than 10 years, and six months ago, she used her savings to set up a little distributorship for soft drinks and beverages. She works every day in all her businesses, and it is going very well for her. With this, she has succeeded in advancing.

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and soft drinks to stock her warehouse. She has been in her communal bank for 13 years. She is the treasurer of the group, and she likes it because her fellow bank members are very compliant.

Her dream is to have a truck to make the deliveries of her products.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and soft drinks

loans.name: Jonal

texts.en: Jonal is 33 years old, married and blessed with two children. For his family's living, he built up his own business. He has a stand in the market where he sells plastic wares. He also works as a photographer as an additional source of income. He has been operating his plastic sales business for eight years.  Now, he is requesting PHP 5,000 to buy plastic wares and equipment for photo developing. He hopes that through this loan, he will be able to increase his sales because he wishes to save for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy plastic wares and equipment for photo developing

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gbenonkpo Group

texts.fr: GBENONKPO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies. La représentante du groupe, Lucienne (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 35 ans et est mariée à un forgeron du nom de Marcellin. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont aucun scolarisé, et un reste à leur charge. Lucienne et son mari vivent ensemble avec leur enfant. Lucienne n’a pas fréquenté. Il y a près de six ans que Lucienne mène comme activité la vente des bouteilles vides dans un marché du Bénin. Lucienne s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Lucienne sollicite un cinquième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe GBENONKPO. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
GBENONKPO is a group of three persons whose members are friends. The group's representative, Lucienne (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 35 years old and married to a blacksmith named Marcellin. The couple have four children, none in school, but one remains in their care. Mariam and her husband live together  with their child. 

Lucienne did not attend school. For nearly six years, she has been selling empty bottles at a market in Benin. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin.

Seeking to satisfy her customers, Lucienne is requesting, along with the other members of the group GBENONKPO, a fifth loan that will be used to respond better to customer demands and to make more profit. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase empty bottles to sell

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina “Santa Lucia” cuenta con 19  integrantes,  se encuentra  en el Segundo Ciclo, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas, solidarias  y responsables, todas ellas se dedican a actividades diferentes. Las integrantes se encuentran muy comprometidas con el programa de la Fundación Paraguay ya que han empezado a ver los resultados.
La señora Silvia se dedica al corte y  confección de ropas. La señora gracias a su creatividad y talento ha podido restaurar las ropas dañadas y también a crear ropas como vestidos, pantalones, chalecos, etc. 
El crédito solicitado sería para comprar mayor cantidad de insumos como telas, hilos, tijeras, alfileres, revistas con diseños, y demás materiales que le ayuden a crecer como profesional.
texts.en:
The committee called “Santa Lucia” (Saint Lucia) consists of 19 members that are in the second cycle. This group is known in the neighborhood for being very united, supportive and responsible. The members work in different activities. The members are dedicated to the program of the “Fundacion Paraguay” (Paraguay Foundation) now that they have begun to see results.

Silvia works as a dressmaker. Thanks to her creativity and talent she has been able to restore damaged clothes. She is able to create clothes such as dresses, pants, vests, etc.  The loan requested is to buy a greater amount of supplies such as fabrics, thread, scissors, pins, pattern magazines, and other materials to grow professionally.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fabrics, thread, scissors, pins, fashion magazines, etc

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El señor Francisco de 31 años de edad, está casado con la señora Norma de 28 años de edad, ella es ama de casa, se encarga del cuidado de sus dos hijos, una niña de 2 años y un niño de  6 años. Francisco es experto en  trabajos sobre vidrio,  realiza colocaciones de vidrio en puertas y ventanas, espejos trabajos artesanales sobre vidrio y otros.
Empezó trabajando para terceros, aprendió el oficio con los años, ahora posee mucha experiencia, un día se animo y emprendió el trabajo por su cuenta.
La Fundación Paraguaya le otorgo crédito para la compra de algunos activos fijos, y en esta  la ocasión solicita un nuevo crédito para la compra de vidrios templados, espejos y otros para realizar trabajos varios, y cumplir varios pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
Francisco is 31 years old and married to Norma, who's 28 years old. She's a homemaker and takes care of their two children, a 2-year-old daughter and a 6-year-old son. Francisco is an expert in glasswork. He provides services of placing glass on doors and windows, mirrors, glass craftwork, etc.
He started out by working for other people and learned the business through the years, and now he has a lot of experience. One day he summoned up the courage to begin working for himself.
The Fundación Paraguaya provided a loan for him to buy some fixed assets. On this occasion he requests a new loan in order to purchase tempered glass, mirrors, etc., so that he can do various works and meet several pending orders.

loans.use: to purchase tempered glass, mirrors, etc.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Valentina; la socia pertenece al banco comunal SAN RAFAEL,la socia continua con su negocio de llamadas telefonicas ,la socia trabaja de forma ambulatoria por el centro de la ciudad,la socia ofrece llamadas nacionales y locales para los clientes que le soliciten,la socia trabaja todos los dias desde las 08:00am hasta las 07:00pm ,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para comprar un nuevo equipo de celular.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This communal bank member is Señora Valentina. She belongs to the communal bank "San Rafael." She continues to work in her telephone call service. She works as a walking vendor through the center of the city. She offers national and local calls for the customers who come to her. She works every day from 8 am to 7 pm. She is a responsible and tenacious person, since this is the way she is raising her family.

She is applying for the loan to buy a new cell phone.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy a new cell phone.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is from Gata Diot, Clarin. She is 29 years old. Florence is married and has one child. To make a living, Florence has been managing a transportation service business for 4 years and earns 15,000 a month for this activity. Florence is requesting a loan of 24,000 which will be used to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories. In 2007, Florence joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Hudna

texts.en: Hudna is a 58 years old married woman. Her husband is a teacher while she has a clothing sale shop. By helping each other they were able to send their kids to schools and improve their living conditions. Now Hudna wants to work on expanding her business by first getting a new collection of clothes and later maybe opening another shop or starting to distribute the clothes she has into other markets. For that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to get a new collection of clothes

loans.name: Tatiana Estefania

texts.es:
TATIANA 22 AÑOS ES SOLTERA TIENE UNA HIJA DE 6 AÑOS VIVE CON LOS PADRES QUIENES SON LOS QUE LE AYUDAN CON EL CUIDADO DE LA NIÑA VIVE EN CHIMBO.

SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE PERFUMES, MAQUILLAJES Y BISUTERIA EL DINERO LO NECESITA PARA INVERTIR EN PRODUCTOS COMO PERFUMES LABIALES, ESMALTES RIMEL PARA EL NEGOCIO Y TAMBIEN LIBROS PARA LA UNIVERSIDAD.

EL SUEÑO DE TATIANA ES QUE SU NEGOCIO CREZACA Y QUE TERMINE SU CARRERA UNIVERSITARIA.

EN LOS TIEMPOS LIBRES SE DEDICA A LA HIJA Y A VENDAR LOS PRODUCTOS
texts.en:
