22-year-old Tatiana is single and has a 6-year-old daughter. She lives with her parents, who help her take care of her little girl. She lives in Chimbo.
She sells perfumes, makeup and costume jewelry. She needs the loan in order to invest it in perfume, lipstick, nail polish and mascara for her business. She will also purchase books for college.
Tatiana's dream is to have her business grow and to complete her college studies.
Her free time is dedicated to her daughter and to selling her merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase perfume, lipstick, nail polish and mascara.

loans.name: Maria Elisa

texts.es:
MARIA ELISA tiene 63 años de edad es soltera tiene una hija, vive con la hija en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC 30 DE JULIO, se encuentra ubicada en Recinto Zapotal nuevo, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

MARIA ELISA  se dedica  a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, además se dedica a la crianza de pollos. Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, urea, abonos, líquido mata monte, insecticidas.

Las compras y las ventas de los productos las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas cada 20 días. Con La ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los insumos.

Enfrenta desafíos cómo las plagas el cogollero y lancha que caen en los cultivos. El sueño es tener éxito en la vida. En el tiempo libre le gusta cosinar.
texts.en:
Maria Elisa, 63, is single and has one daughter. She lives with her daughter in the city of Ventanas in the province of Los Rios. She is a member of the lending club 30 de Julio [July 30th], located in Zapotal Nuevo in the canton of Ventanas. They work in agriculture. 

Maria Elisa is a farmer, planting corn and raising chickens. She asks for a loan to buy fertilizers, urea, compost, liquid weed killer and insecticides. She makes purchases and sells her products in the city of Ventanas every 20 days. The loan will help her to buy these inputs.

She faces challenges like army worms and frost that befall her crops. Her dream is to be successful in life. In her free time she likes to cook.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, urea, compost, liquid weed killer and insecticides.

loans.name: Darwin Mighail

texts.es:
El socio Darwin Mighail tiene 20 años de edad y es soltero,el socio estudia la carrera profesional de odontologia y en sus tiempos libres trabaja en un consultorio como ayundante odontologo,el socio le gusta la carrera que esta estudiando y su sueño es terminar de estudiar y poder abrir su propio consultorio dental.El socio soliciat el credito para comprar materiales dentales como macillas y herramientas dentales.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Communal bank member Darwin Mighail is 20 years old and is single. He is studying for a professional career in dentistry, and in his free time he works in a clinic as a dental assistant. He likes the career he is studying for, and his dream is to finish his studies and be able to open his own dental clinic. He is applying for the loan to buy dental materials such as filling material and dental tools.

He is happy about the loan and promises to make his payments.

loans.use: to buy dental materials such as filling material and dental tools

loans.name: Gordana

texts.en:
Gordana is a married woman who has 3 children between the ages of sixteen and twenty-one years old. She lives with her family in a Serbian community in Kosovo. Nine years ago she began to run her own boutique. She started with a small store selling clothes, has been able to expand since then, and is planning to expand it further. She sells different types of clothing for people with different tastes and styles. She is usually open Monday through Saturday from 7:00am until 6:00pm. However, she extends her schedule when needed to accommodate customer needs. 

Gordana is requesting a loan in order to buy a larger variety of clothing for the upcoming autumn and winter seasons and expand her collection to meet customer needs. She is also contemplating adding different styles of clothing in order to increase her income and customer base. She hoopes to expand her business and own a big boutique shop in the future. 
Her goal is to save money to ensure a better education for her children. 
Gordana is very thankful for this help and appreciates KIVA lenders!

loans.use: To buy a larger variety of clothes

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 61 years old, married, and had five children. She is a fruit and vegetables vendor at the public market. She usually gains about PHP 5,000 and it goes for meals and bills at home. 

She is now asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy more mangoes and bananas to sell. Someday, with profitable income, she will achieve a prosperous life for her family. She hopes to save funds to use in times of emergency.

loans.use: to buy mangoes and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida lives at Pinopoc with her family and there manages her food selling business. She sells fruits and vegetables to the people in her village. She buys her merchandise at the public market and resells it at their village for profit. 

She is asking for additional capital of PHP 12,000 because she has an insufficient fund now to increase her merchandise. From her loan, she will buy mangoes, bananas, eggplant, and cabbages to sell. 

Zenaida is now 54 years old, married, and has five children. She hopes to make her business more profitable to pay school fees of her two children who are currently attending school.

She will be very happy to see them become professionals someday.

loans.use: to buy mangoes, bananas, eggplant, and cabbages to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 41 years old, married, and has four children. To earn a living, he runs a motorbike transport business. He has been in the business for three years.  

Through Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save his money because he has been trained in financial management. This has helped him to invest in his business.

John hopes to own many motorbikes for his transport business in the future. He has requested 20,000 KES to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to buy another motorbike.

loans.name: Goran

texts.en:
Goran lives in a Serbian community in Kosovo. He is married and has two children who are 5 and 7 years old. Currently, only one, the 7 year old, attends school. His wife works as a nurse. Three years ago, Goran started his own business cleaning and washing buildings and homes.  In the beginning, he started with a small amount of equipment, which was sufficient for the services he was providing. Now he has managed to achieve a higher level and cleans apartments, offices, and other buildings depending on the needs of the customer. 

Although he lives in a Serbian community, he also provides work for the Albanians, Roma, and other communities throughout Kosovo. He is in need of a loan to pay for the registration and repair of his vehicle used primarily as work related transportation. With this transportation he will be able to improve the speed and ease at which he can obtain and complete work as demands for his services increase. His goal is to expand his business in the future and raise the number of employees who will work for him. 

He is very happy for this support!

loans.use: to register and repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Virgen De Fátima Group

texts.es:
Actualmente el comité está integrado por 12 señora de la misma zona. Los integrantes del comité son muy unidos, responsables y solidarios, manifestaron que tienen muchas ganas de trabajar y salir adelante, tanto con el grupo e individualmente. El Comité de mujeres Virgen de Fátima está realizará actividades de manera grupal, para que puedan tener un fondo común y así tener un respaldo económico para distintas situaciones que se presenten dentro del grupo.
La sra. María, una de las integrantes del comité, es comerciante, tiene un pequeño negocio con el cual ayuda a su familia en la canasta familiar. Su deseo es poder ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a su clientela y poder generrar para provecho propio y el de su familia mayores ingresos económicos.
El crédito solicitado sería para la compra de productos como: frutas, verduras, hortalizas, panificados, lácteos, etc.
texts.en:
Currently the committee is composed of 12 women from the same area. The members of the committee are very united, responsible, and supportive. The group expressed a strong the desire to work hard and get ahead, as a group and individually. The women of the “Virgen de Fatima” (Virign of Fatima) committee will works as a team in order to have a communal fund for economic relief when different situations occur. 

Maria, one of the members, is a merchant and has a small business with which she contributes to her family with basic necessities.  Her dream is to be able to offer a greater variety of products to her customers and therefore earn for herself and family a greater income. The loan requested is to purchase products such as: fruit, vegetables, baked goods, milk, etc.

loans.use: to purchase products such as: fruit, vegetables, baked goods, milk, etc.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
La Sra. Edith,la socia continua con su negocio de cafetin ,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio,la socia a la vez continua trabajando en una institucion privada,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando economicamente a su hija. 

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de insumos para su negocio de cafetin como leche y azucar.

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
The member Edith continues to run her small cafe. She has been in this business for a long time, and it's going well thanks to the hard work she does. The member also continues to work for a private company. She's a responsible and hardworking person, and that's how she gets her family ahead. The member wishes to keep on working, so that she can continue to support her daughter financially.
She requests the loan in order to purchase supplies for her small cafe business, such as milk and sugar.
The member appreciates and gives thanks for the loan she received, and she pledges to make her repayments in a disciplined fashion.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her small cafe business, such as milk and sugar.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a hardworking businessman. He supplies bread to retail shops and cafeterias to earn a living.  He has been in this business for 10 years.  His desire is to grow his clientele. Samuel also farms to earn more income. 

Samuel has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to buy bread.

loans.use: to buy bread.

loans.name: Kionzo

texts.en:
Kionzo lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He owns a spare parts shop that he has been operating for 1 year now.

Kionzo learnt about Milango through a friend who invited him to the group and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are customers not paying on time, price fluctuation and inflation, and taxes.

Kionzo is applying for a loan of 73,050 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock motorcycle spare parts. His extra income will be added to his savings. He aspires to expand and open other spare parts shop and be a supplier of spare parts.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 32 years old and from Nakuru. She is married with four children who are all in school. She has been in the transport business with good income.

Agnes has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy spare parts for her lorry. The lorry is being used to transport goods for her customers. She is optimistic that her business will do well after the loan.

She hopes to buy another lorry in the near future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her lorry.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 50 years old and married, but unfortunately does not have her own child. But despite that, she needs to earn for herself and her husband. 

She engaged herself in a business where she sells vegetables. She does it daily and earns an amount of PHP 200 a day. She uses this to buy their everyday needs such as rice, spices, and viands. 

Now she is asking for a loan amount of PHP 12,000 to buy additional vegetables to sell such as eggplant, cabbage, and squash and also vegetable seeds to plant by her husband in their backyard. She hopes she could now earn higher than her standard income.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell such as eggplant, cabbage, and squash and also vegetable seeds to plant.

loans.name: Zaid

texts.en:
Zaid is a 20-year-old single man. He is one of five siblings living together with their parents. He attends the university to get a BA degree in Banking Services and Finance. 

Ziad has applied for this loan to register for the next semester and start his third year.

loans.use: to register for the next semester.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 41-year-old married man. He is the father of 5 children. To be able to support his family, he opened a shop selling and repairing computers. 

Khaled has applied for a loan to expand the shop to include a section for mobiles and their accessories.

loans.use: to expand the shop.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: El señor Miguel y la señora Roxana  son una familia con cuatro hijos el señor se dedica al servicio de transporte trabajando en una línea de taxitrufis de la ruta de la zona del barrio fortaleza esto queda en la zona sur de la ciudad zona donde ellos viven que esta a 15 minutos de la ciudad él trabaja desde hace 10 años en la zona y en este rubro los gastos de sus cuatros hijos hacen que la situación sea difícil de sobre llevar lo cual provoca que apenas se gane el pan del día a día  para poder vivir pero en condiciones no muy normales, el señor miguel necesita dinero para que pueda arreglar su vehículo ya que esta un poco mal y deteriorado y con lo que gana apenas le alcanza para comer y al mejorarse vehículo podrá arregla su calidad de vida
texts.en:
Miguel and Roxana are a family with four children. Miguel works in the transportation business, working for a taxi company.  His taxi route operates in the Fortaeza neighborhood. This area is located in the southern side of the city. This is fifteen minutes from where they live. He has worked in this area and this line of work for the past 10 years. The expenses generated by supporting his four children make the financial situation very difficult. He can only make enough money to buy daily bread, but not much else.  

Miguel needs money to repair his taxi, which is in bad shape and deteriorated. The money he earns is barely sufficient to feed his family. with a repaired vehicle he will be able to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: repairs to his taxi

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad is 51 years old and married with five children.

Caridad is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Caridad requested a 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Caridad has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF and, more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 48 years old and is married to Margaret. They are blessed with 4 children. Patrick runs a malimali business that exchanges new household items for old clothes, shoes, etc. in Tala. He has been in this business for the last 5 years and gets an income of 15,000 KES per month.

Patrick has a good credit history with KADET LTD. where he is applying for his fourth loan of 80,000 KES, which he wants to use to buy the malimali materials like utensils, basins, jugs, buckets, and thermos to exchange. He will use the extra profit to educate his children.

He hopes to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more household items like utensils, basins, jugs, buckets, and thermos to exchange.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora, es una mujer luchadora y fuerte, está casada con Jorge, con quien tiene cuatro hijos, pero ahora sólo vive con uno de ellos: Jorge Luis, a quien cuida con mucho amor en la casa que compró hace 30 años. 
Su especialidad es la siembra de papa, aprendió desde niña que en la altura, donde quedan sus terrenos agrícolas, la tierra produce muy bien. Todo el día, desde muy temprano, se alista para caminar media hora hasta sus terrenos, allí cuida de sus siembras, fertilizando y manteniendo alejada a las plagas y maleza. A pesar de tener inconvenientes con la vista, Teodora es una mujer luchadora, esa fuerza le otorga el ánimo para seguir en la agricultura, pues como ella dice hay temporadas en las que baja el precio en el mercado y no se obtiene las ganancias requeridas. Sus productos: papa, habas, maíz y alverja, los comercializa en la ciudad cercana o en la capital del país. Ahora ella desea juntar el capital necesario para poder comprar sus propios terrenos agrícolas, pues los que tiene ahora los alquila.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Central Checche” y este es su crédito número 9 con MFP, por lo que espera continuar con este apoyo financiero, pues gusta de trabajar en su asociación, donde cada día aprende nuevas cosas sobre su negocio. Asimismo, promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Teodora invertirá este dinero en la compra de fertilizantes naturales y guano de isla, para esparcir entre sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Teodora is a strong and determined woman. She is married to Jorge, with whom she has four children. But now she only lives with one of them: Jorge Luis, whom she takes care of with much love, in the house she bought 30 years ago. 

Her specialty is growing potatoes. From an early age she learned that in the highlands, where her farmland is located, the land produces very well.  

Very early each day, she gets ready to walk half an hour to her land. There she looks after her crops, fertilizing them, and keeping them free of pests and weeds.  

Despite having problems with her vision, Teodora is a determined woman. That strength grants her the courage to keep on farming, since as she says, there are seasons when the market price goes down, and the needed profits are not obtained. 

Her products: potatoes, lima beans, corn and peas, she sells in the nearby city or in the country's capital. Now she wishes to raise the necessary capital to be able to buy her own farmland, as what she has now she rents. 

She belongs to the “Central Checche” solidarity group, and this is her ninth loan with MFP, so she hopes to continue with this financial support. She likes working in her group, where each day she learns new things about her business. As well, she promises to make her instalment payments on time. 

Teodora will use this money to buy natural fertilizers and island guano to scatter among her plantings.

loans.use: To buy natural fertilizers and island guano to scatter among her plantings.

loans.name: Petra Del Rocio

texts.es:
PETRA DEL ROCIO tiene 43 años de edad es soltera tiene un hijo, vive con el hijo en la ciudad de Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC 30 DE JULIO, se encuentra ubicada en Recinto Zapotal nuevo, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

PETRA DEL ROCIO  se dedica  a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz, fréjol y maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, fertilizantes urea, abonos, líquido mata monte.

Las compras y las ventas de los productos las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas. Con La ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los insumos agrícolas y hacer crecer los cultivos.

Enfrenta desafíos cómo las plagas y lancha que caen en los cultivos. El sueño es tener éxito en el trabajo. En el tiempo libre le gusta ir a la iglesia
texts.en:
Petra del Rocio, 43, is single and has a son. They live in the city of Ventanas in the province of Los Rios. She is a member of the lending club 30 de Julio [July 30th] in the area of Zapotal Nuevo in the canton of Ventanas. The members of the club work in agriculture.

Petra del Rocio is a farmer who plants rice, beans and corn. She asks for a loan to buy inputs like fertilizers, urea, compost, and liquid weed killer. She will make her purchases and sell her products in the city of Ventanas. With the help of the loan she will be able to buy agricultural inputs and grow her crops. 

She faces challenges like pests and frost that befall her crops. Her dream is to be successful. In her free time she likes to go to church.

loans.use: to buy inputs like fertilizers, urea, compost and liquid weed killer.

loans.name: Noemi Luz

texts.es:
La socia Noemi pertenece al banco comunal SAN RAFAEL,la socia continua con su negocio de ferreteria ,la socia lleva años en este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio ,su negocio esta ubicado en su mismo domicilio,la socia trabaja de lunes a sabado durante el dia,la socia vende lo que son pinturas,cemento entre otros,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de mercaderia como cemento y herramientas.

La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Noemi is part of the San Rafael village bank. She continues running her hardware store, a business that she has had for some years. It's going well thanks to her dedication. Her business is located in her home and she works during the day from Monday to Saturday. She sells paints, cement and other things. She is responsible and dedicated because this is how she gets her family ahead.

She asks for a loan to buy merchandise like cement and tools. She is grateful for the loan and promises to make the established payments.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like cement and tools.

loans.name: Byambadolgor

texts.en:
Mrs. Byambadolgor lives with four children and a niece in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband passed away many years ago. Her oldest daughter, Dejidmaa, is 21 years old; her oldest son, Hanchandmanai, is 19 years old; her younger son, Natsagdorj, is 15 years old; and her younger daughter, lhagwa, is 14 years old. 

She started her business in 2002 by making felt and wool art, and at that time, her turnover capital was equal to 100,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT). Now, she produces felt slippers, felt underlining and blankets in a rented  room. She already has many regular clients. In a few months, the cold will come, and she has a lot of orders for felt underlining and blankets. She needs 2,000,000 MNT to purchase raw materials for her business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for making felt underlining and blankets.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 57 years old, married and lives with her three children in Capucao, Ozamis City. For over 20 years, she has earned about 13,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month by farming. 

In 2010, she joined GDMPC. She is requesting loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Neida Betzabeth

texts.es:
EL  Banco Comunal San Gregorio se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad del Valle, ciudad de clima cálido de hermosas mujeres y con una gran variedad en su gastronomía.

En este lugar vive la señora Neida, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 4 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun  viven en su casa. Su esposo se dedica al comercio.

Ella es una mujer muy luchadora que para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, vende productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). También en sociedad con uno de los hijos tiene un negocio de venta de repuestos automotrices en su casa, lugar donde además su hijo también tiene un taller de mecánica automotriz con lo cual sus ventas son muy buenas ya que los clientes de su hijo también le compra allí mismo algún repuesto que necesiten, ellos llevan más de 8 años con este negocio y les va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y repuestos para carros. Lleva más de 4 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brinda el banco.
 
Su meta es seguir adelante en sus negocios.
texts.en:
The communal bank San Gregorio meets every fifteen days in the beautiful city of Portoviejo, capital of the province of Manabi, which is known as the City of the Valley. The city has a warm climate, lovely women, and a great variety of cuisine. 

Neida lives in Portoviejo. She is 45 years old, married, and has four children all of whom are older and two of which live at home. Her spouse makes a living in business. 

Neida is a strong woman, and in order to help her husband with household expenses, she makes a living in business by selling Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories for women). Also, in partnership with one of her children, she has a business in the sale of automotive spare parts out of her house. The sales are good because her son also has a car repair shop in the house, and his clients buy whatever part they need from her. They have been in this business for more than 8 years and it is going very well. 

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and spare parts for cars. Neida has been with the communal bank for more than four years and likes it because of the help the bank offers. 

Her goal is to continue growing her businesses.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and spare parts for cars

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 42 years old and married, with six children.

To earn a living, Delia has engaged in selling of kakanin and malagkit in the village. Her business serves as a source of income for the family and helps provide their daily needs.  

She wants to expand her business to other villages to satisfy her family's needs, but she has insufficient capital. Therefore, she is taking out a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy malagkit rice, sugar, milk, and coconut milk. 

She wishes to make a variety of kakanin through this loan to increase her proceeds. She believes she can save funds through her loan and hard work.

loans.use: to buy malagkit rice, sugar, milk, and coconut milk

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 44 años, está casada con Demetrio, con quien tiene cinco hijos, pero ahora sólo vive con dos de ellos: Rosmery y Melisa, a quienes cuida en la casa que compró hace 25 años.
Gracias a la herencia de sus padres logró obtener los terrenos agrícolas donde ahora siembra papa, habas y alverja, los que cuida con mucho esmero; “si no se fertiliza y extrae la maleza que crece entre los surcos, podemos tener unos productos de mala calidad y no recuperaríamos lo invertido”, comenta. Es por esta razón que María dedica mucho tiempo en el cuidado. Asimismo, cría vacas, de las que extrae varios litros de leche que comercializa a una procesadora reconocida y con el dinero que recibe día a día puede solventar los gastos del hogar y tener un capital fijo para la agricultura.   

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Central Checche” y este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que espera continuar con este apoyo financiero, pues gusta de trabajar en su asociación, donde cada día aprende nuevas cosas sobre su negocio. Asimismo, promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
María invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus sembríos de papa.
texts.en:
María is 44, and married to Demetrio, with whom she has five children. But now she only lives with two of them: Rosmery and Melisa, whom she takes care of in the house she bought 25 years ago.

Thanks to her parents' legacy, she managed to obtain the farmland where she now grows potatoes, lima beans and peas, which she looks after with much care.

"If we don't fertilize, and take out weeds that grow among the furrows, we can have poor quality crops, and we would not recover our investment," she says.

That is why María devotes a great deal of time to looking after her crops. As well, she raises cows, from which she obtains several litres of milk that she sells to a well-known processing company. With the money she gets, she is able to meet the household expenses and have a regular source of working capital for farming.  

She belongs to the “Central Checche” solidarity group, and this is her first loan with MFP, so she hopes to continue with this financial support. She likes working in her group, where each day she learns new things about her business. As well, she promises to make her instalment payments on time. 

María will use the money to buy natural fertilizers to scatter among her potato plantings.

loans.use: To buy natural fertilizers to scatter among her potato plantings.

loans.name: Verónica Audeya

texts.es:
EL  Banco Comunal San Gregorio se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad del Valle, ciudad de clima cálido de hermosas mujeres y con una gran variedad en su gastronomía.

En este lugar vive la señora Verónica, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos, tres de ellos ya  mayores de edad y la menor tiene 9 años,  dos de ellos  estudian en universidad y una en escuela. Su esposo se dedica al comercio.

Ella es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y de productos de Lebel y Esika (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y  trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al dia,  deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 8 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son los perfumes y cosméticos ya que son muy buenos.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa de todo tipo,  perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. 

Su sueño es tener una boutique.
texts.en:
The communal bank San Gregorio meets every fifteen days in the beautiful city of Portoviejo, the capital of the province of Manabi, which is known as the City of the Valley. The city has a warm climate, lovely women, and a great variety of cuisine. 

Verónica lives in Portoviejo. She is 42 years old, married, and has four children. Three of her children are older and the youngest is 9 years old. Two are studying in university and one at primary school. Her husband makes a living in business. 

Verónica is a housewife who - in order to have her own resources and with them the ability to help her husband with the household expenses - makes a living selling clothing of all kinds and Lebel and Esika products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories for women. She makes sales by going door to door three days a week for two or three hours a day. She sells her products on credit and collects payment every eight days. She has been making a living this way for the last 8 years and it is going very well. Her best-selling products are perfumes and cosmetics because they are very good. 

This loan will be used to by clothing of all kinds, perfumes, creams and cosmetics. Verónica has been with the communal bank since it began, and likes it because the payments are easy to make. 

Her dream is to have her own boutique.

loans.use: to buy clothing, perfumes, creams and cosmetics

loans.name: Yeris Del Carmen

texts.es:
El Sauce está ubicado a 90 km del departamento de León, es un bello pueblo rodeado de montañas florecidas y ríos caudalosos, se caracteriza por tener hermosas mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras, como es el caso de doña Yeris, una señora de 39 años, casada, que se dedica al pequeño comercio.

Inició su negocio hace 6 años, el cual consiste en la venta de Fritanga, la fritanga es una especie de comida rápida que se vende solo por las noches como son los tacos, enchiladas, carne asada, maduro con queso, tajadas, donde la mayoría de las personas tienen la costumbre de adquirirla para la cena, este negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación.

Está solicitando este crédito para compra sillas y mesas, carne de cerdo, plátanos verdes, plátanos maduros, queso, aceite, frijoles, arroz y carbón con el fin de brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes y se sientan a gusto, además de satisfacer la demanda de los mismos.

Agradece a KIVA y Ceprodel por el apoyo con estos pequeños créditos que ayudan a mejorar las condiciones de vida de muchas familias de escasos recursos y que sin ello no se pudieran cumplir muchos sueños.
texts.en:
El Sauce is located 90km from the state of Leon. It's a pretty town surrounded by lush mountains and mighty rivers. It is known for beautiful women who are hardworking and entrepreneurial, like Yeris. 

Yeris is 39, married and has a small business. She started her business 6 years ago selling "frittanga". Frittanga is a type of fast food only sold at night, like tacos, enchiladas, grilled meat, plantains with cheese, and plantain chips. Most people come for dinner. Her business is located in her home.

She is asking for a loan to buy seats and tables, pork, green and ripe plantains, cheese, oil, beans, rice and charcoal so that she can give her customers better service by pleasing their palates and meeting their demand.

She thanks Kiva and Ceprodel for the support. With these small loans many families of limited resources are able to improve their living conditions. Without it, they would not be able to achieve many of their dreams.

loans.use: to buy seats and tables, pork, green and ripe plantains, cheese, oil, beans, rice and charcoal.

loans.name: Reagan

texts.en:
Reagan is 26 years old and single. He operates a video showing business. He has been in the business for the past year.  He gets a monthly income of KES 15,000.


This is his first business loan in KADET LTD. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.  He will use the loan amount to build a structure that  he will use as a cinema hall.

He hopes to open another branch and start a family.

loans.use: to build a structure that he will use as a cinema hall.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 44- year-old married man and a father of five children.  

He is supporting his family from his only source of income, which is his coffee kiosk. Now he want to improve the service he provides by adding new types of hot drinks other than coffee.  For that, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To add new types of hot drinks.

loans.name: Xiomara Janeth

texts.es: Xiomara es originaria de Estelí, tiene 30 años de edad, soltera, actualmente cursa su ultimo año de  estudios universitarios. Ella es comerciante, inicio su propio negocio de pulpería hace 3 años, con dinero que obtuvo de su antiguo trabajo, decidió ahorrar y los invirtió en su negocio ubicado en su casa de habitación, con mucha dedicación  lo atiende todos los días sin ningún tipo de apoyo familiar. Xiomara esta solicitando este crédito para compra de azúcar, aceite, frijoles, cosméticos y ropa interior. Al obtener este préstamo sus ventas aumentaran ya que podrá ofertar más productos a sus clientes dejando esto como resultado buenos ingresos. En sus planes futuros esta ampliar su negocio tanto en inventario como en el local para hacer de el  una distribuidora donde pueda abastecer la mayor parte de  la comunidad para poder cumplir el sueño de tener una casa de su propiedad.
texts.en:
Xiomara is a native of Estelí.  She's 30 years old and single.  Currently she is in her final year of her university studies.

She's a merchant.  She started her local store business three years ago with money she got from her previous job.  She decided to save and she invested it in her business, located in her home.  With a lot of dedication she tends her store every day without any type of help from her family.

Xiomara is requesting this loan to buy sugar, oil, beans, cosmetics, and underwear.  Her sales will go up when she gets the loan because she'll be able to offer her customers more products, which will give her a good income.

Among her future plans is expanding her business in both inventory and her store, to make it a distributor where she can supply the majority of the community, so she can achieve her dream of having her own house.

loans.use: to buy sugar, oil, beans, cosmetics, and underwear

loans.name: Flavio

texts.es:
El socio Flavio tiene 62 años de edad,es casada y tiene 3 hijos,el socio se dedica al negocio de venta de libros,el socio vende libros en forma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.,m y tambien tiene una tienda de abarrotes que junto con su esposa atienden este negocio,el socio ya tiene 4 años en el negocio de venta de libros y 10 años en el negocio de tienda de abarrotes,el sueño del socio es tener un local donde pueda vender los libros.El socio solicita el credito para comprar libros al por mayor.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Flavio is 62 years old and married with 3 children. He has a business as an ambulatory vendor selling books from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m., and he also has a grocery store; he runs this business together with his wife. He has had his book vendor business for 4 years, and the grocery store for 10 years. His dream is to have a store where he can sell the books. He is requesting a loan in order to purchase books wholesale. 

He is glad for the loan and is committed to paying the installments on time.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale books.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is married with two kids. She is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. Marissa is a farmer, and she grows coconuts to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years, and every month she earns 4,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) from this work. 

She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Marissa became a member of GDMPC just this year. In the future, Marissa hopes to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Gloris

texts.es:
Gloris tiene 55 años, vive en compañía de dos de sus tres hijos, en una casa que alquila desde hace 2 años. 
Ella se siente muy feliz por su trabajo, pues le permite dedicar tiempo a su familia, sobre todo de su futuro nieto, quien muy pronto llegará a darle alegría. Hace muchos años adquirió una casa muy amplia donde vivió un tiempo muy corto, posteriormente decidió alquilar las habitaciones, sobre todo a estudiantes de la universidad. Para cuidar de ello viaja dos veces al año, pues no puede permanecer mucho tiempo en la ciudad, ya que tiene que cuidar de sus hijos. Como es una mujer inteligente realizó un sistema para que sus inquilinos paguen la mensualidad por medio de giros bancarios. Ahora se encuentra deteriorado el cerco de su casa, por lo que está pensando en cambiarlo por completo, pues lo que más le importa a Gloris es mantener a gusto a sus inquilinos. 

Este es su octavo crédito con MFP y durante todo este tiempo, logró avanzar en su negocio y adquirir ganancias para el futuro de sus hijos. Por esa razón promete ser puntual en sus cuotas, pues le agrada ser parte de su grupo.
Gloris invertirá este dinero en la compra de tablas por millares para el cerco de su casa, donde alquila las habitaciones, en la ciudad.
texts.en:
Gloris is 55 years old and lives with two of her three children in a house that she has been renting for 2 years.

She is very happy with her work as it allows her to dedicate time to her family, above all to her future grandson who will be born very soon and bring her joy. Many years ago she had a very spacious house where she lived for a short time. Later she decided to rent out rooms mainly to university students and to take care of it she travels twice a year. She cannot stay in the city for a very long time as she has to take care of her children. She is an intelligent woman who made a system so that her tenants pay the monthly rent by wire transfer. Now she finds that the fence of her house is deteriorated in which she is thinking of completely changing it. What is most important to Gloria is to make her tenants comfortable.

This is Gloris’s eighth loan with MFP and during this whole time she has made progress in her business and earned a profit for her children’s future. For this reason she promises to be punctual in her payments as she is pleased to be a part of this group.

Gloris will invest this money in the purchase of planks in units of one thounsand for a fence for her house in the city where she rents out rooms.

loans.use: to buy planks in units of one thounsand for a fence for her house in the city where she rents out rooms.

loans.name: Donatilda

texts.es:
Donatilda tiene 46 años, es una mujer que se esfuerza mucho por darles lo mejor a sus tres hijos, ya que es madre soltera. Su casa es propia, la compró gracias a su trabajo y ahorros de muchos años.
Ella se dedica a la venta de comestibles en la tienda que acondicionó en su vivienda hace 8 años, comenta que lo que más le gusta son las relaciones amistosas que entabla con sus clientes. Por otro lado, es un negocio rentable, ya que siempre tiene ingresos. Su mayor anhelo es que sus hijos sean profesionales para ello se esmera en seguir con su trabajo para poder pagar sus estudios universitarios.

Este es su crédito número 12 con MFP y sabe que tiene la responsabilidad de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesto a hacerlo, como anteriormente. En su banco comunal siempre está al tanto de todos los acuerdos a los que llegan, pues es muy participativo y responsable.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles de este préstamo comprará un saco de arroz y otro de azúcar, así como algunas conservas, leche en tarro, bebidas, verduras, para abastecer su tienda.
texts.en:
Donatilda, 46, is a woman who works hard to give her three kids the best, since she is a single mother. Thanks to many years of hard work and saving, she owns her own home.

She sells food in a store that she arranged in her home 8 years ago. She tells us that what she likes most is the friendly relationships that she has with her customers. It's also a profitable business and she always has income. Her biggest desire is for her children to be professionals, which is why she continues doing her best at her job so she can pay for them to go to college.

This is her 12th loan with MFP and she knows that she is responsible for making her payments on time, and is ready to do so as she did before. She always is aware of the agreements that her village bank comes to because she participates a lot and is responsible. With the 1000 nuevos soles from this loan she will buy a sack of rice and another of sugar, along with preserves, canned milk, drinks and vegetables to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy a sack of rice and one of sugar, along with preserves, canned milk, drinks and vegetables to stock her store.

loans.name: Carmen Marisol

texts.es:
EL  Banco Comunal San Gregorio se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad del Valle, ciudad de clima cálido de hermosas mujeres y con una gran variedad en su gastronomía.

En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene 39 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tienen tres hijos, una mayor y dos de 16 y 13 años de edad, la mayor estudia en Universidad y los dos menores en el colegio. El marido es chofer.

Ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida en su casa, en las mañanas vende el delicioso encebollado y ceviches de pescado además de  otros platos deliciosos hechos con mariscos, por las tardes vende meriendas y tiene variedad de platos para satisfacer a sus clientes que visitan su restaurante. Trabaja de Jueves a domingo en las mañanas y tardes y cuenta con la ayuda de su marido y sus hijos, tiene 4 años con su negocio y le va muy bien.

Este nuevo crédito lo va a emplear en comprar víveres necesarios para preparar los deliciosos alimentos que vende. Tiene 4 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
The San Gregorio Communal Bank meets every fifteen days in the beautiful city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí and known as the City of the Valley. It is a city with a warm climate, beautiful women, and a great variety of foods. 

In this place lives Carmen. She is 39 years old and is in a common-law marriage, from which she has three children – one older, and two who are 16 and 13 years old. The oldest studies at the university and the two youngest are in high school. Her husband is a driver. 

She has a business selling food out of her home. In the mornings, she sells delicious encebollado (stew cooked with onions) and ceviches de pescado (fresh seafood dish), in addition to other delicious dishes made from seafood. In the afternoons, she sells snacks; she has a variety of dishes to satisfy the customers that visit her restaurant. She works Thursday to Sunday in the mornings and afternoons, and she counts on the support of her spouse and her children. She has had this business for 4 years, and it’s going very well for her. 

She is going to use this new loan for purchasing the necessary provisions to prepare the delicious food that she sells. She has been a part of the Communal Bank for 4 years and she likes it, because with the first loan, she started up her business.

Her dream is to have a great restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase food provisions.

loans.name: Kanduri

texts.en:
Kanduri is a 30-year-old disabled person living with his wife and his two daughters who are five and three years old. He is running a cycle repair shop in the market. He earns 5,000 INR from this business. He repairs bicycles. But he needs to go to the market to get the required spare parts to repair bicycles as and when required. He does not have enough funds to have these spare parts in stock. As a physically challenged person, it is difficult to go to the market very frequently and he is not able to provide the service within the required time. He wants to purchase these spare parts in bulk and improve his customer service by reducing the turnaround time for the repairs. 

Kanduri has applied for a loan of 20,000 INR to purchase spare parts like free wheels, chains, tires, seat covers etc, which are frequently needed in his repair work. This will help to repair bicycles on time, provide better service to his customers, attract more customers and reduce the frequent trips to the market. He says he will earn 6,000 to 7,000 INR per month from this business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts like free wheels, chains, tires, seat covers etc. for his cycle repair shop.

loans.name: Rajalaxmi

texts.en:
Rajalaxmi is a 32-year-old woman living with her son and daughter who are 16 and 18 years old. In 2006, her husband passed away in an accident. That was a very hard time for her because the entire family burden came on her. In those days, she had two cows with her so she managed her family by selling milk but that was not sufficient. In 2008, she started a ladies novelty corner in her house. She sells face creams, hair oils, shampoos, body talc, body deodorants, body lotions, and fashion accessories (earrings, finger rings, bangles, bracelets, bangles etc.) in her ladies novelty corner. She has a plan to have a new product line by adding milk, curd, ice cream, butter and other milk products in her shop.

She has requested a loan of 40,000 INR to purchase milk products and a freezer for keeping those milk products.

She wants her son to complete his graduation from a good college and to save money for her daughter’s marriage.

loans.use: to purchase milk products like butter, yogurt, ice cream etc. and a freezer to store those milk products

loans.name: Gitanjali

texts.en:
Gitanjali is a 30-year-old widow living with her mother, her five-year-old son and her seven-year-old daughter. After her husband’s death, she started working in a tailoring shop located in her village to manage her family. She gets only the labor cost, which is just 1,000 INR per month. She has four years of experience in this activity. She stitches salwar suits (traditional Indian dresses) for her customers who place orders for the dresses.

She wants to purchase a sewing machine so that she can run her own tailoring shop in her house and earn more income. She says that running her own tailoring shop will make her independent and allow her to give time to her children.

She has requested a loan of 20,000 INR to purchase a sewing machine and fabrics. She has a dream of giving the best quality education to her children and saving some money for her family’s future.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and fabrics

loans.name: Kenia Iveth

texts.es:
El municipio de El Sauce se caracteriza por ser un pueblo calmo, lleno de personas trabajadoras y honradas como es el caso de la joven Kenia Ivett que habita en la comarca Las Pilas a 8 km de dicho municipio, es una joven de 24 años, casada con un pequeño hijo, que desde muy pequeña le enseñaron el amor al trabajo por lo cual ella inició con su pequeño negocio de comercio ambulante.

Tiene 3 años de dedicarse a la venta de ropa y zapatos, el que inició con capital otorgado por su esposo con el fin de generar sus propios ingresos y ayudar en los gastos del hogar.

Está solicitando este crédito para compra de pantalones, blusas, ropa interior, camisa de varón y zapatos  para su respectiva comercialización con el fin de satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y así generar un poco más de ganancia lo cual es un beneficio para el desarrollo económico de su hogar.

Está muy agradecida con KIVA y Ceprodel por el apoyo que le han brindado con estos créditos, ya que una manera aumenta el capital de trabajo de todo pequeño comerciante. Espera y confía en Dios que estos inversionistas de buen corazón signa prestando dinero a personas que lo necesitan en nuestro país.
texts.en:
The municipality of El Sauce is known for being a calm town, full of hard-working, honest people. This is the case with young Kenia Iveth, who lives in the Las Pilas region, eight kilometers from El Sauce. She is a young 24-year-old woman who is married with a young son. From the time she was very small, she was taught the love of work, which is why she started her own little street vending business.

She has been working in clothes and shoe sales for three years. She started her business with money given to her by her husband with the goal of generating her own income and helping with household expenses.

She is requesting this loan to buy pants, blouses, underwear, men's shirts, and shoes so she can offer them for sale with the goal of satisfying customer demand and thus generating a little more profits, which would be beneficial for the economic development of her household.

She is very grateful to Kiva and Ceprodel for the support they have offered her with these loans, because it's a way to increase the working capital of all small-business owners. She hopes and trusts in God that these good-hearted investors will continue lending money to people who need it in her country.

loans.use: to by pants, blouses, underwear, men's shirts, and shoes.

loans.name: Y Poty Group

texts.es:
El comité Y Poty actualmente se encuentran  en el segundo ciclo, con diez (10) integrantes, el grupo empezó, demostrando unión y solidaridad entre las compañeras; quienes poseen actividad  económica y son muy trabajadoras. La mayoría de los integrantes son indígenas. Las  integrantes ya contaban con trabajo antes de formar parte del comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. Todas ellas son mujeres muy sacrificadas, escasos recursos, por lo que reciben muy pocas atenciones y beneficios.
María, una de las integrantes del grupo, se dedica a la cría de animales al igual que las demás que integran el grupo; para ello necesita alimentos balanceados y gastos de veterinarias para mantenerlos sanos y poderlos ofrecer a la venta y así generar ingresos para su familia.
Solicita el crédito para comprar alimentos balanceados.
texts.en:
The group Y Poty is currently in its second cycle, with 10 members. The group began with unity and solidarity among its partners, who have business activities and are very hardworking. The majority of the members are indigenous people. The members already had work before forming part of the group Mujeres Emprendedoras (Enterprising Women). They are all very self-sacrificing women with scant resources; because of this, they receive very little attention and benefits. 

María, one of the group members, works raising animals, as do the majority of the others who make up the group. For this work, she needs balanced feed and money for veterinary expenses to keep the animals healthy and be able to offer them for sale, so she can generate income for her family. 

She is requesting the loan to purchase balanced feed.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for fattening livestock.

loans.name: Santilata

texts.en:
Santilata is a 39-year-old widow living with her parents, brother and a daughter who is eight years old. After her husband’s death, she came back to her paternal house, started living with her parents and got herself engaged in tutoring the village kids. She earns 2,000 INR per month from this activity but this is not sufficient for her to run her family.
 
She has a plan to start a ladies novelty corner in her house where she will keep cosmetics, hair oil, shampoo, body talc, body deodorant, bangles and other fashion accessories. She says that doing so will improve her earnings and her family’s status. She has requested a loan of 25,000 INR to purchase the above-mentioned items for her ladies novelty corner.
 
She dreams of educating her daughter and saving money to make her future secure.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, hair oil, shampoo, body talc, body deodorant, bangles and other fashion accessories to sell

loans.name: Gangadhar

texts.en:
Gangadhar is a 35-year-old physically challenged person living with his parents, wife and a daughter who is eight years old. He owns and manages a variety shop where he sells betel, tobacco sachets, toffees, biscuits, wheat flour, onions, potatoes, soaps, detergents etc. He also has a sewing machine in his variety store where he repairs the clothes of his village people. His monthly income from this shop is 8,000 INR.

He has a plan to keep fertilizers in his shop. The fertilizer is used for farming purposes. Most of the population of his village is involved in agricultural activities. To grow the best crops, they need good quality fertilizers from the market, which is far away from their village. He says that doing this will increase his income as well as satisfy his customers.

He has applied for a loan of 50,000 INR to purchase more stock to sell in his variety store including fertilizers.

He has a dream of giving his family a good quality life and having his daughter study in a good school.

loans.use: to purchase betel, tobacco sachets, toffees, biscuits, wheat flour, onions, potatoes, soaps, detergents and fertilizers for his variety shop.

loans.name: Byron Antonio

texts.es: Byron es agricultor se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol desde hace 15 años. Solicito un crédito kiva el cual lo pago satisfactoriamente y lo destino para comprar insumos y pagar mano de obra para cultivar una manzana de frijol, obtuvo buena cosecha aseguro el autoconsumo del grano para su familia y vendió el resto. Esta solicitando un segundo  préstamo con el apoyo de su familia para invertirlo en compra de insumos agrícolas y pago  de mano de obra para cultivar dos manzanas de frijol. Al finalizar de pagar este segundo crédito espera seguir sembrando granos básicos como son el maíz y frijol  y contar con nuevos créditos que le permitan comercializar su producto.
texts.en:
Byron is a farmer who has planted corn and beans for the past 15 years. He has requested a Kiva loan that he paid back satisfactorily and used to purchase agricultural inputs and pay for manual labor to cultivate a manzana [.7 hectare] of beans. He had a good harvest, and after securing the grain that his family would consume, he sold the rest.  

Now, with the support of his family, he is requesting a second loan to purchase agricultural inputs and pay for manual labor to cultivate two manzanas [1.4 hectares] of beans. Upon finishing paying off this second loan, he hopes to continue planting basic grains such as corn and beans, and to have new credits that will allow him to sell his products.

loans.use: purchase agricultural inputs to plant corn and beans and pay for labor

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has been selling clothes in Nakuru town for the past one year and it has been profitable. She is 22-years old and married to David.

This is her first loan with KADET LTD and she plans to buy more stock of clothes to sell in her business. With the anticipated profits, she plans to buy more variety of clothes such as shirts and skirts to sell.

In the future, Mary hopes to grow her business and open a boutique to make more income.

loans.use: To buy more variety of clothes such as shirts and skirts to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To rent a store and buy inventory for his new grocery business.

loans.name: Abdulilah

texts.en: Abdulilah is a 63-year-old man who opened his own business after retirement to continue being a proactive person. He is supporting three members in the family. He was the first and the only one who opened a cleaning services office in the city he lives in; because of that, he was able to launch and turn the business into a successful one. Now he has applied for this loan to start working on covering more areas by employing more people and getting more equipment.

loans.use: to employ more people in his cleaning services store.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 45 years old and married with five children. She has been in the cereals business for the last five years earning approximately KES 16,000 monthly. She has applied for her third business loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying her previous loans. She borrowed 50,000 Ksh and plans to use it on purchasing dry maize for resale.

With the anticipated profits, she plans to repay her loan and save the remaining amount for her children’s education. She hopes to open a big cereals store in town.

loans.use: To purchase dry maize for resale.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca's business is selling fruits and vegetables. She has been in her business for three years. She is 56-years-old, and  married with eight children. Rebecca wants to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in the public market; that is why she is taking out this loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to buy a variety of fruits and vegetables such as bananas, ripe mangoes, beans, and so on. Through the loan, she hopes to improve her business as well as acquire improved income.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruits and vegetables such as bananas, ripe mangoes, beans, and so on.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian is a poultry farmer who lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is a married mother of four and has been doing the business for twenty-six years. Lilian is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenyan shillings to purchase chicks, medicines, and the poultry feeds. She also owns rental houses. She began the business from her savings. Her only challenge is the overall inflation that has reduced the purchasing power of many customers, but Lilian intends to extend the size of the poultry house using the income from the loan. There have also been cases of disease outbreaks.

loans.use: To purchase chicks, medicines, and the poultry feeds.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, pictured here with one of her dairy cows though requesting funding for poultry business, is a mother of six children aged between 18 and 10 years. She lives with her family in their rural home in Kitale area of Rift Valley Province of Kenya where she carries out a farming business; beans, milk, maize, eggs, and vegetables are her major produce for the local market.

Elizabeth has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry. She says she will be able to diversify her farming business with the loan capital and generate enough income to meet her family basic needs.

Elizabeth faces the following challenges; poultry diseases and poor market prices for agricultural produce.

loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es: El señor Marcos tiene 42 años de edad casado con la Sra. Santusa hace 20 años tienen 5 hijos dependientes, toda la familia se dedican a la actividad agrícola es la fuente de sus ingresos económicos producen papa, locoto cultivando en terreno de 3 has con rotación de cultivos en la comunidad de Corani Pampa Duraznos, Marcos tiene mucha experiencia en la actividad agrícola, ellos están a 82 km de la ciudad de. Marcos y su esposa nos comentan que necesitan dinero para comprar un terreno agrícola que está en venta de urgencia al lado de su parcela, el ahorro que tenían gastaron en la construcción de vivienda, Don Marcos es una persona joven y emprendedor, nos comenta que con el préstamo comprara el terreno y ampliaran su producción agrícola para que tengan mejores ingreso económicos garantizando  la seguridad alimentaria para su familia.
texts.en:
Marcos is 42 and has been married to Santusa for 20 years. They have five dependent children, and the whole family works in agriculture as it is their source of income. The grow potatoes and peppers on 3 hectare of land and practice crop rotation. Marcos has a lot of experience as a farmer. They are located 82 km from the city in the community of Corani Pampa Duraznos. 

Marcos and his wife say that they need the funds to purchase farmland that is on urgent sale and is located beside their land. The savings they had was spent on construction of their home. Marcos is a young person at heart and a hard worker. He says that with the loan, he will purchase the land and increase his agricultural production so that they can have a better income and guarantee the food security of his family.

loans.use: purchase farmland

loans.name: Elimar

texts.en: Elimar is 36-years-old, and married with three children. His responsibility is to give a good way of living to his family, but so far isn’t able to achieve it. This is due to the difficult living and poor economic stability plus the fact that his tricycle has poor performance. So no matter how he has tried to strive, he keeps on falling. But Elimar still has big faith and hope. He dreams to have a higher income from his transportation business and could attain this through requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 to use in the overhaul repair of his tricycle. He hopes that after providing for the needs of his tricycle, he would be blessed with a higher income.

loans.use: to use in the overhaul repair of his tricycle.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en: Ms Rukhsana is a 46 year-old married woman. Three years ago, she started her own business of clothing sales when her husband got severely ill. She didn’t lose hope and contacted Kashf Foundation upon the advice of her neighbor to initiate her own business. She buys clothes of different designs from market in bulk at lower rates and sells them in her community. She counts a good client list, most her clients are her neighbors. She is mother of five children. Two of them are school going. She wishes to send other children to school but is unable to cover the expenses. She has gradually improved her business, now she requested a loan of Rs. 20,000. She is going to use this loan to buy an ample variety of clothes in a larger quantity to add to her current ones. She intends to use the earned profits on her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy an ample variety of clothes and in larger quantity to add to her current ones.

loans.name: Glady's

texts.en: Gladys states that she spent the entire loan in purchasing a drier and a blow-dry machine. The business picked up well, but since the year was approaching low season, she faced a great deal of challenge in the loan repayment. There were a number of clients who wanted to be served on credit and this also reduced her income. She has now decided to apply for a loan of KES 31,500 to restock her salon. She believes that she can now make more sales having had an experience over the last year.

loans.use: To purchase a drier and cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
Ramiro, es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres ocupando solo una habitación pequeña con paredes de adobe  y el piso de tierra, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Padilla en la ciudad de El Alto.
El estudió solo hasta terminar la secundaria y actualmente trabaja por más de diez horas como ayudante de albañil realizando todo tipo de construcciones, ya que con lo que gana debe cubrir  sus gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de estuco, pinturas y enchufes y cables ya que desea terminar la obra fina de la  habitación que ocupa en la casa de sus padres  para tener más comodidad y mejorar su calidad de vida.
El sueño de Ramiro es terminar  poder ingresar a la universidad y seguir una carrera que le permita vivir mejor y ayudar a sus padres.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Ramiro is single and has no children. He lives in his parents’ house, where he stays in a small room with adobe walls and a dirt floor. The house is located in the Padilla area in the city of El Alto.

Ramiro only studied until the end of high school, and he currently works for more than 10 hours a day as a building assistant. He works on all kinds of constructions, and uses the money he earns to cover his own food costs and to provide basic services for his family.

Ramiro has applied for this loan to buy plaster, paint, sockets and cables. He wants to use these items to finish work on the room that he stays in at his parents’ house, so that he can be more comfortable and have a better quality of life. Ramiro’s dream is to be able to go to university, where he wants to study a degree that will afford him a better life and allow him to help his parents. This is the second time he has asked for a loan from IMPRO, and the first that he has asked for a Kiva loan.

loans.use: To buy plaster, paint, sockets and cables to finish work on his room in the home where he lives with his parents.

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Juan de 44 años de edad, es padre de dos hijos vive en su propia casa junto a su conyugue, en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, el se dedica desde hace 2 años al negocio de la venta de leche, frutas y también al trabajo de albañilería.
Don Juan esta solicitando el préstamo de 8,000.00 lempiras para comprar fertilizantes y cemento y bloques que el necesita para empezar a construir un cuarto para sus hijos.
Don Juan con el apoyo de este préstamo el desea suplir la necesidad de financiamiento que necesita para llevar a cabo  su proyecto y seguir con su negocio.
El deseo de Don Juan es mejorar su casa y tener buen ganado que le genere buenas ganancias con la producción de leche.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Agosto del 2012.
texts.en:
Juan is 44 years old. He is the father of two children and lives in a home he owns with his wife in the community of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras. For 2 years he has worked in the business of selling milk and fruit. He also works as a bricklayer.

Juan is asking for a loan of 8,000.00 lempiras to buy fertilizer, cement and blocks that he needs to build a room for his children. With the support of this loan, Juan wants to  have the financing he needs to complete his project and stay on in his business.

What Juan wants is to improve his home and have good cattle so he can generate good income with milk production.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - August, 2012.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, cement and blocks for his business.

loans.name: Salustina

texts.es:
Salustina vive en el municipio de El Sauce, ubicado al occidente del departamento de León, es una señora de 62 años, soltera, con 4 hijas, todas preparadas profesionalmente, las cuales  trabajan actualmente. Gracias a su profesión como Instructora en Salud que ha desempeñado por 29 años logró preparar a sus hijas las que hoy ya no dependen de ella y que son personas de bien, luchadoras y con buenos principios al igual que su madre, la cual las educó siendo madre soltera  sin la ayuda de su padre.

También hace muchos años adquirió un terreno en un barrio de dicho municipio donde empezó a construir su propia casita con la ayuda de los créditos y su salario, ya que alquilaba locales para vivir, hoy ya cuenta con su propia vivienda la que ha ido mejorando conforme pasan los años.

Está solicitando un crédito para terminar de construir un cuarto. Este lo invertirá en  la compra de cemento, ladrillos, zinc y perlines con el objetivo tener mejores condiciones de vida y espacio para cuando lleguen sus hijas de visita.
Se siente muy agradecida y satisfecha por el apoyo que le ha brindado KIVA y Ceprodel  al financiarle con estos créditos que ayudan a cumplir sueños y metas que no se pudieran llevar a cabo con los bajos salarios que se gana en nuestro país.
texts.en:
Salustina lives in El Sauce, a town located in western León. She is a single woman, aged 62 years, with 4 daughters who are all currently working, professional women. Owing to her work as an Health Instructor, a role that she has fulfilled for 29 years, she has managed to educate her daughters so that they are no longer dependent on her: they are good, hard working people with good principles, just like their mother. Salustina was a single mother and educated her children without any help from their father.
Many years ago she also acquired some land in the above-named neighbourhood and she began construction work on her own home, financed by loans and her own salary. She has other properties that she rents out and she now has her own home, which she has been improving over the years.
She is applying for a loan to finish the building work on a new room. She will invest this loan in the purchase of cement, bricks, metal sheeting and purlines with the aim of creating better living conditions and more space for times when her daughters come to visit. 
She is very grateful for and happy with the financial supported provided by KIVA and CEPRODEL via these loans, which will help her to achieve her dreams and aims which she could not achieve otherwise as salaries in her own country are very low.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, metal sheeting and purlines.

loans.name: Denia María

texts.es:
Con un préstamo de 26,250 pesos Denia María podrá comprar mercancía para sus diferentes negocios. Denia tiene un puesto de frutas y vegetales, una cafetería y una tiendita donde vende accesorios y artículos de cuidado personal. Con parte del préstamo Denia María también quiere terminar de construir el área donde desea terminar de instalar la tiendita. Denia María es casada, su esposo es carnicero. Juntos tienen 3 hijos de 12, 5 y tres años. La mayor está en 8vo. Grado y los dos pequeños están en el preescolar.
El sueño de Denia María y su esposo es terminar de construir su casa.  Denia María quiere que su negocio crezca y se fortalezca para poder alcanzar este sueño.
texts.en:
With a loan of 26,250 pesos Denia María will be able to buy merchandise for her different businesses. Denia has a fruit and vegetable stand, a cafe and a little store where she sells accesories and personal care items. With a part of the loan, Denia María also wants to finish building the area where she wants to finish setting up the little store. Denia María is married and her husband is a butcher. Together they have 3 children, aged 12, 5  and 3 years old. The oldest is in 8th grade and the two little ones are in preschool. 

Denia María and her husband's dream is to finish building their house. Denia María wants her business to grow and strenghten to be able to attain this dream.

loans.use: to buy accesories and personal care products for her little store as well as fruit for her fruit stand.

loans.name: Carmen Suyapa

texts.es:
Carmen, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y vive con su esposo y tres hijas en el municipio de Villanueva, Cortes.
Hace 10 años que Carmen, estableció su propio negocio en su casa donde confecciona prendas de vestir para damas, como ser vestidos de toda ocasión, faldas, blusas, pantalones, uniformes, etc. siempre se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde muy joven aprendió esta actividad y ahora es su fuente de ingresos. Con el préstamo que esta solicitando de 21,000 Lempiras va surtir de materia prima como ser: telas, hilos, agujas, adornos, botones etc. para confeccionar las prendas de vestir y brindar un mejor servicio al cliente. Su objetivo es hacer crecer el negocio e incrementar su clientela para obtener más ingresos y cumplir con su meta propuesta la de construir dos apartamentos para alquiler y obtener otros ingresos.
texts.en:
Carmen is 32 years of age, married, and lives with her husband and three daughters in the town of Villanueva, Cortes. She set up her own business at home 10 years ago, where she makes women’s clothing such as dresses for all occasions, skirts, blouses, slacks, uniforms, etc. She has always worked in this business, as it was something she learned at a very young age and is now her source of income. 

With the loan of 21,000 Honduran Lempiras she has requested, Carmen plans to buy raw materials such as fabrics, threads, needles, accessories, buttons, etc. She will use these to make clothing, and therefore provide better customer service. Carmen’s goal is to have a larger business and expand her customer base. This will  allow her to meet her objective of building two apartments, which she will rent out to obtain more income.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials such as fabrics, lace, thread, needles, buttons, clasps, etc.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El grupo empezó, demostrando unión y solidaridad entre las compañeras; quienes poseen actividad  económica y son muy trabajadoras. Las  integrantes ya contaban con trabajo antes de formar parte del comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.
El comité San Cayetano, quedo muy conforme por el respaldo económico otorgado de la Fundación Paraguaya por ser la empresa que ha depositado en ellas la confianza y le dio la oportunidad de mejorar la calidad de vida  a través del trabajo y la integración grupal.
La sra. Leorgina tiene una pollería, en el ella ofrece pollos a la brasa y al espiedo a su clientela ya formada y a los ocasionales, ella compra los pollos y los cocina para luego venderlos y así generar ingresos económicos.
Solicita el crédito para comprar pollos y luego poderlos vender.
texts.en:
This group began as a sign of the union and solidarity between its members, who all work and are very dedicated to their businesses. This group’s members already had work before they joined the “Mujeres Emprendedoras” (entrepreneurial women) committee.

The San Cayetano committee is very happy with the financial support given by Fundación Paraguaya. The institution has placed its trust in the committee, and has given it the opportunity to improve its members’ living conditions through work and group integration.

Leorgina has a poultry business, where she sells grilled and spit-roasted chickens to both regular and one-off customers. She buys chickens and cooks them, before selling them to earn income. She has requested this loan to buy chickens which she later resells.

loans.use: To buy chickens to cook and sell.

loans.name: Reyna Elizeth

texts.es:
La joven Reyna de 21 años de edad, es madre soltera tiene un hijo que depende de ella  y radica en la comunidad de Nacaome al sur de Honduras en donde tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de sandalias y zapatos en el mercado de esa localidad.
Reyna esta solicitando 10,000.00 lempiras para compra de zapato juvenil, zapato de niño y zapato de mujer. Con el apoyo de este préstamo ella desea surtir mas su negocio y por ende tener mejores ganancias.
Reyna su sueño es seguir trabajando y mejorando su negocio y comprarse un  solar en donde pueda construir su propia casa.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Agosto del 2012.
texts.en:
Reyna is 21 years of age, and is a single mother. She has one son under her care, and lives in the city of Nacaome in the south of Honduras. In this city she has a small business, where she sells sandals and shoes in the local market.

Reyna has requested 10,000.00 Honduran Lempiras to buy shoes for young people, children and women. With the help of this loan, she would like to have more supplies for her business and, as a result, have more income. Reyna’s dream is to continue working and to improve her business, as well as to buy a plot of land where she can build her own home.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - August 2012.

loans.use: To buy shoes for young people, children and women for her business.

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.es:
Con un préstamo de 26,250 pesos Aquilina podrá comprar productos y otro secador de pelo para su salón de belleza. Aquilina además está planeando darle un toque diferente a la decoración de su salón de belleza, ya que ella dice: ´ya tengo 5 años con el salón y mis clientes quieren un cambio en el ambiente´ Aquilina es madre soltera de cuatro hijos de 14, 12, 4 y 10 meses.  Los tres mayores están en la escuela y cuida al bebé a la vez que atiende su negocio.
Aquilina quiere terminar la secundaria para ingresar a la universidad y estudiar contabilidad. Sabe que solo estudiando y trabajando duro podrá sacar a sus hijos adelante.
Aquilina es una mujer luchadora, siempre con una sonrisa en los labios, conocedora de que un buen ambiente y una especial atención a sus clientes es lo que las hace regresar cada semana a su salón de belleza
texts.en:
With a loan of 26,250 pesos, Aquilina will be able to buy products and another hairdryer for her beauty salon. She is also planning to add a different touch to the salon’s décor, as she says that “I’ve had the salon for five years, and my customers would like a change to the ambience.´ 

Aquilina is a single mother of four children, who are aged 14, 12, 4 and 10 months. Her three oldest children go to school, and Aquilina herself looks after the baby while she attends to her business.
