She wants to finish high school so that she can study accounting at university, and knows that through study and work she can help her children to get ahead.

Aquilina is a hard-working woman, and always has a smile on her face. She understands that a good atmosphere and special customer service is what makes people come back to her beauty salon every week.

loans.use: To buy beauty products and another hairdryer for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Katya Guisell

texts.es: La joven Katya Guisell de 22 años de edad soltera egresada de la carrera de administración de empresas, empezó a trabajar a los 18 años, ha pagado sus estudios por medio de su trabajo, solicita el crédito para el pago del curso de titulación, actualmente labora en un hospital privado en el área de cartera y cobro. Si no tuviese el préstamo tendría que dejar pasar más tiempo para poder reunir el dinero para pagar el curso, le interesa su profesión porque le ayudaría a culminar sus metas  que junto con su familia seria un sueño cumplido hasta el final siendo una mejor profesional lo que compartiría con otras personas, son sus conocimientos adquiridos en la universidad, y motivar a muchos a tomar esa iniciativa de desarrollo.
texts.en:
Katya Guisell is 22 years of age, and is studying a business administration course. She started working when she was 18, and has worked to be able to pay for her education. She has requested this loan to pay for her course to get qualified, and currently works in the cash and collections department of a private hospital. 

If she were unable to take out a loan, Katya Guissell would have to wait longer to get the money together to pay for her course. She is interested in her profession, as it will help her to meet her goals. This would be a dream come true for her and her family, and she would become a better professional and share with others the knowledge she obtained from university. She will also motivate other people to take this development initiative.

loans.use: To pay for her course to get qualified.

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en: This is 35-year-old Prisca. She is married and a mother to her three children. In 2004, Prisca established her tailoring business. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. She is requesting her second loan from Yehu, having successfully repaid the first loan. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits. In the future, Prisca plans to open a shop. Honest and hardworking, she thanks you for your support. She intends to purchase clothing materials and sewing thread.

loans.use: to purchase clothing materials and sewing thread.

loans.name: Yuris Maricela

texts.es:
La Señora Yuris es una persona muy trabajadora actualmente vive con sus hijos y su esposo los cuales viven en Departamento de Choluteca. Ella se dedica a su negocio propio de venta de comida.
Doña Yuris el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de carnes, condimentos, maíz, leña, aceite, vegetales y arroz. Ella Espera que al finalizar el esta época de invierno su negocio aumente sus ventas. Ya que es una zona muy comercial.
Doña Yuris su deseo es Seguir trabajando duro para terminar de darle a sus hijos lo mejor que es la educación y que sean personas de bien.
Choluteca, honduras - Agosto del 2012
texts.en:
Señora Yuris is a very hard-working person who currently lives with her children and her husband in the department of Choluteca.  She makes a living through her business of selling food.

Doña Yuris needs the loan to buy meat, seasoning, corn, firewood, oil, vegetables, and rice.  She hopes that by the end of this winter season her business will have increased its sales since it is in a very commercial area.

Doña Yuris' dream is to continue working hard in order to finish giving her children the best which is education and being good people.

Choluteca, Honduras - August 2012

loans.use: to buy meat, seasoning, corn, firewood, oil, vegetable, and rice for her business.

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es: Aníbal es habitante de la comarca El Regadío municipio de Estelí, de 38 años de edad, casado, tiene 3 hijos, él es agricultor y ganadero desde hace 15 años, también aprendió mecánica. A los 20 años de edad  heredo de parte de su padre 4 manzanas de tierra. Utilizo la tierra que recibió para sembrar maíz y frijol. Hoy día Aníbal distribuye sus productos en un local de la comunidad contando con el apoyo de su familia, le gustaría darse  a conocer por sus cultivos en los mercados capitalinos para obtener precio justo por su cosecha. El está solicitando un crédito kiva para compra de una vaca para vender  la leche y así obtener mayores ingresos. Su meta es seguir creciendo como agricultor y ganadero comprando más vacas para tener más ganado, vender la leche y  asi diversificar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Aníbal lives in Estelí municipality, in El Regadío region.  He is 38 years old, married, and has three children.  He has been farming and raising cattle for 15 years.  He also studied mechanics.

When he was 20 years old, Aníbal inherited 4 'manzanas' (just under 7 acres) of land from his father.  He used this land for sowing corn and beans.  Aníbal currently distributes his produce in his community and has the support of his family.  He would like to become known for his crops in the markets in the capital city so that he can obtain a fair price for his harvests.

Aníbal is requesting a Kiva loan to buy a cow so that he can sell its milk and thereby make more income.  His goal is to continue growing as a farmer and rancher, buying more cows so that he can increase the size of his herd, sell their milk, and thereby diversify his income.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña Katupyry actualmente se encuentran  en el segundo ciclo, con diez (10) integrantes, el grupo empezó, demostrando unión y solidaridad entre las compañeras; quienes poseen actividad  económica y son muy trabajadoras. Las  integrantes ya contaban con trabajo antes de formar parte del comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.
El comité Kuña Katupyry, quedo muy conforme por el respaldo económico otorgado de la Fundación Paraguaya por ser la empresa que ha depositado en ellas la confianza y le dio la oportunidad de mejorar la calidad de vida  a través del trabajo y la integración grupal.
Norma, una de las integrantes del grupo, se dedica a la cría de animales, los alimenta y los cuida en su salud para luego poderlos vender y así generar mayores ingresos económicos a su canasta familiar.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de animales.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Kuña Katupyry committee are currently on their second loan cycle.  The group demonstrates unity and solidarity among its members who each have their own business activity and are all very hard working.  The members were all working before they joined the Entrepreneurial Women's Committee.

The Kuña Katupyry committee are very happy to be receiving financial support from Fundación Paraguaya.  The company has put their trust in them and given them the opportunity to improve their quality of life through their work and their membership of the group.

Norma, one of the group's members, raises animals for a living.  She feeds them and ensures they are in good health so that she can then sell them and make money for her family.  She is requesting this loan to buy nutritionally-balanced feed with which to fatten her animals.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally-balanced feed with which to fatten her animals

loans.name: Housam

texts.en:
Housam is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 28 years, married and has two children. He is the only provider for the family.

Housam owns a car repairing shop. He specializes in repairing car bodies. He established his business in 2007 and he now has one employee. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a $2,700 youth loan to buy a specialized machine for his work and to install an external ceiling. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a specialized machine for his work and install an external ceiling

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Ms. Khalida is a 35-year-old vigorous lady and a mother of three children. She is doing a business of manufacturing electric rods for the past three years. She uses laminated sheets and rods for electrical insulation. She initiated her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Khalida is the best-earning resource of her house as her husband is employed as a salesperson in a grocery store and he earns not enough to support his family well.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a loan of 35,000 PKR to purchase more rods to facilitate more customers. In addition to repaying the loan, the lady uses part of the revenue to deal with personal expenses and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to purchase more rods to facilitate more customers.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 48 years old, a widow and has 3 kids. She is from Mayor's Village, Lapasan, Clarin. She has owned and operated a transport service business for 5 years and earns 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Nena joined GDMPC. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories. She hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 37 years old, married to Elizabeth, and they have four children. He has a metal shop in Nakuru town where he also sells scrap metal.

This will be his first loan amount and he plans to buy more stock of scrap metal for use in his business and also sell to manufacturing companies. With the anticipated income he plans to buy a pick-up which he will be using to collect scrap metal from several places.

In the future, William hopes to open more scrap metal shops in Nakuru town and thereby make more income and be able to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy scrap metal.

loans.name: Osama

texts.en: Osama, a 22-year-old single guy, is one of seven siblings living together with their parents. He is a university student majoring in Mathematics. Being in a big family led him to decide to finish school by depending on himself, so he applied for this loan to pay for his upcoming semester fees to get his BS degree soon.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Jennefer

texts.en:
Jennefer is from Montol, Ozamis City. She is 27 years old. Jennefer is married and has 3 children. To make a living, she plants, harvests and sells corn. She has been engaged in her business for 8 years and earns about 9,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

Recently, Jennefer joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Housein

texts.en:
Houssein is from Iraq. He is a youth client age 28 years, married, and has two children. He is the only provider for the family.

Houssein owns a shop for women’s clothes. He also sells women’s accessories. He established his business in 2009 and now he has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a $2,700 Youth loan to renovate the walls and the floor of the shop and to increase inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to renovate the walls and the floor of the shop and to increase inventory.

loans.name: Dieudonne

texts.en: Dieudonne is 30 years old. He sells tires for motorbikes. He has been in this business for the past two years, and he wants to add more new types of tires in his store. He will use the profits from the business for savings.

loans.use: To buy more tires for resale.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is 44 years old. She is married to Paul and together they have two children. She operates a hardware store and has been in the business for the past 10 years. This is her second loan from KADET LTD. She paid her previous loan well and in good time. She will use the loan amount to purchase stock of iron sheets, nails and paints for stock in her hardware store. She hopes to open another branch of her hardware store.

loans.use: to purchase stock of iron sheets, nails and paints for stock in her hardware store.

loans.name: Medalla Milagrosa Group

texts.es:
El comité Medalla Milagrosa actualmente se encuentra en el segundo ciclo, con diez (10)integrantes, el grupo empezó, demostrando unión y solidaridad entre las compañeras; quienes poseen actividad  económica y son muy trabajadoras.     
El comité Medalla Milagrosa, quedo muy conforme por el respaldo económico otorgado de la Fundación Paraguaya por ser la empresa que ha depositado en ellas la confianza y le dio la oportunidad de mejorar la calidad de vida  a través del trabajo
Todas ellas se dedica a la cría de animales; la sra. Sara, con la actividad que realiza contribuye a la economía familiar, ella cuida y alimenta a los animales para luego poderlos vender a un buen precio.
Solicitó el crédito para comprar alimentos balanceados para engordar a sus animales y luego poderlos vender.
texts.en:
The 10-member Medalla Milagrosa group is now in its second loan cycle. From the beginning the group has shown unity and solidarity. The women all have jobs and are very hardworking.

The members are very happy with the financial support provided by the Paraguaya Foundation which has shown confidence in the members and given them the opportunity to improve their standard of living through their work.

All the women raise animals. Sra. Sara uses the income she brings in to contribute to family finances. She cares for, feeds, and then sells the animals for a good price. The loan she asked for is to buy nutritious animal feed for fattening the animals which she will then be able to sell.

loans.use: buy nutritious animal feed for fattening the animals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand the working area in his shop.

loans.name: Barrio San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El comité  San Miguel se conformo con la iniciativa de la señora Magdalena; actualmente se encuentran  en el primer ciclo, con diez (10) integrantes que han demostrado unión y solidaridad entre las compañeras; quienes poseen actividad  económica y son muy trabajadoras. Las  integrantes ya contaban con trabajo antes de formar parte del comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y se integraron para lograr un mayor rendimiento en sus actividades.
El comité San Miguel, quedo muy conforme por el respaldo económico otorgado de la Fundación Paraguaya por ser la empresa que confío en ellas y le dio la oportunidad de mejorar la calidad de vida.
Mirtha, una de las señoras del comité es macatera, vende variedades de productos a sus clientes, como sábanas, edredones, hamacas, etc y es así que ella genera ingresos para su familia.
Solicita el crédito para comprar hamacas, sábanas, edredones, toallas, para revenderlos.
texts.en:
The San Miguel group was started on the initiative of Sra. Magdalena. The group is now in its first loan cycle and has ten members. The women have demonstrated unity and solidarity. They all have jobs and are very hardworking. They already had jobs before becoming part of the Mujeres Emprendedoras group and joined together to achieve greater efficiency.

The members are very happy with the financial support provided by the Paraguaya Foundation which has shown confidence in the members and given them the opportunity to improve their standard of living through their work.

One of the group members is Mirtha who sells sheets, quilts, hammocks etc. in the local streets. The money she earns is used to support her family. She is seeking a loan to buy hammocks, sheets, quilts, towels etc. so she can resell them.

loans.use: buy hammocks, sheets, quilts, towels etc.

loans.name: Cristobal

texts.es: EL SR. CRISTOBAL TIENE 67 AÑOS DE EDAD, ESTA CASADO CON ROSARIO DESDE HACE 30 AÑOS. EL TRABAJA CUIDANDO UN RANCHO DESDE HACE YA VARIOS AÑOS. CRISTOBAL TIENE EL DESEO DE ARREGLAR SU CASA Y PODER BRINDARLE A SU FAMILIA UNA MAYOR COMODIDAD Y BIENESTAR, POR ESTA RAZON EL HA COMENZADO A TRABAJAR EN ALGUNOS ARREGLOS DE SU CASA. DEBIDO A ESTO A SOLICITADO UN CREDITO CON EL CUAL LLEVARA A CABO LA COMPRA DE UN VITROPISO QUE PONDRA EN SU CASA CON EL FIN DE MEJORAR SU VIVIENDA PARA BENEFICIO DE SU FAMILIA.
texts.en: Cristobal, 67, has been married to Rosario for 30 years. For several years he has been working as a caretaker in a ranch. He wants to fix up his house so that his family can enjoy greater comfort and better quality of life, and therefore he has started working on some home repairs. To be able to carry out this work he has requested a loan, which he will invest in installing a tiled floor with the goal to improve his home for the benefit of his family.

loans.use: install tiled flooring in his home

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 32 years old.  She sells rice cakes and native cakes in the village, which she has been doing business for two years. She earns 300 PHP a day. 

Juanita is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase white sugar, coconut, malagkit rice, and milk so that she can increase her product offerings. She hopes that she can earn a higher income so that she can build a hog fattening business as an additional source of income.

loans.use: to purchase white sugar, coconut, malagkit rice, and milk.

loans.name: Ishara Group

texts.fr: La cliente Elisabeth est entrepreneur, présidente du groupe Ishara,  âgée d'environ 39 ans, veuve, mère de 7 enfants. Son époux fut décédé suite à une courte maladie. La cliente  est vendeuse de jus local Madrakwa.  Elle est vend aussi des articles divers. Elle  commença son business  dans sa petite jeunesse  avec son fonds propre. Elle fut initiée par sa mère. Elle bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima vers les années 2007 pour renforcer son capital. Elle installe ses produits  à son domicile. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  les intrants de production de jus local Mandrakwa (mais, sorgho, etc.), le reste sera injecté dans le commerce de divers pour augmenter le stock. En plus, elle ambitionne  avoir une boutique d’exposition. La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique.
texts.en:
Elisabeth is an entrepreneur and president of the Ishara group. She is about 39 years old, widowed, and mother of seven children. Her husband died after a brief illness.

Elisabeth sells Madrakwa (the local juice) as well as various other items. She started her business in her youth, with her own money. Her mother taught her about business. Around 2007, she received a loan from the MFI, Hekima, to increase her captial. She sells her goods from home.

This new loan will enable her to stock up on the production inputs for making Mandrakwa (corn, sorghum, etc.). The rest will be used to increase her stock of other items. In addition, she hopes to open her own shop. Elisabeth would like to thank Hekima for all of the work they do to help poor people excluded from the classic banking system.

loans.use: to buy production inputs for Mandrakwa, the local juice (corn, sorghum, etc.)

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco tiene 37 años de edad, junto a él vive su esposa y su pequeño hijo de 5 años de edad por quien trabaja cada día muy duro para poder darle una vida digna y sobre todo con mucho amor;  su vivienda se ubica en un asentamiento Humano ubicado en la ciudad de Mala, Perú. El Distrito de mala se caracteriza por tener un clima muy variado, se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de manzana y plátano, también posee playas hermosas, las cuales reciben a muchos turistas en época de verano. Marco El es un hombre muy trabajador y humilde, debido a sus pocos recursos económicos solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estar en el ejército.

Día a día Marco trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de artículos personales y bazar como jabones, shampoos, maquinas de afeitar, entre otros y también trabaja por las noches como vigilante en un condominio de su ciudad, en el que también aprovecha la oportunidad para ofrecer sus productos; el cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y sobre todo muy amable y honrado con los clientes.

Marco está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que él han brindado el podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda, especialmente comprar eternit para poder colocar en el techo de su vivienda, ya que esta es de esteras y plástico y también podrá poner falso piso, de esta manera el podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y sobre todo se4guir luchando por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Construir su casa de material noble y darle una buena educación a su hijo”
texts.en:
Marco is 37 and lives with his wife and his small 5-year-old son for whom he works very hard every day so that he can give him a life of worth and, above all, much love.  His home is located in a settlement located in the city of Mala, Peru.  The district of Mala is characterized  by having a varied climate; agricultural development, in particular the cultivation of apples and bananas; and it also has beautiful beaches that receive many tourists in the summer season.  Marco is a hard-working and humble man who, due to his limited financial resources, only finished secondary school but would have really liked to be in the army.

Day to day Marco works in his small business of selling personal and market-place products like soap, shampoo, and razors, among others.  He also works at night as a security guard in a condominium in his town where he also takes advantage of the opportunity to offer his products.  He believes his job is going well because he is very responsible and, above all, very friendly and honest with his customers.


Marco is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they have offered him he will be able to make improvements to his home, in particular he will buy fiber cement sheets to put on the roof of his home because it is made of mats and plastic, and he will also be able to put in flooring and in this way be able to improve the quality of life for his family and, above all, continue fighting to make his greatest dream a reality - to build his home out of sturdy material and to give his son a good education.

loans.use: to buy fiber cement sheets and to put in flooring.

loans.name: Edjiwengatuwa Iii Group

texts.es:
El comité Edjiwengatuwa que cuenta con el total de 10 integrantes de los cuales 5 son co-deurores, ellas y ellos tienen sus familias que realizan respectivos trabajos en la agricultura, crías de animales,  para así salvar su pan de cada día, estos jóvenes ACHE se unieron y formaron su grupo, y de esta manera pudieron acceder al crédito otorgado por la Fundación Paraguaya. Actualmente, gracias a las ganas y el entusiasmo que le han puesto ya esta empezando su primer ciclo.
Gabriel,uno de los integrantes del grupo, al igual que el resto se dedica a la cría de animales, para ellos necesita alimentos balanceados y cuidarlos en su salud y así posteriormente venderlos y generar ingresos para su familia.
Solicitó el crédito para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engordar a sus animales, comprar mas animales para engordar y para gastos de salud de los mismos.
texts.en:
The Edjiwengatuwa Group has ten members, five of whom are joint borrowers. They all have families and have jobs in agriculture and animal raising. This is how they earn money to put bread on the table. These young people met and formed a group so they could access a loan through the Paraguaya Foundation. Thanks to their efforts and enthusiasm they are beginning their first loan cycle.

One of the members is Gabriel who, like the others, raises animals. He needs to buy nutritious feed so he can raise healthy animals and then sell them to generate money to support his family. The loan he asked for is to buy nutritious feed, more animals to fatten, and pay for animal health expenses.

loans.use: to buy nutritious animal feed

loans.name: Máximo

texts.es:
El Sr Máximo es estudiante de 32 años de edad desea retomar la carrera de Licenciatura en filosofía en la Universidad Nacional de Villarrica.
Cuenta con la ayuda de sus padres, su madre ama de casa y su padre es Agricultor. Máximo, con mucho esfuerzo pudo conseguir un trabajo estable para solventar sus gastos personales y volver a estudiar. 
Con el crédito otorgado  cubrirá la matrícula y la cuota de su facultad, compra materiales didácticos y otros. 
Su sueño es terminar su carrera y ser un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Máximo is a 32-year old student who wants to take up a Philosophy Degree at the National University of Villarrica.

He counts on his parents’ support.  His mother is a homemaker and his father is a farmer.  Máximo, with much effort, was able to get a stable job to meet his personal expenses and go back to school.

He will use the loan granted to cover enrollment and the faculty quotas, buy school supplies and other costs.  His dream is to complete his degree and become a good professional.

loans.use: to pay for his faculty quotas and to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 27 years old and married to John. They are blessed with three children, aged 12, 9 and 7. She has had a grocery business for the past one year from which she earns a monthly income of KES. 5,000 that she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan term with KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Rose will use the loan to buy more stock of sugar, rice, wheat flour, etc. for her business. 

With the anticipated profit, she will educate her children and expand her business. Her hopes and dreams are to provide her children with the highest level of education.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her business like sugar, rice and wheat flour.

loans.name: Lizy

texts.en:
Lizy is 37 years old. She is married with three children. Her husband also contributes additional income to sustain the family. Lizy runs a boutique shop and has been in operation for three years, earning 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) monthly. 

This is her fourth loan from KADET LTD of KES 70,000, and she plans to use it on purchasing new clothes for resale. Her hope and dream is that her business prospers so she can earn more profits and open a bigger shop.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes for resale.

loans.name: Jose Felix

texts.es:
Don José es una persona muy trabajadora dedicado su negocio actualmente vive con su esposa y 3 hijos, El y su familia viven actualmente en Choluteca al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la venta de semillas actividad que realiza en su casa de habitación desde hace más de 10 años.
Don José el préstamo lo invertirá en su negocio en la compra de maní, morro, cacahuates y otras. El Espera que mejore mi actividad con este capital fresco y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
Don José sus planes es de comprar un vehículo para salir a vender a otras zonas más distantes y ayudar a su familia.
Choluteca, Honduras - Agosto del 2012
texts.en:
José is a very hardworking person and dedicated to his business.  He currently lives with his wife and 3 children.  He and his family live in Choluteca, in the south of Honduras.  His business is selling seeds, an activity that he has been realizing from his home for more than 10 years.

José will invest his loan into his business, buying peanuts, morro seeds, nuts, and other items.  He hopes to improve his enterprise with this fresh capital and to satisfy the needs of his customers.

José plans to buy a vehicle to use in selling his products in more distant locations, and to help his family.  

Choluteca, Honduras – August 2012

loans.use: to buy peanuts, morro seeds, nuts, and other items for his business.

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita is from Panta-on, Ozamis City. She is 42 years old. Marita is married and has five children. To make a living, Marita owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting bananas for sale. Marita has been engaged in her business for eight years and earns 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from these activities. 

Marita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In 2011, Marita joined GDMPC. She plans to use the income generated to expand her business, and a portion of it will be saved for her future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Chultem

texts.en:
Chultem is 44 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Arhangai province, Mongolia. His wife and eldest daughter are unemployed. His other daughter is a nurse, and his son is a college student. 

He is a watchman at petroleum import company and during his free time, he runs a taxi service with his own car. His income from the taxi service is from 10,000 to 20,000 Mongollian tugriks (MNT) a day. He bought land with his business profits, and his goal is to purchase a new car. 

He said: ''My son is attending college, and he needs my support more than ever.'' The total amount he is requesting is a 2,200,000 MNT loan to pay his son's college tuition.

He is a good-natured and hardworking man.

loans.use: To pay his son's college tuition

loans.name: Jose Marcelino

texts.es:
Jose tiene 27 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Guadalupe, la cual se encuentra en al norte de nuestro país y se caracteriza por  en especial el cultivo de plátano, entre otros, asimismo existen atractivos turísticos como "Pakatnamú", "Farfán", "Caracoles", Huaca "Singán”, Templete de Limoncarro, Pampas de Jesús, entre otros. Jose vive al lado de su esposa y de sus 2 pequeños, a quienes adora con todo el corazón y por quienes da la vida con tal de darles un buen futuro y sobre todo sena mejores que el. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecinos de su barrio, así como también comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz Chaufa”. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos jose solo estudio hasta el sexto grado de educación primaria.

Día a día Jose trabaja como chofer de mototaxi, ya que con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de su hogar, el se dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 clientes diariamente; el cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque tiene mucho cuidado al conducir y sobre todo es amable con los clientes .

Jose está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el  podrá realizar mantenimiento general a su vehículo, con lo cual el podrá tener un vehículo más seguro para transportar a los clientes y evitar accidentes, así de esta manera el podrá seguir trabajando y luchando día a día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a su hijo y poder comprar otra mototaxi para alquilarla”.
texts.en:
Jose is 27 years old and lives in the city of Guadalupe, which is located in the northern part of our country.  The area is known for its cultivation of bananas, among other crops, as well as its appealing tourist sites such as "Pakatnamú", "Farfán", "Caracoles", Huaca "Singán”, Templete de Limoncarro, and Pampas de Jesús, among others.  Jose lives with his wife and 2 small children, who he adores with all his heart and for whom he devotes his life to give them a good future and, above all, better opportunities than he has had.  When he has free time, he very much likes to play soccer with his friends and neighbors, as well as eat one of his favorite foods, “Arroz Chaufa”.  Given the few financial resources he’s had, Jose only studied until the sixth grade of his primary school education.

Day to day, Jose works as a rickshaw driver since he can meet his family’s needs with the fruits of this labor.  He works about 10 hours per day, tending to almost 20 customers on a daily basis.  He thinks that things are going well for him in his work because he drives very carefully and, above all, is very friendly with all the clients.

Jose is very thankful for the Kiva loans since, thanks to the help they have provided, he will be able to carry out general maintenance for his vehicle.  This will allow him to have a more secure vehicle with which to transport customers and to avoid accidents.  Therefore, he will be able to keep working and fighting every day to make his greatest dream a reality:  “To provide a good education for my children, and to be able to buy another rickshaw to rent out”.

loans.use: to do general maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 21 years old, single, ad has one child who attends school.  She lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala West region of Uganda. For the past three years, Betty has been working hard to manage her small charcoal selling business. 

To help expand her business, Betty is requesting a loan for 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda, which she will use to buy more charcoal to sell.  The loan will help Betty generate greater profits and it will help her enlarge her business. In the future she would like to open a retail shop. 

Betty is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life skills training.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Kamleh

texts.en: Kamleh, 36, is a housewife and mother for four children. To support her husband, she started a small clothing sales business at home selling traditional and embroidered dresses. Now, she has applied for this loan to increase her inventory of these clothing items and add a new collection to attract more people.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of clothing items.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna, 35, is married with two children and resides in Sibutad. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She's been in this business for three years and each month she earns 3,000 PHP from the business.

Anna requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. In 2011, she joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Anna wants to build a house and to ensure her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 20-year-old university student. He is majoring in Sociology and is still in his earliest years. He applied for this loan to be able to pay for the registration and semester fees so he can continue and get his B.A. degree.

loans.use: to pay for registration and semester fees.

loans.name: Vanesa

texts.es:
Vanesa es soltera y tiene un hijo pequeño, vive en la casa de su madre ocupando solo una habitación, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja atendiendo un puesto de dulces dentro de un colegio trabajando por más de cinco horas al día por las tardes y por la mañana estudio diseño grafico en un instituto, con lo que gana debe cubrir sus gastos de educación, alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una computadora portátil ya que le será de mucha ayuda en sus estudios.
El sueño de Vanesa es mejorar sus ingresos y poder independizarse para darle más comodidad a su hijo y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Vanesa is single and has a small son. She lives in her mother’s house, where she occupies just one room, and the house is located in the Alto San Pedro area of the city of La Paz.

Vanesa currently works in a sweet stall in a school. She works for more than five hours each day in the evenings, and in the mornings studies graphic design in a school. She therefore has to cover her education and food expenses, as well as paying for basic services for her family.

Vanesa’s dream is to improve her income and become independent, which will give her son a more comfortable life and improve her own quality of life. This is the second time that she has requested a loan from IMPRO, and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for her studies.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en: Liza is known as the responsible mother of five children. She endures hardship in managing her piggery business for the good future of her children and wishes to have a larger income through her business. For this purpose, she is applying for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy feed, medicine and vaccines. Through the loan, she hopes to improve her business as well as to receive a higher income.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicine and vaccines.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en: Iman, 23, is single and lives with her family. She is a university student who has decided to depend on herself. She has applied for this loan to pay her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Danila

texts.en:
Danila is 46 years old, married, and has five children. She works very hard to provide for them. She operates a variety store from 6 AM to 8 PM.   

Danila is requesting a loan for 12,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase powder, juice, soap, biscuits, shampoo, and candies. She is hoping that the loan will improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase powder, juice, soap, biscuits, shampoo, and candies.

loans.name: Kulnasiyna

texts.ru:
Кулнасийне 50 лет, воспитала 6 детей. Кулнасийна работает поваром в местной школе и в качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении  13 лет занимается полеводством  и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS ). Благодаря упорному труду Кулнасийны в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется 2 головы крупного рогатого скота с приплодом, 15 голов мелкого рогатого скота, 2 лошади, ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 6,000 сом (KGS). Доходы от хозяйства позволили Кулнасийне оплачивать обучение для своих детей. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кулнасийна обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку 2 коров и 8 голов мелкого рогатого скота для откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Кулнасийна планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса посредством покупки земельного участка.
texts.en:
Kulnasiyna is 50 years old and has raised 6 children. She works as a cook in a local school and, as a supplementary source of income for her family, cultivates crops and raises livestock, having started her business 13 years ago with a sum of 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Kulnasiyna's hard work, her herd presently includes 2 cows with offspring, 15 goats and sheep, as well as 2 horses, while the monthly income from her business amounts to roughly 6,000 som (KGS). Kulnasiyna's business profits have allowed her to pay for her children's education.

In order to continue developing her business, Kulnasiyna has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) to purchase 2 cows and 8 sheep or goats for fattening and resale. She plans to reinvest her profits from this loan into her business by purchasing a plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy merchandise such as cuts of fabrics and new and used blouses to sell

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
Humbert, es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de su padre ocupando solo una habitación, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona  Achachicala de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como empleado en una empresa privada por más de ocho horas al día ya que con lo que gana debe ayudar en los pagos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una computadora ya que desea estudiar computación y le será de mucha ayuda en sus estudios.
El sueño de Humberto, es independizarse para tener más comodidad y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Humberto is single and has no children. He lives in his father’s house where he occupies just one room, and the house is located in the Achachicala area of the city of La Paz.

Humberto currently works for a private company, where he spends more than eight hours per day. He uses the money he earns to help his family with food expenses and basic necessities.

Humberto needs a loan to buy a computer, as he would like to study IT and this will really help him with his studies. His dream is to become independent, so he can be more comfortable and improve his quality of life. This is the first time that he has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a computer for his studies.

loans.name: Sukanti

texts.en:
Sukanti is a 28-year-old widow living with her father-in-law, mother in law, and a son, age 5 years. 

After her husband’s death she wanted to help her father in law financially so she started making items prepared from wool. She is engaged in making tablecloths, sweaters, dolls, wall hangings, hand bags, etc., from which she earns 5,000 INR per month. She sells these items to the dealers of handicrafts and in the exhibitions. She has four years of experience in this business. She also knows how to stitch dresses.
 
She has a plan to enhance her business by making these items in greater numbers and purchasing a sewing machine for preparing dresses. She wants to start a small training school where she can give training to the females of her village for preparing items made of wool and dress stitching.

She has requested a loan amount of 25,000 INR for purchasing a sewing machine and fabrics. She has a dream to provide the best education to her son in his initial schooling days and save some money for her future.

loans.use: to pay for a sewing machine and fabrics.

loans.name: Budhiram

texts.en:
Budhiram is a 25-year-old differently able person. He is living with his parents and his younger brother, age 23. 

He is pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Arts. Along with this he is doing seasonal business like vegetables and non-timber forest products such as mahua. He has four years of experience in this field. In this way, he earns 2,000 to 2,500 INR in a month. 

He has planned to start a fertilizer shop in the village. There is no fertilizer shop near his village and people go to a market nine kilometers away for purchasing fertilizers. The main occupation of the village people is agriculture, so he says a fertilizer business is a suitable business for him. He says that he can earn 4,000 to 5,000 INR per month by selling fertilizers in his shop and make his family happy.
 
He has requested a loan of 30,000 INR to start a fertilizer shop in his village. He has good knowledge in this business and he has a good relationship with the villagers. He hopes to purchase a bike, so that he can travel easily and grow his business.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers and vegetables for his shop.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel, 39, has been operating his retail shop in Nakuru town for the past three years and it has been profitable. He is married to Miriam and they have three children.

This will be his second loan from KADET Ltd and he plans to buy more stock of cereals for resale. He also plans to buy more baking flour, cooking oil, sugar and rice.

In the future, Samuel hopes to grow his business, make more income and to be able to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy cereals, baking flour, cooking oil, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is 27 years old and married. He works full-time in the construction business. He also has a small business at home selling blankets and bed covers. Usually his wife handles the business while he is at work. 

Fadi is requesting a loan, which he will use to increase his quantity of blankets and purchase a new collection.  This loan will help him expand his retail business.

loans.use: to purchase bed covers and blankets.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 34 years old and the mother of five children who range in age from 7 to 15. She earns a living by selling clothes, and is requesting this loan to buy more clothing to sell to her customers. She will use the profits she earns from her business to buy a house.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lydia's Group

texts.en:
Lydia's group is comprised of three hardworking women. Lydia is 23 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala West region of Uganda. For the past five years, Lydia has been working hard to manage her salon, where she plaits and styles women's hair. 

To help expand her business, Lydia has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a steamer and hairstyling materials like gels and cosmetics to sell. This will help Lydia to generate greater profits and will help her own her salon rather than rent. Lydia hopes that, in the future, she will be able to build a house. 

Lydia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy a steamer and hairstyling materials like gels and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Nada, 33, is a conservative woman and she has asked her husband, who works as a security guard, to take her place in the photo.

After her husband's retirement, he started working as a security guard to be able to support his four kids. Nada decided to help her husband so she started a small home-based business selling household goods. Now, she wants to get more goods to increase her profits, as well as to start distributing to the home products and houseware store. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to increase her stock of household goods in order to increase her profits.

loans.name: Exequias

texts.es:
Don Exequias es una persona muy trabajadora dedicada a su negocio actualmente vive con su esposa y 5 hijos y vive en Choluteca al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la venta de refrescos actividad que realiza en su casa de habitación desde hace mas de 10 años.
Don Exequias el préstamo lo invertirá en su negocio en la compra refrescos y churros. El espera que mejore su actividad con el capital fresco y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
Don Exequias sus planes es de comprar una propiedad y ayudar a su familia.
Choluteca, Honduras - Agosto del 2012
texts.en:
Exequias is a very hard-working person who is devoted to his business.  He currently lives with his wife and five children in Choluteca in southern Honduras.

His business is selling soft drinks, which he has been doing at his house for over ten years.

Exequias will use the loan to invest in his business by purchasing soft drinks and churros.  He hopes to improve his business activity with fresh capital and to satisfy his customers’ needs.

Exequias plans include buying a property and helping his family.

Choluteca, Honduras – August, 2012

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and churros for his business.

loans.name: Dasarathi

texts.en:
Dasarathi is a 23-year-old physically challenged person living with his parents, his grandmother and his younger sister, aged 20, in a village of Odisha. 

He has a variety shop in his home. He sells, incense sticks, soap, shampoo, mouth refresher and vegetables (parwal, brinjal, cabbage, cauliflower, ladies finger, cucumber, tomato, bitter gourd, etc.) in his shop. He has been involved in this activity for six months. He purchases the vegetables twice a week from the local market, which is nine kilometers from his village. He earns 1,500 to 2,000 INR per month from his business. The village people are benefited by purchasing vegetables at their village. 

He wants to add some new product lines (tooth paste, tooth brushes, toffees, biscuits, potatoes, onions, etc.) for his shop. He has requested a loan of 20,000 INR to purchase the above products so that he can meet his customers' demands and he can earn 3,000 to 4,000 INR in a month from this business. He has a dream to make a house for his family and pay for his sister’s marriage.

loans.use: to purchase new product lines for his variety shop.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a mixed farmer in Olkalau town where he plants cash crops to sell. He also rears livestock and it has been profitable.

This will be his fifth loan and he plans to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and seeds for planting during this planting season. He also plans to buy animal feed. With the anticipated income he plans to pay his school fees.

In the future, John hopes to improve his farming business and thereby make more income.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and animal feed.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 40 years old, married, and has two children.She operates a grocery store, which she has been doing for 14 years.

Jane is requesting her second loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase assorted vegetables and fruits for stock in her business. She hopes to secure a permanent place for her business.

loans.use: to purchase assorted vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Kuña Pora Group

texts.es:
El comité  Kuña Pora se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santa Rosa. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas y cría de animal. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo.
La sra.Blanca una de las intergrantes de entre estas 10 mujeres, se dedica al igual que las demas a la compra, cría y venta posterior de animales; con esta actividad ella ayuda a los ingresos económicos de su familia.
Solicita el crédito para comprar animales, alimentarlos y luego venderlos.
texts.en:
The Kuña Pora committee was created by a group of neighbours from the city if Santa Rosa. All the committee members carry out their activities independently, such as selling and breeding farm animals. The members formed a group that is very united and capable of carrying out activities further promoting their comradeship.

Blanca is one of the 10 women in this group. Like the other members in the group, she buys, breeds, and then sells farm animals. With this activity, she contributes to the economic earnings within her family.

She's requesting the credit to buy farm animals, feed them, and then sell them.

loans.use: to buy farm animals, raise them and then sell them.

loans.name: Yohana Lizzeth

texts.es:
La Señora Yohana es una persona muy trabajadora actualmente vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos, Ella y su familia actualmente viven en el municipio de el Triunfo departamento de Choluteca donde hay que recorrer muchos kilómetros para poder llegar a su comunidad. Ella se dedica a su negocio propio venta pollos y refrescos.
Doña Yohana el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de pollo y refrescos, Ella espera que al finalizar el invierno pueda tener un buen capital. Ya que es una zona muy productiva. Y tener más producto y poder crecer en este tipo de negocio.
A Doña Yohana le gustaría Seguir trabajando duro para darles a sus hijos la mejor educación y que sean personas de bien para poder ayudar a su familia.
Choluteca 12 de agosto del 2012
texts.en:
Yohana is a very hardworking person and lives with her husband and her two children. She and her family are living in the municipality of Triunfo, in the department of Choluteca where one has to travel many kilometers to reach her community. 

She has her own business selling chicken and beverages. Yohana needs a loan in order to buy chicken and soft drinks. She is hoping that when winter is over she will have good earnings since she is in a very profitable area, and to be able to have more products and to be able to grow in this business. 

Yohana would like to continue working hard in order to give her children the best education so that they become good people in order to be able to help the family.

loans.use: to buy chicken and beverages for her business

loans.name: Sankar

texts.en:
Sankar is a 25-year-old differently able person living with his parents, younger brother (age 20) and two sisters (age 16 and 14). Sankar’s father is engaged in agricultural activity. He is the only earning person who runs the family. All his brothers and sisters are studying. 

Sankar wants to start a grocery shop and help his father financially in managing the family as his father is overburdened with the responsibilities of his family. 

Sankar has a plan to start a grocery shop where he will keep grains, lentils, edible oil, biscuits, wafers, salt and spices. He says that his father and brother will help him in stocking up the inventory in his shop and he will manage the shop. This will increase his monthly income.

He has requested a loan amount of 30,000 INR for establishing his grocery shop. He wants to provide his family the basic necessities of living and save some money for her sisters.

loans.use: to pay for grains, lentils, edible oil, biscuits, wafers, spices etc., to establish his grocery shop.

loans.name: Jayanti

texts.en:
Jayanti is a 35-year-old widow living with her four daughters, age 18, 16, 14 and 12 years. Her husband died one year ago because of brain malaria. After his death she was burdened with all her family responsibilities, so she started working as a daily labourer in a construction company. Her elder daughter, who had to drop out of college to share her mother’s burden, started tutoring the children in her village.
 
Jayanti has a plan to start a stationery shop in her village as there is no other stationery shop in her village and people have to travel to the market, which is five kilometers away from the village, for purchasing stationery items. She will keep notebooks, books, stencils, scales, pens, pencils and other stationery items in her shop.

She has requested a loan amount of 30,000 INR for establishing her stationery shop. 

She has a dream to allow her daughters to study and not leave their studies because of financial crises and save some money for their future.

loans.use: to pay for items like notebooks, stencils, pens, pencils, books, etc. for her stationery shop.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita, 62, is married with five children and resides in Sibutad, Zamboanga del Norte. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She's been in this business for four years and each month, she earns 7,000 PHP from the business.

Angelita has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. She joined GDMPC in 2011. In the future, Angelita wants to build a house and to ensure her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El Sauce es un bello municipio de occidente rodeado de montañas florecidas por la temporada de invierno donde lo típico es ver las humildes viviendas con techos de tejas.

En él hay muchas personas que se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras y luchadoras como es el caso de Juan Carlos, un señor de 55 años, casado, padre de familia el cual se dedica a laborar desde hace muchos años para llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar y para que no les falte nada a sus hijos.

Gracias a su trabajo y el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica al pequeño comercio hoy tiene su propia vivienda la que ha ido mejorando poco a poco y la que quiere ir ampliando para brindarles un buen patrimonio a sus hijos, por tal motivo solicita este crédito para la compra de ladrillos, cemento y arena con el fin de terminar de construir un cuarto para que sus hijos tengan mejores condiciones de vida y espacio.
Agradece a KIVA y Ceprodel por el apoyo brindado a través de estos préstamos que le han ayudado a mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y espera que en futuro le sigan ayudando.
texts.en:
El Sauce is a beautiful western municipality surrounded by flower-covered mountains in winter.  In El Sauce it is typical to see humble houses with tile roofs.  There are many people here who are known for being very hard-working and tenacious.

Such is the case with Juan Carlos, age 55.  His is married and has children.  He has worked for many years in order to bring home the daily bread and so that his children would lack for nothing.  Thanks to his work and support from his wife, who has a small business, he now has his own house.  He has been improving the house little by little.

He wants to expand the house in order to give his children a good legacy.  That is why he is requesting this loan to buy bricks, cement, and sand.  He will use these materials to build a room so that his children have space and better living conditions.

He is grateful to Kiva and Ceprodel for the support given through these loans.  The loans have helped him improve his family’s living conditions.  He hopes that in the future they will continue helping him.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like bricks, cement, and sand.

loans.name: Madelin Suyapa

texts.es:
La joven Madelin de 21 años de edad, es madre soltera tiene una hija que depende de ella, se dedica desde hace tres años al negocio de pulpería y venta de cosméticos, en su casa de habitación, Ella vive con su madre y dos hermanos, ubicado en la comunidad de Nacaome, al sur de Honduras. Madelin es una joven emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante en su negocio como también en sus estudios universitarios.
Madelin esta solicitando el préstamo de 5,000.00 lempiras para comprar frescos, abarrotería, dulces para la chiclera, agua y pollo. Con el apoyo de este préstamo ella desea surtir un poco más su negocio ya que necesita capital de trabajo para aumentar su inventario y vender más, para tener más ganancias y mejorar su condición de vida.
 Madelin su sueño es que su hija se crezca sana y terminar sus estudios de la universidad.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Agosto del 2012.
texts.en:
Madelin is 21 years old. She is a single mother of a daughter who depends on her. Three eyars ago she opened a small grocery store in her house where she also sells cosmetics. She lives with her mother and two brothers in the community of Nacaome in southern Honduras. Madelin is an enterprising young woman who wants to get ahead in her business and in her college studies.

Madelin is asking for a loan of 5,000.00 lempiras to buy beverages, produce and candies, water and chicken for her business. With the support of this loan, she wants to stock her business a little more because she needs working capital to increase her inventory and sell more. This way, she will have more profit and will improve her quality of life.

Madelin's dream is for her daughter to grow up healthy and to finish her college studies.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - August, 2012.

loans.use: to buy beverages, produce, candies, water and chicken for her business.

loans.name: Jagannath

texts.en:
Jagannath is a 29-year-old differently able person living with his parents, his wife and a daughter, age 8 months. 

He owns and manages a dairy farm where he has three buffaloes. He sells five litres of milk per day and earns 3,000 INR per month. His monthly income is very little for a family of five persons.

He wants to purchase two Jersey cows for his farm as there is a greater demand for cow’s milk in his village. He also has a plan to repair the shed for his cattle and make it big.

He has requested a loan amount of 30,000 INR for purchasing two cows and renovating the shed. In future, he wants to grow his farm and sell more milk products like yogurt, butter, etc.

He has a dream to give a better quality life to his family and save some money for his daughter's future.

loans.use: to buy two cows and renovate his cow shed.

loans.name: Arkan

texts.en:
Arkan 28 years old and married.  He is a youth client from Iraq. He is the only provider for the family.  Arkan owns a small shop selling miscellaneous home items such as glassware and kitchenware. He established his business in 2008 and has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a youth loan for $3,000, which he will use to buy a generator and install rolling shutters and an external ceiling for his shop. He is aiming to expand his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a generator and install rolling shutters and an external ceiling for his shop.

loans.name: Martín Antonio

texts.es:
Nosotros los Sauceños somos pinoleros Nicaragüenses por gracia de Dios.
Así es Martín Antonio un nativo  de corazón, es un señor de 66 años, casado, muy cristiano que educó a sus hijos de la mejor manera con buenos principios morales y religiosos y que hoy son personas de bien, independientes los cuales tienen su propio hogar.

Don Martín tiene la meta de terminar de construir la cocina y el baño de su vivienda por lo que en este momento necesita un crédito para la compra de ladrillos, cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra, con el fin de tener una vivienda digna con todas la condiciones adecuadas para él y su esposa, además para cuando lleguen sus hijos de visita brindarles condiciones adecuadas.

A pesar de que es una persona de escasos recursos tiene la visión de salir adelante, de mejorar su nivel de vida y espera que KIVA y Ceprodel le ayuden a cumplir sus sueños de ver su casa terminada con el apoyo de este crédito donde le agradecerá por esta ayuda incondicional que ofrecen a las personas de escasos recursos.
texts.en:
Martín Antonio is 66 years old, married, and very Christian. He educated his children in the best possible way with good moral and religious principles. His children are of good character and living independently with their own homes.

Martín set a goal to finish building the kitchen and bathroom of his house, which is why he needs the credit to buy bricks, cement, sand and hire manual labor to have a dignified home with all the adequate conditions for his wife and him. Also to provide his children with adequate conditions when they visit.

In spite of having scare resources, he has the vision to get ahead, to improve his quality of life, and hopes that KIVA and Ceprodel (MFI) help him realize his dream to see his house finished with the help of this loan. He's thankful for the unconditional support offered to people with scarce resources.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand and pay for manual labor.

loans.name: Frazia

texts.en: Frazia, 30, is married with two children. She sells vegetables and has been in this business for 10 years. With the loan, she wants to buy more vegetables for resale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Elham

texts.en: Elham is a 22-year-old conservative married woman who asked that her husband appear in this photo in her place. Her husband serves in the military, and is studying at the university to get a BA degree in Law. She has applied for this loan to support her husband's studies and pay for his registration fees so he can get this degree and continue on to get a Master's degree, which will help him to get a promotion and a higher rank at work.

loans.use: to pay for her husband's school fees.

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.en:
Clarisse is 22 years old, married, and has one child. She sells fruits, which she has been doing for a few years. 

Clarisse is requesting a loan, which she will use to add more types of fruits to sell, such as tree tomatoes and oranges. She will use the profits from her business to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase fruits to sell.

loans.name: Noe Ivan

texts.es:
Noe tiene 36 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida y sus cinco hijos. Desde la edad de 10 años, él trabaja en la agricultura, su papá le enseño desde muy pequeño. Hoy en día, él también les enseño a sus hijos. Además, de la agricultura don Noe es sastre, pues su compañera de vida se dedica a eso y al detectar que ella sola no era suficiente para satisfacer la demanda, Noe decidió aprender para ayudarle y tener mejores ingresos. 

Ellos se levantan muy temprano, para elaborar el desayuno a sus hijos; para que se vayan a la escuela y ellos se quedan en la casa trabajando, debido a que ahí tienen el negocio.

Los productos que necesita para su negocio, los compra en una ciudad. Para llegar a ahí debe caminar a pie unos diez minutos, luego aborda dos autobuses hasta llegar a su destino.

El préstamo será destinado para la compra de cuatro sacos de abono, pesticidas y herbicidas. Con su esfuerzo logro sembrar sus cultivos; pero manifiesta que ya necesita el abono y con el préstamo podrá abonar a tiempo y lograr que su cosecha sea abundante a fin de obtener mejores ganancias. Su objetivo, es ahorrar para construir una casa de ladrillo, pues vive en una casa de bahareque y su otro proyecto de vida es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Noe is 36 years old He lives with his life partner and five children. He has worked in farming since he was ten years old, his father taught him when he was very young. Today he also teaches his children. Besides farming Noe is a tailor, well, his life partner does this and upon finding out that she alone was not able to keep up with the demand, Noe decided to learn in order to help her to have increased earnings.

They get up very early in order to prepare breakfast for the children who go to school while they stay at home working because they have the business there. The supplies that are necessary for the business he buys in the city. To get there he walks for about ten minutes and then takes two buses to get to his destination.

This loan will be used to buy four bags of fertilizer, pesticides and herbicides. Through his efforts he can grow his crops but he says he already needs the fertilizer and with the loan he could fertilize on time so his crop will be abundant and he will have better profit. 

His objective is to save in order to build a brick home because he lives in a home made from waddle and daub and his other life goal is for the children to finish their university studies.

loans.use: to buy four bags of fertilizer, pesticides and herbicides to have a more abundant crop

loans.name: Danelia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Danelia  es comerciante desde hace 22 años, posee su negocio de elaboración y ventas de hamacas artesanales, ella tiene su propio lugar de venta ubicado en los alrededores del malecón de Masaya, donde expone  las hamacas hecha a mano, pero también distribuye sus productos en el mercado  municipal de Masaya y Chinandega comenta que ya tiene sus clientes fijos que le compran por encargo.

  Actualmente doña Danelia  necesita comprar materia prima como  hilos para tejer y bolillos de maderas, es lo que mas esta necesitando.

 Comenta que gracias a Dios ella ha podido salir adelante en su negocio y que esta muy agradecida por el apoyo que ha  obtenido por parte de  Ceprodel y se presenta a nuestras oficinas para solicitar un préstamo y comprar la materia prima que esta requiriendo
texts.en:
Danelia has worked as a retailer for the past 22 years. She has her own business where she prepares and sells hand-crafted hammocks, and has her own point of sale located in the outskirts of Malecón de Masaya. Daniela displays her hand-made hammocks here, but also distributes them in the Masaya and Chinandega town markets. She says that she has regular customers who place orders with her.

Daniela currently needs to buy raw materials, such as threads for weaving and wooden bobbins. This is what she needs the most. She says that thanks to God she has been able to get ahead in her business, and is very thankful for the support she has received from Ceprodel. She has come to the institution’s offices to request a loan, which she will use to buy the raw materials she needs.

loans.use: To buy threads for weaving and wooden bobbins.

loans.name: Khim

texts.en: Khim is 41 years old and lives in Kampong Chhnang province, where people specialize in making pots, cookers and other types of containers from clay. Kim engages in this type of work and also grows rice as a way to earn enough income to pay both for her family's daily sustenance and school fees for her two children. After she makes her containers, her husband transports them to a marketplace with his horse-pulled trailer. Recently, Khim has come to HKL for her third loan so that she can buy raw materials for her business. In the near future, she plans to use a portion of the income she earns to expand her business. She hopes that she will be a successful entrepreneur someday.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for a handicraft business.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
El señor Enrique y su esposo son originarios de Nuevo Laredo están casados y tiene dos hija que están actualmente cursando el ciclo escolar de la primaria.
Esta solicitando un crédito para cubrir los gastos de la escuela que son el pago de las inscripciones, compra de los útiles y uniformes.
El señor Enrique es empleado de una restaurant de un hotel, su esposo se ha dedicado el cuidado y atención de la familia. 
Desea brindarles a sus hijas una buena educación y calidad de vida para que en el futuro sean unas triunfadoras.
texts.en: Enrique and his spouse are natives of Nuevo Laredo. They are married and have two daughters who are currently enrolled in grade school. He is applying for a loan in order to cover the cost of school expenses, which include enrollment, supplies, and uniforms. Enrique is employed at a hotel restaurant, and his spouse works at home as a caretaker. He wishes to provide his daughters with a good education and quality of life so that in the future they will be high achievers.

loans.use: to pay school expenses.

loans.name: Carmen Elena

texts.es: Carmen de 57 años de edad es comerciante de medicamentos naturales, cosméticos, ropa, perfumería y similares, negocio que iniciara  desde el año 1999, cuando una de sus amigas la enseñó, pues antes de se emprendedora  trabajó como empleada de una empresa, sus principales productos son la ropa productos refrescantes, hidratantes, que controlan el peso y de belleza. A sus clientes ofrece estos artículos directamente sin intermediarios y en las modalidades de contado y a crédito. Ella ha estructurado una clientela fija, entre amas de casa, empleados independientes y trabajadores de empresas, que también le compran. En la actualidad su clientela se ha ampliado y el capital de trabajo con el que cuenta para responderle a sus pedidos no es suficiente, pues debe esperar recuperar el dinero producto de sus cuentas por cobrar; esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará productos hidratante, reductores de pesos y cosméticos, con los cuales dará respuesta a su mercado, aumentando así el volumen de sus ventas y la estructura de su negocio, porque finalmente ese es el objetivo que persigue.
texts.en:
Carmen, age 57, sells natural medicines, cosmetics, clothes, perfume, and similar items.  She started the business in 1999 when one of her friends taught her how.  Before being an entrepreneur, she worked as an employee in a company. 

Her main products are clothes, skin care products, moisturizers, products for weight control, and beauty products.  She offers these products directly to her customers without intermediaries.  She sells for cash and on credit.  She has established a fixed clientele of housewives, independent workers, and people who work in businesses who also buy from her.  

Her clientele has now grown, and she does not have enough working capital to respond to their orders.  Therefore she needs to wait to recuperate her money from her accounts receivable.

That is why she turns to a Kiva loan.  This is her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the loan to buy moisturizing products, weight reduction products, and cosmetics.  These products will respond to her market.  They will increase her sales volume and the structure of her business, which is the eventual objective she is pursuing.

loans.use: to buy moisturizing products, weight reduction products, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres ocupando solo una habitación, la casa esta ubicada en la zona La Portada de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como empleada por más de ocho horas al día en una empresa privada y en su tiempo libre confecciona chamarras de ambos sexos; ya que con lo que gana debe ayudar con los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de tela, forro e hilo por cantidad ya que desea elaborar chamarras por cantidad y venderlas para mejorar sus ingresos.
El sueño de Liz es mejorar sus ingresos y poder independizarse ya que desea tener más comodidad y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la cuarta vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Liz is single and has no children. She lives at the home of her parents which only has one room. The house is located in the District of La Portada in the city of La Paz.

Liz is currently employed at a private company where she works more than eight hours a day. In her spare time, she produces jackets for both sexes. With the money she earns, she is able to help pay for food and basic services for her family.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy fabric, lining, and thread in quantity so that she can produce jackets in bulk that she can sell. This will help to improve her earnings. Liz dreams of earning more income and becoming independent. She wants to be more comfortable and have a better quality of life.

This is the fourth time she has requested a loan from IMPRO, but the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy materials for producing jackets.

loans.name: Dilcia Marlene

texts.es: Dilcia tiene 37 años de edad, tiene dos hijos, vive en el municipio de Villanueva, Cortes. hace un año que Dilcia estableció su propio negocio de pulpería para vender productos de la canasta básica familiar, como especies, arroz, frijoles, manteca, azúcar, café, pan, productos de abarrotería, agua purificada, refrescos, etc. anteriormente ella trabajaba en una maquila y con sus ahorros logro establecer este negocio, que es su fuente de ingresos. Esta solicitando un préstamo de 11,000 Lempiras para surtir mas el negocio con productos de la canasta básica familiar, granos básicos, azúcar, pastas, agua purificada, refrescos etc. Con esta inversión va poder ofrecer a sus clientes variedad de productos y así mantendrá fija su clientela. Su sueño es siempre superarse mediante el crecimiento de su negocio y poder darle una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Dilcia is 37 years old and has two children. She lives in the town of Villanueva, Cortes.

One year ago, Dilcia opened her own store where she sells basic household products such as spices, rice, beans, lard, sugar, coffee, bread, groceries, distilled water, soft drinks, and other items. She previously worked at a factory and used her savings to start this business, which now serves as her source of income.

Dilcia is requesting a loan of 11,000 HNL so that she restock her business with more household products such as basic grains, sugar, pasta, distilled water, soft drinks, and other items. With this investment, she will be able to offer her customers a variety of products and thereby maintain an established clientele. Her dream is to always succeed at growing her business so that she can provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Gokula

texts.en:
Gokula is a 25-year-old physically challenged person living with his parents, wife, sister and two children, a son, age 2 years and daughter, age 3 years. 

He owns and manages a grocery shop where he sells lentils, wheat flour, rice, toffees, chocolates, detergents, salt, edible oil, spices, salts, etc. He earns 2,000 INR per month. His father helps him in bringing stock from the market, which is three kilometers away from his place.

He wants to renovate his shop and increase his inventory by purchasing more stock of what he sells. He has applied for a loan of 25,000 INR for purchasing grains, wheat flour, edible oil, and other household items that he sells in his shop.

He has a dream to give his parents a good life, get her sister married in a good family and save some money for his children’s future.

loans.use: to buy grains, wheat flour, edible oil, and other household items for his grocery shop.

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en: As the married mother of 10 children, Cornelia works hard to support her family. She earns a living by making items out of shells and has requested a loan for PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy the raw materials she needs to make more items to sell. She has sustained her business activities thanks in part to six previous loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her shell-crafting business.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is 36 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in Calilic, Sibutad. Beatriz owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting coconuts to earn a living. She has been in this business for five years and earns 4,000 PHP each month. 

Beatriz is requesting a loan for 6,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase farm chemicals. Beatriz been a member of GDMPC since 2011. In the future, she plans to save her profits in order to buy another plot of farm land.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals

loans.name: Walaa

texts.en: Walaa is from Iraq. He is a youth client who is 20 years old, single and lives with his six family members. His dad contributes to the family income, while Walaa owns and operates a barber shop. He established his business in 2010 and now has lots of experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community. He is requesting an $1,800 youth loan to buy an air-conditioner and a small generator. His goal is to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with a better life.

loans.use: to buy an air-conditioner and a small generator.

loans.name: Venuste
