Mary is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and a wider variety of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en:
Haidar is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 22 years old, married, and has one child. He is the only provider for the family.

Haidar owns a small restaurant. He established his business in 2006 after a long experience in this field. He has now four employees and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting $3000 as a youth loan to renovate the shop and install a rolling shutter. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate the shop and install a rolling shutter

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is from Iraq. He is a youth client at 26 years old, who is single and lives with a family of nine members, three of whom are employed. 
Alaa owns a small cafeteria for fast food. He established his business in 2007 after a good experience in the fast food business. He has two employees and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting $2400 as youth loan to install rolling shutters and buy a refrigerator. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to install rolling shutters and buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Sara Pilar

texts.es:
SARA PILAR TIENE 53 AÑOS DE EDAD ES MADRE SOLTERA TIENE DOS HIJOS, VIVE CON LOS HIJOS EN LA CIUDAD DE VENTANAS PROVINCIA DE LOS RIOS.

ES INTEGRANTE DE LA VRC 30 DE JULIO, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN RECINTO ZAPOTAL NUEVO, PERTENECE AL CANTÓN VENTANAS SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRÍCOLAS.

SARA PILAR  SE DEDICA  A LA AGRICULTURA A LA SIEMBRA DE ARROZ, FRÉJOL Y MAÍZ. SOLICITA EL CRÉDITO PARA COMPRAR INSUMOS, FERTILIZANTES UREA, ABONOS, LÍQUIDO MATA MONTE.

LAS COMPRAS Y LAS VENTAS DE LOS PRODUCTOS LAS REALIZARÁ EN LA CIUDAD DE VENTANAS CADA 15 DÍAS. CON LA AYUDA DEL CRÉDITO PODRÁ COMPRAR LOS INSUMOS.

ENFRENTA DESAFÍOS CÓMO LAS PLAGAS, LANCHA EN LOS CULTIVOS. EL SUEÑO ES TENER MÁS INGRESOS. EN EL TIEMPO LIBRE LE GUSTA PASEAR.
texts.en:
Sara Pilar is 53 years old and a single mother of two children.  She lives with her children in the city of Ventanas, de Los Rios Province. 

Sara Pilar is a member of the communal back "30 de Julio" (30th of July), which is located in the Zapotal precinct, a part of Ventanas Canton.  The members make their livings in agriculture. 

Sara Pilar makes her living in agriculture.  She plants, rice, beans and corn.  She is requesting the loan to purchase supplies: fertilizers, urea, compost and liquid Mata Monte (an herbicide). 

Sara Pilar purchases her supplies and sells her products in Ventanas every two weeks.  With the help of the loan, she will be able to purchase more supplies. 

She faces challenges, like pests and fungus, in her crops.  Sara Pilar's dream is to have a greater income.  In her free time, she likes to go for walks.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, urea, compost and liquid Mata Monte (an herbicide).

loans.name: Isidro 	Jr.

texts.en:
Isidro is a 34-year-old fisherman from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. He is a married man and a father of six young children ages 16, 14, 12, 9, 7 and three years old. Isidro has been in the fishing business for more than fourteen years now. This is the source of his daily income which he uses for the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of his children.

Isidro is asking for a loan worth 13,000 PHP to buy new fishing nets, fuel and for the maintenance of the fishing boat. With this loan, Isidro will be able to increase his daily catch thus allowing him to sell more fish to the market.

In the future, Isidro wants to improve his business so that it will generate more revenue necessary for the needs and expenses of the family.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, fuel and for the maintenance of the fishing boat

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles has practiced farming in the town of Olkalou for the last five years with very good income.

This is his sixth loan with Kadet Ltd. He paid his previous loans well and in good time. He will use the loan to purchase a cow.

He hopes to diversify and become a dairy farmer.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda tiene 48 años, está casada con Moisés, con quien tiene cinco hijos, pero ahora sólo viven con dos de ellos: Shirley y Mayra.
Su negocio es la crianza de cuyes desde hace 3 años. “Fue una buena idea incursionar en la crianza de cuyes al por mayor y menor, aunque el comienzo me resultó algo difícil”, menciona. Ella sabe que con esfuerzo y voluntad todo resulta, ha comenzado a mejorar su granja con cuyes de mejor raza para poder venderlos a un mayor precio. También se dedica al tejido, sus principales prendas son gorras de todo tamaño y color. 

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Telarmachay” y este es su décimo crédito con MFP. Promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas.
Hilda invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de cuyes hembras, para continuar con la crianza de estos animalitos. También comprará lana de diferentes colores.
texts.en:
Hilda is 48 years old. She is married to Moisés, with whom she has five children. Now, only two of their children, Shirley and Mayra, live with them.

Her business for the last three years has been raising guinea pigs. "It was a good idea to get into raising guinea pigs for wholesale and retail, although getting started was pretty hard for me," she says. She knows that everything happens through effort and will, and has started to improve her farm with better quality guinea pigs to be able to sell them at a higher price. She also works at knitting; her main garments are hats of all sizes and colors.

Hilda belongs to the "Telarmachay" communal bank, and this is her tenth loan with MFP. She promises to be punctual with her loan payments. Hilda will invest the requested money in the purchase of female guinea pigs, so she can continue breeding these little animals. She will also buy wool af different colors.

loans.use: to buy female guinea pigs, so she can continue breeding these little animals. She will also buy wool of different colors.

loans.name: Julia Emperatriz

texts.es:
JULIA TIENE 76 AÑOS DE EDAD ES CASADA TIENE 3 HIJOS DE 35, 40, 50 ELLOS SON CASADOSA LA SEÑORA VIVE CON EL ESPOSO.

SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE COMIDA EN UN LOCAL ADECUADO EN SU CASA. EL DIENRO DEL CREDITO NECESITA PARA INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE CEBOLLA, PAPAS, ACEITE, PAPAS DE RES Y DE CERDO, COLAS Y JUGOS. EL DINERO DEL CREDITO LE AYUDADO A INCREMETAR LAS VENTAS Y TENER UN POCO MAS DE GANANCIAS.

EL SUEÑO DE JULIA ES AUMENTAR LAS VENTAS. EN LOS MONTOS LIBRES LE GUSTA DESCANSAR.
texts.en:
Julia, 76, is married and has three children, ages 35, 40, and 50, who are all married.  She lives with her husband.

She works selling food in a place set up in her house.  She needs the loan money to invest in buying onions, potatoes, oil, fried potatoes, and soda and juice.  The loan money helped her increase her sales and have a little more profit.

Julia's dream is to increase her sales.  In her free time she likes to rest.

loans.use: to buy food

loans.name: Socorro

texts.es:
Con un préstamo de 12,720 pesos Socorro podrá comprar zapatos y ropa de segunda mano y cosméticos para su tienda de ropa y artículos de cuidado personal.
Socorro es casada, su esposo trabaja en la construcción y tienen 9 hijos de 25 años a 1 año. Los tres mayores trabajan y ayudan en la casa los demás estudian en la escuela primaria y secundaria, a excepción del de 4 y 1 año.

Socorro desea que su negocio crezca y venda más, para así poder agregarle dos nuevas habitaciones a su casa.
texts.en:
With a loan of 12,720 pesos Socorro will be able to purchase shoes, second hand clothing and cosmetics for her store, which sells clothes and personal care items.

Socorro is married and her husband is a construction worker. They have nine children ranging from 1 to 25 years old. The three oldest work and help at home and the rest are in primary and secondary school, except for the 4 year-old and 1 year-old.

Socorro wants her business to expand and to sell more so that she will be able to add two new rooms to her house.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, second hand clothing and cosmetic for her store, which sells clothing and personal care items.

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.en:
Alphonse is 27 years old and sells foodstuffs. He is requesting a loan so he can buy more rice and fish for resale.

If he is able to accumulate profits from his business, he plans to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs for resale.

loans.name: Margot

texts.es:
Margot tiene 33 años, está casada con Elmer, con quien tiene dos hijos: Kenler de 15 y Ángel de 4 años. Su casa es propia y se ubica en una zona rural.
Ella es una mujer agricultora, siembra arvejas y flores (gladiolos), los cuales, desde sus primeros años como agricultura, siempre le dieron buenos resultados. “He sembrado una bolsa y media de arvejas, las que cosecharé en mayo, obtendré 40 sacos”, comenta. Asimismo, produce gladiolos, en este caso sus compradores la visitan hasta su chacra para negociar la venta. Según dice, sus ventas son rentables, porque  los compradores adquieren sus productos al instante y se lo llevan hacia otras ciudades. De esa manera, Margot obtiene ingresos que le permiten educar a sus pequeños hijos y ofrecerles algunos gustos. Ahora continuará con sus sembríos de arvejas, aprovechando las próximas lluvias.

Este es su crédito número 8 con MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. “Los Picaflores de Patay”, es el nombre de su banco comunal, donde es una socia responsable en las actividades y pagos.
Con el dinero de este préstamo invertirá en la compra de bolsas de semillas de arvejas (con 1800 soles), el dinero restante le servirá para adquirir fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Margot is 33 and is married to Elmer, with whom she has two children: Kenlar, who is 15, and Ángel, who is 4.  They own their own home, which is located in a rural area in Peru.

She is a farmer, planting peas and flowers (gladiolas), which, from her early years in agriculture, always gave good results.

She says, "I plant a bag and a half of peas.  When I reap in May, I will get 40 bags."  She also produces gladiolas.  Her buyers visit her farm to negotiate sales.  She says sales are profitable because buyers snap up her products and then take them to other cities. Thus, Margot has income that allows her to educate her young children and affords them some luxuries. For now she will continue on with her crops of peas, taking advantage of the next rains.

This is her 8th loan with Kiva Partner Microfinanzas Prisma.  She promises to be punctual with her monthly payments.  "The Hummingbirds of Patay" is the name of her community bank, where she is a responsible partner in her activities and payments.

She will invest loan proceeds in the purchase of bags of pea seeds and the remaining money will be used to buy fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy bags of pea seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Joselyn Sofia

texts.es:
Joselyn es una joven de 20 años, es soltera, vive con sus padres y hermanos en la ciudad de Chincha, a pesar de ser tan joven ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar para apoyar a sus padres y solventar sus gastos, no ha podido estudiar una carrera profesional pero sueña con poder hacerlo muy pronto, en sus ratos libres le gusta relajarse escuchando un poco de música.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, Joselyn puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta y alquiler ropa, calzado y accesorio, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana ella inicia su labor y puede trabajar un promedio de 10 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por los modelos novedosos en prendas de vestir y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Joselyn se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería, tales como vestidos, zapatos, cartera, entre otros artículos; de esta manera Joselyn tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido, con ello espera poder incrementar sus ventas y aumentar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para que en un futuro no muy lejano  pueda ampliar su negocio y así junto a su familia desea poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
Joselyn is a 20-year-old young woman. She is single and lives with her parents and siblings in the city of Chincha. Despite being so young, she is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person who greatly wants to succeed. Unfortunately, due to the need to work to support her parents and pay her expenses, she has not been able to study for a professional career, however she dreams of being able to do so very soon. In her spare time she enjoys relaxing by listening to a little music.

With great effort and enthusiasm, Joselyn started a small business selling and renting out clothes, shoes and accessories. Ever day from early in the morning she starts work and can work an average of 10 hours a day. She believes she is doing well because of her novel clothing fashions and  because of her friendly treatment of customers.

Joselyn is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, she will be able to purchase merchandise, such as dresses, shoes and handbags, among other items. In this way, she will have her business better stocked. Thus she expects to be able to increase her sales and income. This will help her expand her business in the very near future, so that, together with her family, she will be able to get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise, such as dresses, shoes, handbags, etc.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is still married to James and their one child has already completed college. She is still operating the cereal shop and her monthly income has now increased to 20,000 shillings.

This is her second loan with KADET LTD and she will still use the amount to purchase more stock for her cereals business like beans, maize, and rice. She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.


She hopes to open a big general shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy  two sacks of beans, one sack of black beans and one sack of green grams.

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en:
Wilfred is still marred to Pamela and supports his mother and their child. He is still operating his retail shop and his income has now increased and is able to meet his family’s needs. 

This will be his third loan with KADET LTD and he plans to use this loan amount to add more stock of items in his retail shop like rice, sugar and tea leaves for resale. He will use the anticipated profits to plough back into the business by buying more stock and repaying his loan. 

He hopes to open a supermarket in future.

loans.use: To add more stock like rice, sugar and tea leaves for sale.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia tiene 45 años, junto a su pareja tiene tres hijos: Vanesa de 22, Romario de 16 y Ada de 14 años. 
Se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 20 años. Al lado de su pareja se dirigen al campo para limpiar y fertilizar sus cultivos. Sus principales productos constan de papas, maíz, arvejas, flores (gladiolos) y alfalfa. Pero a lo que le da mayor prioridad es a las flores y a las arvejas, por la rapidez de su crecimiento y por la rentabilidad en sus ventas. Cuando cosecha traslada toda su producción hacia el mercado mayorista de la ciudad, donde vende con facilidad sus productos. “Hace 5 años me contacté con compradores de Lima (ciudad capital), quienes se llevan toda la cosecha, pagando puntualmente”, comenta contenta. Ahora piensa iniciar una nueva siembra de arvejas.

Este es su préstamo número 6 con MFP y menciona que será puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Pertenece al banco comunal “Los Picaflores de Patay”, uno de los grupos más organizados de esta región.
Invertirá el dinero solicitado en dos bolsas de semillas de arvejas (con 1200 soles). Lo restante lo empleará en la compra de fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Lidia is 45 years old. Together with her husband, she has three children: Vanesa is 22, Romario is 16, and Ada is 14.

She has worked in agriculture since she was 20 years old. Alongside her husband, she spends her time in the country, weeding and fertilizing her crops. Her main products consist of potatoes, corn, peas, flowers (gladiolus), and alfalfa, but the flowers and peas are her main priority because of their rapid growth and the profitability. When she harvests, she transports all her production to the wholesale market in the city, where she sells it easily. "Five years ago, I made contact with buyers in Lima, the capital city, who took the whole harvest, paying on time," she says happily. Now, she is planning to start a new pea planting. 

This is her sixth loan with MFP, and she mentions that she will be punctual with her loan payments. She belongs to the "Picaflores de Patay" ["Hummingbirds of Patay"] communal bank, one of the most organized groups in the region. She will invest 1200 soles (PEN) of the requested money in two bags of pea seeds, and use the rest of the money to buy fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy two bags of pea seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase material and fabric for his factory making shirts and jerseys.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 49 years old, married to Alice and they are blessed with four children. His wife does not earn extra income, so he remains the sole bread-winner for the family. He operates a welding fabrication business and is currently running for eleven years. This business earns him a monthly income of 10,000 shillings.

This will be his fourth loan with KADET LTD and he would like to use it in the fabrication business to purchase more welding machines. He plans to use his anticipated profit to expand his business. 


He hopes to own a construction firm in the future.

loans.use: To add more machines for his welding business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 65 years old, a widower and a mother to three children. She is a dairy farmer and she has been in this business for the past five years with a monthly income of Kenya shillings 15,000.


This will be her first loan with KADET LTD and she plans to use the loan amount to extend her dairy-farming business by buying storage facilities and equipment to support her business. She plans to use the anticipated profits to stabilize and extend her business. 


She hopes to be able to raise her income so she can maintain her family successfully.

loans.use: to extend her dairy-farming business by buying storage facilities and equipment.

loans.name: Grison

texts.en:
Grison is now 49 years old and married to Irene, who is a housewife. They are blessed with five school-going children. He has been in business for 27 years, earning a monthly income of 60,000 shillings.

This will be his fifth loan with KADET Ltd. He wants the loan so to buy enough stock to supply bread to a local school.  He plans to use the anticipated profit to plough back into the business and hopes to start a bakery in future.

loans.use: To buy more bread which he will supply a local school.

loans.name: Bosco

texts.en:
Bosco, 28 years old, is married to Angela and they are blessed with one child. Angela is a salonist and so she assists in meeting the family's needs. Bosco operates a hardware business and owns an equity agency. Bosco has been in business for six years, earning a monthly income of 30,000 KES. 

This will be Bosco's first loan with KADET LTD, and he wants to use it to add float to his business and to purchase stock for his hardware. He hopes to use the anticipated profit to open an agent shop. 

Bosco hopes to be a prominent businessman.

loans.use: To add float and hardware stock

loans.name: Teresiah

texts.en:
Teresiah is a single lady blessed with three children. She is the sole breadwinner of her family. She has been in business for five years, earning a monthly salary of 100,000 Kenya shillings (KES).


This will be her first loan with KADET LTD and she will use the loan to purchase materials/fabric in bulk so as to be ready for her customer’s requests. She plans to invest the anticipated profit back into her business, as well as take care of her children. 

She hopes to own a shop selling furniture wares, bed covers, and loose covers in the future.

loans.use: to purchase materials/fabric for her clothing business in bulk.

loans.name: Johnny Jose

texts.es:
JOHNNY JOSE TIENE 41 AÑOS DE EDAD DE ESTADO CIVIL UNIÓN LIBRE TIENE UN HIJO, VIVE CON EL HIJO EN VENTANAS PROVINCIA DE LOS RIOS.

ES INTEGRANTE DE LA VRC 30 DE JULIO, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN RECINTO ZAPOTAL NUEVO, PERTENECE AL CANTÓN VENTANAS SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRÍCOLAS.

JOHNNY JOSE SE DEDICA  A LA AGRICULTURA A LA SIEMBRA DE ARROZ, FRÉJOL Y MAÍZ. SOLICITA EL CRÉDITO PARA COMPRAR INSUMOS, FERTILIZANTES UREA, ABONOS, LÍQUIDO MATA MONTE.

LAS COMPRAS Y LAS VENTAS DE LOS PRODUCTOS LAS REALIZARÁ EN LA CIUDAD DE VENTANAS CADA 15 DÍAS. CON LA AYUDA DEL CRÉDITO PODRÁ COMPRAR LOS INSUMOS AGRÍCOLAS.

ENFRENTA DESAFÍOS CÓMO LAS PLAGAS, LANCHA EN LOS CULTIVOS. EL SUEÑO ES TENER ÉXITO EN LA VIDA. EN EL TIEMPO LIBRE LE GUSTA PRACTICAR EL DEPORTE.
texts.en:
Johnny José, 41, is in a common-law marriage and has one child.  He lives with his son in Ventanas, in the province of Los Ríos.  He's a member of 30 de Julio Communal Bank, located in the Zapotal Nuevo area of Ventanas Canton, where the people make a living in agriculture.

Johnny José works in agriculture growing rice, beans, and corn.  He's requesting the loan to buy agricultural inputs, fertilizer, urea, manure, and liquid weedkiller.

He'll buy and sell his products in the city of Ventanas every two weeks.  With the help of the loan he'll be able to buy the agricultural inputs.

He faces challenges such as pests and the "lancha" fungus in his crops.  His dream is to be successful in life.  In his free time he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs, fertilizer, urea, manure, and liquid weedkiller

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is married to a businessman; they have seven children aged between one and sixteen. She sells milk, and is planning to get a loan for buying a cooler for milk storage. She plans to use the profits for paying school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy a milk cooler to use in the business of selling milk.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is now twenty-two years old, single and supports two members of her family.  She has been in the M-Pesa (money transfer) business for three years, earning a monthly income of 10,000 shillings.  


This is her second loan with KADET LTD and she wants to buy more phone accessories, mobile phone credit cards and add more mobile money transfer float with the loan given.  She plans to use the anticipated profit to expand her business.  


Her dreams are to open another M-Pesa in another area in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more phone accessories and credit cards as well as add more float for her business

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George, a 36-year-old father of two, is married to Jane, who supports him in his business. George has been a livestock farmer for three years, earning a monthly income of 28,000 KES. 

Now requesting his second loan from KADET LTD, he will buy more livestock such as cows, sheep and goats. He plans to use the anticipated profit to buy a piece of land as he dreams of becoming horticultural farmer.

loans.use: to buy more livestock such as goats, sheep and cows for his business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is now thirty-six years old, a mother to three children and she also supports three members of her family.  She operates a boutique business and does not have any other source of income other than this business.  She has been in business for six years now earning a monthly income of 28,050 shillings.  


This will be her second loan from KADET LTD and she will use the loan to buy more stock like ladies dresses, belts and children's clothes for resale. She plans to use the anticipated profit to buy a plot of land and construct a rental house.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Anny

texts.es:
Con un préstamo de 15,900 pesos Anny ha podido abastecer su tienda con artículos escolares para aprovechar la temporada de vuelta a clase y poder ofrecer a sus clientes una buena variedad de productos.

Anny es casada, su esposo es obrero en una fábrica de papitas fritas y otros productos fritos de este tipo. Tienen 2 niños de 4 años y 11 meses.
Anny es una mujer con visión de negocio, siempre procura abastecer su pequeña tienda con los productos que se demandan según la temporada. Aunque es una tienda pequeña a sus clientes les gusta visitarla por que siempre tiene un buen surtido.

Ella desea terminar la universidad, donde está estudiando administración de empresas y ampliar su negocio. Su sueño es ofrecer a sus hijos un hogar con ambiente seguro y poder suplir todo lo que ellos necesiten para crecer sanos  y estudiar.
texts.en:
With a loan for 15,900 pesos [DOP], Anny has managed to supply her store with school supplies to make the most of the back-to-school season and so offer her customers a good variety of products.

Anny is married.  Her husband works in a french-fries and fried-food factory.  They have two children, ages 4 years and 11 months.  Anny is a woman with a business vision.  She always tries to supply her small store with the products that are in demand according to the season.  Although it's a small store, her customers like to visit her because she always has a good assortment.

She wants to finish the university, where she's studying business administration, and expand her business.  Her dream is to give her children a home with a safe environment and to be able to give them everything they need to be healthy and to study.

loans.use: to supply her store with school supplies

loans.name: Florida Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLORIDA” iniciará el  primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Justina es la Presidenta Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de dulces, tejido de macramé de mantas, tienda de barrio, comercio de ropa, venta de peluches, venta de comida, venta de calzados, venta de café.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Justina es una integrante, ella indica que hace un año y medio que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su comadre que es socias de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de comida, ella nos cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió desde niña, cuando le ayudaba a su madre a realizarlo. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de maíz) que comprará de las vendedoras por mayor y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The "Florida" group is starting its first loan cycle with the organization Pro Mujer.  They are working with one of the organization's regional offices in Villa Adela.  The group is made up of eight members and is directed by a governing board where Justina is the President.  The members have developed various businesses which include: the making of macrame blankets, a neighborhood store, and the sale of various items including sweets, clothing, stuffed animal toys, food, shoes and coffee.

This loan will benefit the small businesses where Justina is a member.  She has been a member of Pro Mujer for a year and a half since she was invited by her godmother, who is one of the members of the institution.  Right now Justina has a business which sells food.  She says that she learned about this business since she was a girl, when she helped her mother to start it.

The loan she is receiving will be used to increase her capital (to buy corn), which she will buy from wholesale vendors and later sell at the markets in the city of El Alto.  This form of work permits Justina to generate income to support her family.  She is single and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Justina said she likes the health services.

loans.use: to buy corn

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is from Iraq. He is 47 years old, married, and has six children. He is the only provider for the family. 

Mohamad owns a small shop for electrical supplies. He established his business in 2010 and now he has one employee. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community. 

He is requesting a $2400 loan to buy a generator and a refrigerator. He also wants to increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy a generator and a refrigerator

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 34-year-old businessman who sells stationery in Mariakani. He is a married father of two children. He has been operating this business for the last three years with great success. 

This marks his second business loan from Kadet Ltd. to finance his business. He plans to purchase more text books, exercise books, geometrical sets and printing papers. 

He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business further. He hopes to have a bigger and more profitable business.

loans.use: To purchase more text books, exercise books, geometrical sets and printing papers

loans.name: Lilibeth Del Carmen

texts.es: Lilibeth de 20 años de edad, soltera, labora como docente en una escuela pública que atiende a personas mayores de edad en la primaria, estudia la carrera de ingeniería en sistemas por medio de una beca, solicita el crédito para la compra de una computadora ya que es una herramienta vital para el desarrollo de su carrera, si no tuviese el crédito le afectaría en el desempeño de su profesión en un futuro. Le interesa mucho su formación por que se identifica mucho con el campo laboral que le ofrece su carrera, le apasiona todo lo relacionado en el ramo de la informática el cual es importante para el buen ingreso de la familia ya que es una carrera muy prometedora. El mensaje que comparte es que Nicaragua tiene personas esforzadas y trabajadoras que necesitan recursos tecnológicos para desarrollarse en el área que más les guste, ella aportara sus conocimientos para el desarrollo de nuestro país.
texts.en:
Lilibeth, 20 years old, is single and works as a teacher in a public school for adults, who are at the primary school level. She is studying for a degree in systems engineering on a scholarship.  She is requesting a loan to purchase a computer because it is a vital tool for the development of her career. If she did not have the loan it would affect her future ability to work in her profession.

Lilibeth is very interested in the training she is receiving because she identifies strongly with the workplace she is preparing for. She is passionate about everything related to the field of computer science. This is an important field in which to earn a good income for the family, because it is a very promising career. The message that she is sharing is that Nicaragua has many hardworking people who need the technological resources to develop in the areas they find most enjoyable. She will contribute her knowledge to the development of our country.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca  de 59 años de edad es casada sus hijos son independientes, ella se dedica a la venta de pescado y camarón, Ella viaja a otra ciudad a vender sus productos y también vende en su casa. Ella radica en una comunidad de Amapala, Honduras.
Doña Francisca esta solicitando el préstamo de 15,000.00 lempiras para comprar pescado y camarón,  Con el apoyo de este préstamo ella desea mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
Doña Francisca su sueño es que su familia este muy bien en sus trabajos y negocios.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Agosto del 2012.
texts.en:
Señora Francisca is 59 years old, married and has grown children.  She makes her living selling fish and shrimp.  She travels to another city to sell her seafood and she also sells directly form her home.  Doña Francisca lives in the Amapala community in Honduras.
Doña Francisca is requesting a loan of 15,000.00 lempiras (USD $775) to purchase fish and shrimp.  With the help of the loan, she hopes to improve her income and her quality of life. 
Doña Francisca's dream is for her family to do well in their work and businesses. 
San Lorenzo, Honduras - August, 2012.

loans.use: to purchase fish and shrimp for her business.

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es:
Alvaro, es soltero y tiene un hijo que esta en etapa escolar, vive en casa de sus padres ocupando solo una habitación, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona San Antonio de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como empleado en una empresa privada realizando trabajos en arquitectura por más de diez horas al día ya que debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de materiales de construcción, como ladrillo, cemento, arena, estuco, vigas de madera  y otros para la  construcción de otra habitación ya que desea darle más comodidad a su hijo.
El sueño de Alvaro es mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Alvaro is single and has one school-aged son. He lives in his parents' home, occupying just one room. The house is located in the San Antonio area of the city of La Paz. 

Currently he works as an employee at a private company, doing architectural work for more than 10 hours a day, as he must cover expenses for food, education and payment of basic services.

He needs the loan in order to purchase construction materials such as brick, cement, sand, stucco, wooden beams and other supplies for the construction of another room, as he wishes to provide his son with more comfort.

Alvaro's dream is to improve his income and his quality of life.

This is the first time he has worked with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy bricks, cement, sand, stucco and other supplies for constructing an additional room.

loans.name: Señor De Los Milagros- Cajas Group

texts.es:
Buenos Días!, saludos de todos los peruanos.
El grupo  “Señor de los Milagros” está formado por 9 socios, están iniciando su segundo ciclo, el nombre que se pusieron se debe a que son devotos a este Santo.
Una de sus Socios es Isaura, de 56 años de edad, viuda y con 3 hijos, todos mayores de edad.
Ella se dedica a la venta de dulces, frutas, gaseosas, etc., en un espacio que acondicionó en su casa.
Sus principales clientes son los niños y  alumnos de la escuela que está ubicada al frente de su casa
En este negocio lleva 10 años y ella es su único sustento.
El préstamo lo utilizará en la compra de galletas, gaseosas, frutas, para poder surtir su negocio y generar más ingresos.
Isaura además de agradecer a las personas de todo el mundo que la apoyan para cumplir sus metas les dice: “Que sigan apoyando a todas las personas de bajos recursos”.
Isaura es la tercera de la izquierda, viste una chompa verde, pantalón rojo y lleva un sombrero tìpico de la región.
texts.en:
Good Morning!  Greetings from all the Peruvians.

Señor de los Milagros Group is made up of nine members who are beginning their second loan cycle.  They gave the group that name because all of them are devoted to to this saint.

One of their members is Isaura, 56, a widow with three adult children.  She works selling candy, fruit, soda, etc., in a space she set up in her house.  Her main customers are the children and students from the school across the street.  She has had this business for 10 years and it's her only support.

She'll use the loan to buy cookies, soda,  and fruit to be able to supply her business and generate more income.

In addition to thanking all the people who help her realize her goals, Isaura tells them: "Continue helping all the low-income people."

Isaura is the third from the left.  She's wearing a green sweater, red pants, and a hat that's typical of the region.

loans.use: to buy cookies, candy, snacks, and soda

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Lesbia Lizeth

texts.es:
La señora Lesbia de 27 años de edad, es soltera y tiene su propia casa en donde vive con su hermana, y su abuela, Ella vive con su familia en una comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 7 años al negocio de venta de pan y rosquillas su venta es en el mercado viejo y en la empacadora San Lorenzo.
Lesbia es una joven muy emprendedora y trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante. Ella esta solicitando 20,000.00 lempiras para compra de harina, leña, lácteos, y otra materia prima para sus rosquillas.
Lesbia con las ganancias del préstamo desea mejorar sus ingresos y su casa para poder ayudar a su familia.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Agosto del 2012.
texts.en:
Lesbia is 27 years old, single, and has her own home where she lives with her sister and grandmother. She lives with her family in a community in San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras. She has been working for 7 years selling bread and and doughnuts in an old market in San Lorenzo.

Lesbia is a very enterprising and hard-working young woman who wants to do well. She is requesting 20,000 lempiras to buy flour, wood, dairy products and other supplies for her doughnuts.

With the earnings from this loan, Lesbia wants to improve her income and her home to help her family.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - August 2012

loans.use: purchase flour, wood, dairy products and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Duo Rositas De San Bartolo Group

texts.es:
Historia duo Rositas de San Bartolo
Este duo esta conformado  por doña Gladis ella tiene 40 años de edad se dedica a la venta de  productos comestibles de consumo diario en san Bartolomé Milpas Altas, tales como aguas gaseosas, golosinas, pan, azúcar y fideos, huevos, y ha complementado su negocio con venta de leña,    ella tiene  tres hijos dos varones y una señorita todos están estudiando ya en básicos, doña Gladys esta solicitando el crédito para la inversión de en mas productos comestibles  ya que quiere aprovechar porque se acerca la feria de su pueblo y así lograr surtir mas su negocio su propósito es  que junto con su esposo logren ver que sus hijos terminen el año con éxito en sus estudios.
texts.en: Gladis, 40, is a member of the communal bank Duo Rositas de San Bartolo. She sells groceries such as water, sodas, sweets, bread, sugar, noodles, eggs, and wood in San Bartolomé Milpas Altas. She has three children, two boys and a girl, who attend elementary school. Gladis is requesting a loan to buy more groceries and increase her inventory because she wants to take advantage of the local fair, which will be held soon. Her goal is that she and her husband will be able to see their children complete the school year sucessfully.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, spaghetti and wheat for her grocery store.

loans.name: Iris Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora Iris de 32 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos que dependen de ella, su esposo vive en los Estados Unidos ya que fue en busca del sueño americano para ayudar económicamente a su familia, ella tiene casa propia y se dedica desde hace 6 años al negocio de venta de tortillas, golosinas, esta ubicada en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras.
Doña Iris esta solicitando el préstamo de 15,000.00 lempiras para comprar materiales como cemento, arena, grava y varillas para construir una pila en su casa, y comprar leña y maíz para elaborar las tortillas.
Doña Iris con el apoyo de este préstamo desea suplir la necesidad de financiamiento que ella necesita para llevar a cabo  sus proyectos.
 Doña Iris su sueño es tener una buena casa para que sus hijos estén bien.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Agosto del 2012.
texts.en:
Señora Iris is 32 years old. She is the mother of four dependent children. Her husband lives in the United States, since he went in search of his American dream to help his family economically. She has her own house and has been working for six months in a business where she sells tortillas and candies. It is located in the community of San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras.

Doña Iris is applying for the loan of 15,000 lempiras to buy materials such as cement, sand, gravel, and rods to build a sink in her home and to buy firewood and corn to prepare tortillas.

With the help of this loan, Doña Iris wants to cover her need for financing to complete her projects. Her dream is to have a good house so that her children will be well.

San Lorenzo, Honduras, August, 2012

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, and rods to build a sink and firewood and corn to prepare tortillas

loans.name: Juana Bertha

texts.es:
Doña Juana de 55 años de edad, es soltera vive con su sobrina en su propia casa ubicada en la comunidad de Nacaome al sur de Honduras, Ella se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de calzado para todas las edades al igual que también vende ropa, su negocio es en el mercado de Nacaome, sus ventas son de lunes a domingo  sus clientes que ha diario le visitan le prefieren por su atención y por la variedad de ropa y calzado que les ofrece, Doña Juana es una mujer que ha salido adelante sola sin apoyo de un esposo y se ha superado y ha crecido como persona y como comerciante.
Doña Juan esta solicitando el préstamo de 20,000.00 lempiras para comprar  calzado escolar y uniformes escolares ya que se acerca la época del día del niño y de las fiestas patrias en donde los padres compran estos productos a sus hijos.
Doña Juan con el apoyo de este préstamo desea suplir la necesidad de financiamiento que necesita para llevar a cabo la  inversión de su negocio y así mejorar las utilidades y también su condición de vida.
Doña Juana su sueño es que su sobrina tenga su propio negocio.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Agosto del 2012.
texts.en:
Juana, who is 55 years old, is single and lives with her niece in her own home located in the community of Nacaome in the south of Honduras. She has a business that buys and sells shoes for all ages, and also sells clothes. Her business is in the Nacaome market, and is open from Monday to Sunday. Her customers, who visit her daily, choose to buy from her due to the service she provides and the variety of clothes and shoes she offers. Juana is a woman who has done well on her own, without support from a spouse, and she has overcome challenges and grown as a person and as a business woman.

Juana is asking for a 20,000 lempiras loan to buy school shoes and school uniforms, since the season for children's day and parents' festivals are approaching, when parents buy these products for their children.

With the support of this loan, Juana wants to secure the finances needed to invest in her business and improve its usefulness, as well as her life circumstances.

Juana's dream is for her niece to have her own business. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - August 2012

loans.use: purchase school shoes and uniforms for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy backpacks, notebooks, shoes and school uniforms.

loans.name: Kendal Gabriel

texts.es: Kendal Gabriel, tiene la edad  de 21  años, está soltero,  vive con sus padres y dos hermanos, uno en la escuela y el otro en el colegio   actualmente. El con el crédito pretende comprar abono  para fertilizar bien el café  y fumigaciones  y ayudarse con la mano de obra. El tiene pensado abonar la plantación de café para poder obtener una mejor cosecha y un café más fértil y así  poder producir un poco mas y  poder generar más ganancias  y obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica . Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Kendal Gabriel, 21, is single and lives with his parents and two siblings; one is attending elementary school and the other attends secondary school at the present time.  He intends to use the loan to buy manure to fertilize the coffee well and to buy fumigation and help pay for labor costs.  He’s thinking about fertilizing the coffee plantation to obtain a better coffee harvest and a more fertile coffee so that he can produce a bit more and be able to generate more profits thus obtaining a better quality of life and economic stability. 

This is his first Fudecosur loan.  He’s had no previous loans with state banks and Fudecosur has given him loan with the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy manure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make a down payment for a second vehicle for his taxi service

loans.name: La Rica Vicky - Chupaca Group

texts.es:
Hola! Saludos fraternales a todos ustedes.
La señora Hilda, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, de 54 años de edad viuda y con un hijo que depende ella.
Ella pertenece al grupo “la Rica Vicky – Chupaca”, grupo numeroso, que está integrado por 11 socios, todos ellos vecinos de la misma localidad.
Hilda se dedica a su Bio Huerto y a la crianza de animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, conejos), acondicionada en un espacio de su casa 
Ella siembra en su huerto plantas ornamentales como: margaritas, lirios, anís, etc., que las vende en los mercados y ferias dominicales, que hay en su localidad.
Con los ingresos que le genera este negocio educa a su único hijo, y sueña en un futuro que estudie una profesión.
El préstamo que ella está solicitando es para la compra de semillas y abonos para su Bio Huerto. 
Ella está alegre por el apoyo de personas de otros países, y ella y sus compañeros dicen: Mil Gracias!.
Hilda viste con una chompa roja y y polo blanco, y es la segunda de la izquierda (se encuentra de pie).
texts.en:
Hello!  Fraternal Greetings to all of you.

Hilda is a very hardworking mother.  She’s 54-years-old, widowed and has a dependent son.  She belongs to the “La Rica Vicky-Chupaca” communal bank, a large group that has 11 members who are all neighbors from the same location.

Hilda works in her orchard and also raising small farm animals (chickens, guinea pigs, rabbits) in a space set aside for this at home.

She grows ornamental plants like daisies, lilies, anise, etc. that she sells in markets and at the Sunday street market in her locality.  With income generated from this business she’s able to educate her only son and she dreams with his studying a profession in the future.

The loan she’s requesting is to buy seeds and manure for her orchard.  She’s happy because of the support she gets from people in other countries and she and her fellow group members say: “Thank You!”

Hilda is wearing a red sweater and white shirt.  She’s second from the left (standing).

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure.

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es:
José, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, con la intensión de mejorar su pequeño taller, trabajando en la elaboración de forros de cuero para los corvos, se comprara cuero curtido o pre dorado, que es la materia prima de la cual elabora los forros.
Manifiesta que a través de esta ayuda ha logrado mantenerse en la elaboración de los forros, para poder atender la demanda, hasta el momento ha tenido buenas ventas, de las cuales han servido para la subsistencia de su familia.
texts.en: José has decided to take out another loan with the intention of improving his small workshop where he works manufacturing leather sheaths for machetes.  He will buy the types of leather that are the raw materials to make the sheaths.  He states that by means of this support he’s managed to stay in business making sheaths to meet demand and to date has had good sales that have made it possible for him to support his family.

loans.use: to buy leather.

loans.name: Dúo El Cariño Group

texts.es: Dúo el cariño,   este dúo está integrado por la señora  Elvia  es originaria de San Juan Comalapa ella tiene 4 hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de ropa de bebe, sus ventas las realiza de forma ambulante está muy contenta porque poco a poco a salido adelante en su negocio y ahora que tiene la oportunidad de un crédito lo solicita ya que necesita comprar materia prima para la confección de trajes de bebe, espera que le puedan dar ese apoyo que necesita para seguir adelante con su negocio
texts.en: The duo, El Cariño, is made up of two members, one of whom is Elvia, who is from San Juan Comalapa and has four children. She earns a living making and selling clothing for babies, and sells the products she makes by traveling door to door. Her business has been growing steadily, and she is grateful for the opportunity to receive this loan. She plans to use the support from this loan to purchase raw materials for making her clothing items, and she hopes that this investment will help her to grow and strengthen her business.

loans.use: to purchase input materials for making baby clothing for resale.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel has been selling used clothes in Naivasha for the last 15 years. He is a 38-year-old, married man. He and his wife, Mary, have one child.

This is his fourth loan from KADET LTD. He successfully repaid his previous loans on time. He will use the loan proceeds to purchase more inventory of clothes for his shop. He hopes to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothes to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 38 years old. To earn a living, she sells potatoes and rice. She has been in this business for three years.

With the loan she is seeking, she wants to purchase more potatoes and rice for sale. With the profits she expects to generate as a result of the loan, she would like buy a plot of land where she plans to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase additional potatoes and rice for sale.

loans.name: Violette

texts.en:
Violette is 32 years old. To earn a living, she sells clothes. She has been in this business for three years.

She is seeking a loan to buy more clothes for sale. With the profits she expects to generate as a result of the loan, she would like to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothes for sale.

loans.name: Carmen Adriana

texts.es:
Carmen anteriormente trabajaba en un almacén vendiendo productos pero su salario no le estaba alcanzando para cubrir las necesidades de su hogar, pues Carmen es madre soltera cabeza de familia de su hijo y el padre de su hijo los abandonó sin hacer alguna contribución económica para su sostenimiento. Gracias a que a su padre le dieron un pequeño local, Carmen aprovechó esta oportunidad y montó una cafetería, motivada principalmente por generar mayores ingresos con los que pudiera tener en su hogar una mejor calidad de vida para su hijo y brindarle el acceso a una educación de mejor calidad. Ya hace un tiempo montó su cafetería y a pesar de no contar con mucho capital, ha logrado sacarla adelante gracias a su gran esfuerzo todos los días. Buscando ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, Carmen busca un préstamo para comprar insumos para su cafetería y así superar su dificultad de capital.

Su sueño es poder tener una gran cafetería y generar empleo para más personas que se encuentran en su misma situación de ser madres solteras cabezas de hogar y así contribuir para que más personas tengan una mejor calidad de vida. Además, anhela en un futuro poder brindar a su hijo el acceso a una educación universitaria que le permita salir adelante.
texts.en:
Carmen used to work as a salesperson in a store but her salary wasn’t quite enough to cover all household needs because she’s a single mother, head of household.  She has a son and his father abandoned them leaving them no financial support.

Thanks to her father having gotten a small locale, Carmen used it to set up a small snack bar motivated primarily by the need to generate higher income so that she could have a better quality of life at home for her son and be able to provide him with access to a better quality education.  

She started the snack bar some time ago and despite not having much capital has managed to move it forward thanks to the great effort she puts into it every day.  Seeking to offer better customer service, Carmen is looking for financing to buy supplies for the snack bar and thus overcome her problem with capital.

Her dream is to have a great cafeteria that will generate employment for others who find themselves in the same situation of being single mothers heading households so that she can contribute towards their having better quality of life too.  In addition, she’d like her son to be able to have access to a university education in the future that will make it possible for him to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her snack bar.

loans.name: Elda Amparo

texts.es:
Elda comenzó a trabajar en la actividad de la confección desde muy joven, y gracias a sus conocimientos le surgió la oportunidad de trabajar como operaria de confección en una empresa donde trabajó durante 4 años. Luego, buscando mejores ingresos para su familia, dado que es cabeza de hogar, Elda decidió retirarse y con unos ahorros compró la maquinaria básica para montar su propio taller de confección el cual gracias a su esfuerzo ha logrado sacar adelante y superar las dificultades de capital que se le han presentado. A medida que ha pasado el tiempo ha logrado ir comprando más implementos de trabajo que requiere y esto le ha permitido ofrecer una mejor calidad en sus trabajos, lo que hace que los pedidos de sus clientes vayan aumentando cada vez más. Ahora, buscando diversificar sus ingresos, Elda busca un préstamo para comprar una máquina plana para comenzar a confeccionar su línea propia de prendas de vestir.

Su sueño es poder tener su línea propia en el mercado y lograr ser reconocida por la buena calidad de sus productos. Además, aspira a que en un futuro su taller crezca y tenga la oportunidad de generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas.
texts.en:
Elda started working making clothes at a very young age and thanks to her skills she got the opportunity to work as an employee for a firm where she worked for four years.  Then, looking for a way to earn higher family income since she’s the head of her household, she decided to leave her job and use some savings she had to buy some basic machines and set up her own clothing manufacturing shop.  

Thanks to her great effort she’s managed to move it forward and to overcome the difficulties she’s had with capital.  As time has gone by, she’s managed to buy more work tools she needed and this has led to greater quality of work which in turn has led to increased customer orders.  Now, seeking to diversity her income, Elda is looking for financing to buy a straight stitch sewing machine to start manufacturing her own line of clothing.

Her dream is to be able to launch her own line in the market and to become well-known for the good quality of her products.  In addition, she hopes that in future the workshop will grow and generate employment for those most in need.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Hector Santiago

texts.es:
Hector Santiago es un joven emprendedor de 19 años de edad que ha decidido buscar su propia fuente de ingresos para poder contribuir económicamente en su hogar y apoyar la gran dificultad económica que tienen sus padres, además de buscar los recursos con los cuales pagar sus estudios universitarios. Aprendió la actividad de venta de productos de uso personal viendo a las personas que se dedicaban a esto y desde hace medio año aproximadamente montó su propio negocio el cual trabaja todos los días fuertemente. A pesar de que inició su negocio con muy escasos recursos, el gran esfuerzo que hace le ha permitido sacarlo adelante y poder tener muy buenos pedidos de sus clientes, es por esto que busca un préstamo para comprar productos de uso personal y responder a los pedidos que tiene de sus clientes. 

Su sueño es llegar a tener un gran negocio con muchos clientes y que esto le permita generar los recursos con los que pueda contribuir aún más con sus padres para tener una mejor calidad de vida en el hogar, y también poder pagar sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Hector Santiago, 19, is a young entrepreneur who has decided to find his own income source so that he can contribute to his household, relieve his parents' financial difficulties, and pay for his university courses. He learned how to sell personal care products watching other salespeople in the field. He started his own business about 6 months ago and works hard at it every day. 

Though he started his business with few resources, his effort has allowed him to prosper and receive many customer orders. He is, therefore, requesting a loan to buy personal care products to fill his customers' orders. He dreams of having a big business with many customers that will allow him to earn more income to contribute to his parents ,so that their life is better, and to be able to pay for his university studies.

loans.use: to buy personal care products to fill his customers' orders.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos aprendió desde muy joven la actividad del arreglo de latonería y pintura de vehículos, gracias a que su padre se la enseñó y esto le ha permitido tener muy buena experiencia en la actividad y ahora ofrecer trabajos de buena calidad a sus clientes. Desde hace unos 7 años decidió comenzar a trabajar de manera independiente y gracias a esto su familia estaba gozando de muy buena calidad de vida y oportunidades económicas para salir adelante. Debido a que hace poco tuvo un percance de salud, se vio obligado a dejar el trabajo de lado y para poder pagar los gastos médicos vendió algunas de las herramientas de trabajo. Ahora que ya se ha recuperado y puede volver al trabajo, Carlos busca un préstamo para comprar herramientas como una pulidora, un compresor, un taladro, y otras herramientas más que le permitan retomar la actividad.

De esta manera logrará volver a generar ingresos para el hogar y seguir aportando económicamente, pues durante el tiempo en que estuvo con dificultades de salud fue su esposa quién sostuvo los gastos del hogar, lo que ha traído que en el momento tengan grandes dificultades económicas. Su sueño es poder tener un gran negocio que le permita sacar su familia adelante.
texts.en:
As a very young man, Carlos learned the business of body work and painting vehicles, thanks to the fact that his father taught him, and this allowed him to have very good experience in this type of work. Now he offers good quality work to his customers. Some seven years ago he decided to begin to work independently, and thanks to this his family was enjoying a very good quality of life and economic opportunities to advance. Because he had a health problem a little while ago, he was obliged to stop working, and in order to pay his medical expenses he sold some of his work tools. Now that he has recovered and can return to work, Carlos is seeking a loan to buy tools such as a polishing machine, a compressor, a drill, and other tools that will allow him to resume his business.

In this way he will manage to return to generating income for his household and continue supporting it economically, since during the time in which he had health problems, it was his wife who carried the household expenses, which has brought them great economic difficulties at this time. His dream is to be able to have a big business that will permit him to raise his family.

loans.use: to buy tools such as a polishing machine, a compressor, a drill, and other tools that will allow him to resume his work.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 20 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is single and has one child who is currently in school. For the past three years, Sylvia has been working hard to manage her small business, where she sells poultry feed. 

To help expand her business, Sylvia has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more poultry feed, and will help Sylvia to generate greater profits and pay for school fees and cover basic needs. Sylvia hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a home on it. 

Sylvia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life skills training.

loans.use: to buy more poultry feed

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette is 40 years old. To earn a living, she sells various food items and charcoal. She has been in this business for one year.

She is seeking a loan to buy more bananas, rice and charcoal for sale. The profits she expects to generate from the business as a result of the loan will reinvested to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional food (bananas and rice) and charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Mowafak

texts.en:
Mowafak is a 40-year-old single man from Iraq. He lives with a family of five, four of whom are employed.

To earn a living, Mowafak owns a shop where he sells locks and handles. He established his business in 1996, and now he has one other employee. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a loan in the amount of $3,000 to renovate the shop. He is aiming to grow his business and to increase his profits so that he will be able to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his shop

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La señora  Norma  de 35 años de edad, es casada madre de 4 hijos y se dedica desde hace 5 años al negocio de venta de pescado, frescos, abarrotería, granos básicos, ubicada en la aldea el comercio San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, Doña Norma es una mujer muy humilde y muy trabajadora con deseos de superarse y en su negocio esta creciendo ya que sus clientes la prefieren por su amabilidad al momento de atenderles.
Doña Norma esta solicitando el préstamo de 20,000.00 lempiras para surtir más su negocio con productos como pescado, jugos, refrescos, carnes, huevos, pan, café, maíz, arroz, azúcar, manteca, aceite, vegetales, condimentos y otros productos de consumo, con las ganancias desea mejorar su vivienda.
Doña Norma su sueño es tener el mejor negocio de la comunidad.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Agosto del 2012.
texts.en:
Sra. Norma, 35 years old, is married and the mother of four children. For the past five years she has had a business selling fish, soft drinks, groceries and basic grains located in the village of El Comercio in San Lorenzo municipality in the southern part of Honduras.

Doña Norma is a very modest and hardworking woman who wants to excel. Her business is growing because her customers prefer her due to the friendly way she waits on them. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 HNL (Honduran lempira) in order to stock her store with products such as fish, juice, soft drinks, meat, eggs, bread, coffee, corn, rice, sugar, butter, oil, vegetables, condiments and other consumption products. She wants to improve her home with her profits.

Doña Norma’s dream is to own the best business in the community.
San Lorenzo, Honduras – August, 2012.

loans.use: to buy fish, juice, soft drinks, meat, eggs, bread, coffee, corn, rice, sugar, butter, oil, vegetables, condiments and other consumption products for her business.

loans.name: Fredy Mauricio

texts.es:
Freddy es una persona muy trabajadora que al no haber tenido oportunidades laborales decidió iniciar su propio negocio en busca de mejores oportunidades económicas para sus sostenimiento. Fue así como inició su negocio de venta de fritos a las afueras de una universidad de la ciudad, el cual a pesar de haberlo iniciado con muy bajo capital ha logrado sacar adelante con mucho esfuerzo. Freddy desea mejorar sus ingresos, los cuales debido al invierno se vieron afectados por unos productos que se le perdieron cuando se dañó su carpa; por esto ahora que busca recuperarse busca un préstamo para comprar insumos para la preparación de los fritos y ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes.

Su sueño es sacar este negocio adelante y poder seguir ofreciendo una buena calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Freddy is a very hardworking person who unable to secure employment decided to start his own business seeking economic wherewithal to support himself.  This is how he started his fried fast-food business outside the city’s university.  Despite having started it with very little capital, he’s been able to move it forward thanks to the great effort he puts into it.

Freddy would like to improve his income which was affected in the winter when he lost some of his products because his tent was damaged.  He now wants to recuperate from this loss and is looking for a loan to buy ingredients to make the fried fast-food snacks and offer good customer service.  His dream is to move the business forward in order to continue providing a good quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for his fast-food snacks.

loans.name: Maria Adelaida

texts.es:
Maria Adelaida aprendió la actividad de la confección desde muy joven y gracias a esto consiguió trabajo en una empresa donde le ofrecieron la oportunidad de generar ingresos para contribuir con sus padres para ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida en el hogar. Posteriormente, este trabajo sería la fuente de ingresos con la que aportaría a su hogar junto con su esposo para poder tener una buena calidad de vida para su familia y así salir adelante. Desde hace 1 año decidió independizarse y montar su propio taller de confección en su hogar donde puede estar al cuidado de su trabajo y al cuidado de su familia, lo que le ha permitido ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Debido a que montó su taller con muy bajo capital, aún le faltan algunas máquinas que requiere para poder responder a todos los pedidos de sus clientes, es por esto que Maria Adelaida busca un préstamo para comprar una máquina plana y así aumentar su capacidad de producción.

Su sueño es poder sacar su taller adelante, terminarlo de dotar de todo lo necesario para ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes y así poder crecer y generar empleo en un futuro. Además, aspira a poder sacar su familia adelante brindándoles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Adelaida learned how to make clothes when she was still very young and thanks to this got a job in a firm where she could earn income to help her parents and provide a better quality of life at home.  Later on, this work would be her source of income to support her home with her husband so they would have a good quality of life for their family and thus move ahead.

She decided a year ago to become independent and set up her own sewing workshop at home where she can simultaneously do her work and care for her family; this has led to a better quality of life at home.  Because she set up her shop with very little capital she still needs some machines to be able to fill all her customer orders and this is why María Adelaida is looking for financing to buy a straight stitch sewing machine and increase production.

Her dream is to make the shop prosper and to finish equipping it with everything necessary to provide good customer serviced so that it can grow and generate employment in the future.  She also hopes to move her family forward providing them with better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Jose Gilberto

texts.es:
Jose se encuentra casado y tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad, y debido a que antes tenía un empleo donde generaba unos ingresos que no eran suficientes para el sostenimiento de su hogar, ha decidido renunciar y desde hace 2 semanas inició su propio negocio de venta de helados el cual inició con muy bajo capital pero gracias a su esfuerzo diario ha logrado ir sacando adelante. Gracias a su buena atención y la buena calidad de los productos que ofrece, Jose ha venido teniendo buenas ventas, sin embargo no cuenta con el capital suficiente para respaldarlas y por esto busca un préstamo para comprar productos de heladería para surtir su negocio de productos que ya se han ido agotando.

Jose espera poder seguir saliendo adelante y ofrecerle a su familia una buena calidad de vida y a su hijo el acceso a una educación de buena calidad. Su sueño es llegar a conseguir su casa propia y ofrecerle a su familia un hogar más estable.
texts.en:
Jose is married and has a three year old child. Because he had a job where the money he earned was not sufficient to meet his household expenses he decided to quit it and two weeks ago he began his own ice cream shop which he opened with very little capital but thanks to his daily effort he has managed to make it prosper. Thanks to his good service and the good quality of the products he offers, Jose has been having good sales, but he does not have enough capital behind him and this is why he is searching for a loan in order to buy ice cream products to supply his business with the  products he has already run out of.

Jose hopes to be able to continue moving forward and to offer his family a good quality of life and his child access to a good education. His dream is to own his own home and to offer his family a more stable home.

loans.use: to buy ice cream products in order to supply his business with products he has run out of

loans.name: Bernabas

texts.en:
Bernabas is one of several TLM clients funded by Kiva lenders in August 2011 when he received a loan of IDR 3,000,000 to buy more fish to sell. Prior to getting the loan, Bernabas was only able to generate an income of between IDR 250,000 and 400,000 per day, but after securing the loan, he was able to generate a daily income of between IDR 400,000 and 600,000. With the improvement in his business, Barnabas was able to fully repay his loan in July 2012.

Barnabas has a desire to keep improving his business and is therefore requesting a loan of IDR 4,500,000 to buy more stocks of sardines and yellow fin tuna. He would also like to use part of the loan for his home renovation.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell, i.e., sardines and yellow fin tuna, and to renovate his house.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry has operated his retail shop in Naivasha town for the last twelve years. He is 59 years old and married to Beatrice; they have four children. 

This is his first loan from KADET Ltd. He plans to buy more sugar, rice and cooking oil to sell in his shop. He also plans to buy bundles of maize flour and baking flour. 

In the future, he plans to grow his business and open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy bundles of maize flour and baking flour.

loans.name: Jbar

texts.en:
Jbar is from Iraq. He is 46 years old, married, and has six children, three of whom are employed. 

Jbar owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juice, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2008 and he now has one employee. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community. 

He is requesting a $3000 loan to install rolling shutters and buy a generator. He also wants to install shelves in the store. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to install rolling shutters and buy a generator

loans.name: Ma. Delia

texts.en:
Ma. Delia is a businesswoman from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She has two young children. Ma. Delia has had a food vending business, or eatery, in their place for more than nine years now. This is the source of her income. 

Ma. Delia is asking for a loan of 11,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy stocks and ingredients for her food vending business like vegetables, meat and others. Ma. Delia hopes to expand her business in the future so that it will increase her income, allowing her to send her children to school for a better education and a bright future.

loans.use: to buy stocks and ingredients for her food vending business like vegetables, meat and others

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 39 years old and blessed with six children whom she supports by herself. For the past year she has operated a shoe selling business, earning a monthly income of 18,300 KES. 

This will be Mary's first loan with KADET LTD and she wants to use this loan to buy more shoes for resale including ladies' shoes, rubber shoes and slippers. She will use the anticipated profit to buy more stock and repay her loan. 

She has dreams of buying a piece of land and to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more shoes

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto se separó hace más de un año de su esposa y tiene dos hijos de los cuales uno ya es independiente y el menor esta en etapa escolar, viven en la casa de sus padres ocupando dos habitaciones, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe ingresos de su renta de jubilación y ahora trabaja en una empresa de limpieza ya que es el único que cubre los gastos de educación, alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para cubrir los costos de la legalización de documentos de su casa ya que sus padres le dejaron como herencia.
El sueño de Alberto, es hacer construir su casa para acoger a sus hijos.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
En el préstamo anterior canalizado a través de Kiva, se indicó que vivia en casa propia, pero en realidad es de sus padres, la misma que ahora será propia despues de la legalización de documentos.
texts.en:
Alberto separated from his wife more than a year ago. He has two children, one of whom one is already independent and the younger one school-age. 

They live in his parents' home, occupying two rooms. The house is located in the Tacagua area of the city of La Paz.

Currently he earns income from his pension, and now works at a cleaning company, as he is the only one covering his family's expenses for education,  food and payment of basic services. 

He needs the loan in order to cover the costs of registering the title of the house where he lives, to transfer it into his name, as his parents left it to him as an inheritance.

Alberto's dream is to have his house built to shelter his children.

It is the second time he has applied for a loan with IMPRO and Kiva.

In the previous loan channeled through Kiva, it was indicated that he lived in his own home, but actually it is his parents' home, which will now belong to him, after the registration of documents.

loans.use: To cover the costs of registering the title of the house where he lives, to transfer it into his name, as his parents left it to him as an inheritance.

loans.name: Deimer Alejandro

texts.es:
Deimer desde muy joven aprendió la actividad del corte de cabello y con la ayudad de un primo consiguió trabajo. Gracias a su esfuerzo logró reunir unos ahorros y pidiendo un poco de dinero prestado montó su propia barbería y ahora esta es su fuente de ingresos con la que sostiene los gastos de su hogar donde convive con su esposa y su hija de 2 años de edad. Debido al poco capital con el que cuenta en su negocio, Deimer busca un préstamo para realizar adecuaciones locativas en el local y poder así ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Su mayor sueño es sacar su propio negocio adelante haciéndolo crecer y pudiendo generar empleo. Además, poder tener en su hogar una mejor calidad de vida con los ingresos que este le genere y así su familia pueda progresar.
texts.en:
Deimer learned to cut hair when he was still very young and with help from a cousin got work.  Thanks to his effort he was able to save up and with borrowed money he asked for was able to start his own barber shop which is now his source of income to support his home where he lives with his wife and two-year-old daughter.  Because of the little capital he disposes of, Deimer is looking for financing to do some physical improvements to his shop in order to offer better customer service.  

His greatest dream is to move his own business ahead and with income generated by it make it grow and be able to have a home with better quality of life so that his family can progress.

loans.use: to do some physical improvements to his salon.

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es:
Roberto se ha dedicado gran parte de su vida a la crianza de pollos, pues gracias a que su madre se dedicaba a esta actividad logró aprenderla desde muy temprana edad. Actualmente, tiene un galpón de pollos con el que genera los ingresos para su hogar y ha logrado brindar una buena calidad de vida a su esposa y sus 3 hijos, pero ha tenido una gran dificultad de capital generada principalmente por un accidente que tuvo hace unos meses que lo perjudicó de trabajar y tuvo que dejar su negocio por un largo tiempo. Ahora que busca recuperarse ha puesto un gran esfuerzo y ha logrado devolver a su negocio los clientes que tenía, y buscando responder a los grandes pedidos Roberto busca un préstamo para comprar pollos, el cuido necesario para su sostenimiento y realizarle mantenimiento al galpón. 

Su sueño es poder tener nuevamente su negocio en marcha en buenas condiciones y volver a generar los ingresos que requiere en su hogar para poder sostener su familia y así salir de la difícil situación por la que están atravesando.
texts.en:
Roberto has dedicated a grand part of his life to raising chickens, and thanks to the fact that his mother also pursued this activity, he came to know the business from an early age. At present, he has a shed with chickens from which he generates his family's income and hopes to offer a good quality of life to his wife and their 3 children.

But Robert has had difficulty generating capital, due to an accident he had some months ago that threatened his work. He had to leave his business for a long time. Now, he is seeking to recover. With great effort, he has been able to bring back to his business the customers he used to have. And now, attempting to respond to large orders, Roberto is requesting a loan to buy chickens, plus the care necessary to sustain them and also, to perform maintenance on his chicken shed. 

His dream is to have his business moving ahead in good condition once again, and to generate the household income required to be able to sustain his family and thus, get beyond the difficult situation through which they are now passing.

loans.use: buy chickens and pay for the care needed to sustain them, and to maintain their shed.

loans.name: Yngrid

texts.es:
