La socia se sigue dedicando al trabajo en un bar,recepcion y limpieza,tambien la socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de panes y crianza de animales como pollos,la socia los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes mercados,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los pollos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar pollos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues working in a bar, as a receptionist and as a cleaner. The member is also engaged in the business of selling bread and raising animals, such as chickens. The member raises and fattens them and then sells them at different markets. The member’s dream is to have a place where she can sell her chickens. The member is requesting a loan to purchase chickens.

The member is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase chickens.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 22 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga, in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is single and has one child who is currently in school. For the past six years, Juliet has been working hard to manage her restaurant and bar, where she sells posho, rice and matoke. 

To help expand her business, Juliet is requesting a loan of 400000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a refrigerator and matoke. This will help Juliet grow her business and generate greater profits, which will help cover her family's needs. Juliet hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house. 

Juliet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and matoke.

loans.name: Francine

texts.en: Francine is 37 years old. She sells cement. She has been in the business for the past five years. She wants the loan to buy more cement to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more cement for sale.

loans.name: Gloria Elena

texts.es:
Gloria es una persona muy trabajadora que ha salido adelante a pesar de las grandes adversidades que le ha presentado la vida. Actualmente Gloria trabaja como empleada en un cultivo donde siente que no le pagan lo suficiente para poder sostener los gastos de su hogar donde convive con su hijo de 6 años de edad, y siempre ha querido poder tener su propio cultivo de verduras, pero como nunca ha podido contar con el capital suficiente para ello ha tenido que ver como este sueño se aplaza constantemente. Ahora que tiene la oportunidad, Gloria busca un préstamo para comprar insumos como semillas, riegos, abonos, insecticidas y otros más para iniciar con su propio cultivo de verduras.

Su sueño es tener su propio negocio y sacarlo adelante para poder ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo y mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar. Además, sueña en un futuro brindarle una educación de mejor calidad a su hijo que le permita progresar.
texts.en:
Gloria’s a very hardworking person who has gotten ahead despite the great adversities life has presented her.  She currently works as a hired field hand but feels that she’s not paid enough to cover all her household expenses where she lives with her six-year-old son.  She’s always wanted to have her own vegetable crops but has never had sufficient capital to do so and this dream is constantly being postponed.  Now that she has the opportunity, Gloria is looking for financing to buy supplies like seeds, irrigation supplies, manure and insecticide to start her own vegetable crop.

Her dream is to have her own business and to move it forward to be able to offer better quality of life for her son and better economic opportunities for progress.  In addition, she dreams in future with providing her won with a better quality education that will make it possible for him to progress.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es: El señor Esteban es natural de la comunidad de Toracari a 170 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba al norte de Potosí, actualmente vive en la ciudad de Cochabamba con sus cuatro hijos viven a su cargo de él, vive en un vivienda en alquiler en una casa particular. La actividad a que se dedica es la servicio de albañil hace 4 años, su esposa trabaja de servicio de empleada domestica, la  señor prácticamente el crédito que está solicitando es para comprar una mezcladora de cemento para poder incrementar trabajar particularmente de esa manera incrementar su ingreso en los próximos años trabajando individualmente. El cliente manifiesta anteriormente vivieron en sus comunidades que hay una extrema pobreza es por esta razón han migrado a departamento de Cochabamba a buscar trabajo y trabajando de albañil ayudante.
texts.en: Esteban is a native of the community of Toracari, 170 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba, to the north of Potosí. He currently lives in the city of Cochabamba with his four children who he is in charge of. He lives in a place that he rents in a private home. He has made a living providing masonry services for a wage of 125 per day, for the past four years. His wife works as a domestic employee. The loan Esteban is requesting is for practical purposes: to purchase a cement mixer to be able to increase his work output, particularly so that he can raise his income in the next few years working individually. He states that previously they lived in communities where there was extreme poverty, which is why they have migrated to the division of Cochabamba to look for work, and so he could work as an assistant mason.

loans.use: to purchase a cement mixer

loans.name: Giuleisy Carolina

texts.es:
Giuleisy es una joven de 18 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Nazca, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido, en el cual se desarrolla la agricultura, especialmente se cultiva el algodón, la tuna, frejoles, entre otros, posee muchos atractivos turísticos, los cuales son muy visitados por muchos turistas en todo el año, entre ellas tenemos “las Líneas de Nazca”, los acueductos de Cahuachi, entre otros, cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le encanta leer y sobre todo comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “ají de gallina”.

Día a Día Giuleisy trabaja como mesera en un restaurante de la ciudad, ella labora alrededor de 8 horas al día, ya que por las noches estudia la carrera de administración y con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de sus estudios y apoyar en casa; ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es responsable y amable con los clientes.

Giuleisy está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá completar el dinero que necesita para la compra de un pequeño auto, con el cual iniciara su pequeño negocio de alquiler de vehículo para taxi, con lo cual tendrá  un ingreso más para solventar los gastos de sus estudios y así seguir luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia y ser una gran profesional”.
texts.en:
Giuleisy is a youth of 18 years old, lives in the city of Nazca, which is characterized by having a very warm climate and where agriculture is developed, especially cotton, cactus, and beans among others. It has many tourist attractions which are visited by many tourists year round. Among them we have "The lines of Nazca", the aqueducts of Cahuachi. When Giuleisy has free time, she loves to read and more than anything eat one of her favorite dishes which is the rich "ají de gallina" or spicy chicken.

Day to day Giuleisy works as a waitress in a city restaurant. She works about 8 hours a day, as at night she studies for an administration career and with the fruits of her labor she can settle the expenses from her studies and support her household. She believe that she will succeed in her job because she is responsible and kind to her clients.

Giuleisy is very grateful for the Kiva loans and thanks to the assistance that they have provided she will be able to have the money necessary to purchase a small vehicle, with which she can start her small business of renting the vehicle. With this she will have more income to settle her student debt and also continue each day to realize her greatest dream: "To have her own house and be a great professional."

loans.use: to purchase a vehicle.

loans.name: Froilan

texts.es:
Froilan, es casado y tiene siete hijos de los cuales cinco ya son independientes y los dos pequeños están en etapa escolar, viven en casa propia ocupando dos habitaciones pequeñas con paredes de adobe y el piso de tierra, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Villa Ingenio  en la ciudad de El Alto.
Froilan no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar por que sus padres no tenían dinero, actualmente percibe ingresos ya que trabaja por más de doce horas al día como albañil en diferentes construcciones ya que es el único que cubre los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de ladrillos, cemento, estuco, para la refacción de las habitaciones de su vivienda ya que desea dar más comodidad a su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida.
El sueño de Froilan es mejorar sus ingresos y terminar de construir su casa.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Froilan is married and has seven children five of which are already independent; the two little ones are school age.  They live together in a house with two small bedrooms with adobe walls and dirt floor located in the city of El Alto’s Villa Ingenio zone.

Froilan never went to school because his parents had no money.  He currently earns income working more than 12 hours daily in construction on various construction sites since he’s the only one who covers his family’s food, education and basic utilities costs.

He needs the loan to buy bricks, cement and stucco to improve the rooms in his house because he wants to provide more comfort for his family and to improve their quality of life.

Froilan dreams with improving his income and with finishing building his house.  This is the first time he’s requested credit from IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan, esta casado y tiene dos hijos los cuales ya son independientes, vive con su esposa en una casa alquilada ocupando dos habitaciones, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz. 
Actualmente percibe ingresos ya que trabaja por más de seis horas al día como director técnico de una escuela de fútbol ya que debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una Lap top ya que le será de mucha ayuda en su trabajo, pues necesita hacer planillas y reportes de actividades de sus jugadores, como también horarios de entrenamientos y liquidaciones para cobros por sus servicios.
El sueño de Juan, es mejorar sus ingresos y adquirir una casa en anticrético para ahorrar en los pagos de alquileres y tener más comodidad.
Es la cuarta vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Juan is married and has two children who are now independent.  He lives with his wife in a rented house, and they occupy two rooms.  The house is in the Miraflores zone of the city of La Paz.

He currently gets income working for over six hours a day as the manager of a soccer school.  He does this because he needs to cover the food expenses and pay for his family’s basic services.

He needs the loan to buy a laptop.  It would be very helpful to him in his work.  He needs to make spreadsheets and reports about his players’ activities. He also needs to make training schedules and invoices to collect for his services.

Juan’s dream is to improve his income and to get a house in ‘anticrético’ [transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner could lose the property to you].  He wants to do this in order to save the rent payments and to be more comfortable.

This is the fourth time he has requested a loan with IMPRO and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a laptop, which would be very useful to him in his work as a manager of a soccer school.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos, es soltero y no tiene hijos; vive en la casa de sus padres, ocupando una habitación, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente Carlos trabaja y estudia al mismo tiempo; percibe ingresos ya que trabaja por más de ocho horas al día en una empresa privada de radiodifusión ya que con lo que gana debe cubrir sus gastos de estudios ya que estudia periodismo y también debe ayudar en los pagos de servicios básicos de su familia. Carlos está estudiando Periodismo en una Universidad de la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una computadora que le será de mucha ayuda en sus estudios.
El sueño de Carlos, es mejorar sus ingresos y poder independizarse para mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Carlos is single and has no children. He lives in his parents' home, occupying a room. The house is located in the Irpavi area of the city of La Paz.

At the present time, he earns income, as he works for more than eight hours a day at a private broadcasting company as well as studying. With what he earns, he must cover his school expenses, as he is studies social communication, and must also help pay for his family's basic services.

Carlos is studying journalism at a university in the city of La Paz. 

He needs the loan to purchase a computer, as it will be a great help in his studies. 

Carlos' dream is to improve his income, and be able to live on his own, in order to improve his quality of life.

This is the first time he has worked with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a computer that will help him in his journalism studies at a university in La Paz.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: El Sr. Julio es  tranquilo y trabajador según referencias de su vecinos, curso hasta el bachillerato no pudiendo así seguir con los estudios superiores por problemas económicos , viéndose de esa forma desde muy joven a trabajar es así que hoy lleva más de 20 años trabajando es casado. El cliente nos cuenta además que actualmente su esposa trabaja en el área de agricultura en Argentina la cual con  mucho sacrificio manda una remesa cada mes con el fin de cubrir las deudas que ellos tienen con otra entidad y de esa forma algún día volver y estar reunida con su familia una vez que hayan pagado gran cantidad de dinero la deuda que deben, es así que hoy en día gracias a ese crédito cuentan con un lote Ubicado en San Jerónimo, la misma que Don Julio aspira algún día construirla y vivir junto con su familia. Con el crédito que se le otorgue el piensa  refaccionar su vehículo que con mucho sacrificio pudo comprarlo, con el cual espera seguir generando ingresos  y de esa forma mejorar  su nivel de vida, y concretar sus sueños a lado de su familia ya que con crédito le será más fácil avanzar en el sueño que quiere lograr,  además de sentirse más satisfecho de haber logrado lo que quiso.
texts.en:
Julio is even-tempered and hardworking according to references from his neighbors.  He attended high school but was unable to continue with higher education due to economic problems.  He had to go to work very young and today has more than 20 years’ experience working.  He’s married.  

He mentions that his wife works in agriculture in Argentina and with much sacrifice sends a monthly stipend home to help cover debts they have in another institution hoping someday to return and once again be reunited with her family once they’ve managed to repay the large amount of money they owe.  Because of that loan, they own a lot located in San Jerónimo that Julio hopes one day to build a house on to live with his family.

With the loan he may be granted, he plans to service the car he bought with so much sacrifice that he hopes to continue earning income with thus improving his quality of life and to reach his dreams alongside his family because with the loan it will be easier to move forward towards the dream he wants to reach while at the same time having the satisfaction of having accomplished what he wanted to.

loans.use: to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Rithy

texts.en: Rithy is 36 years old. He is married and lives in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. He has been employed as a policeman for more than 10 years, earning about $5 per day. His wife is a garment worker who earns about $3 daily. In order to improve his family’s finances, Rithy is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase chickens and fodder for breeding. By doing so, he would earn more income to support his family. In the future, he would like to expand his business and build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and fodder

loans.name: James

texts.en: James sells clothing in the town of Olkalou and has been in the business for the past four years. He is 34-years-old and married to Esther. This being his fifth loan, he plans to use the loan to buy more stock of clothing to sell. With the anticipated income, he plans to buy shares in a profiting company. In the future, James hopes to have a stable business, get more income and be able to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy personal use products and clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies and products that she needs in her cafe to be stocked that have been running out.

loans.name: Karar

texts.en: Karar is from Iraq. He is a youth client, 23-years-old, married and has one child. He is the only provider for the family. Karar owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He chose this field because he is versed in it; he established his business in 2009. He has had a good experience in this field and has a good reputation in his local community. He is requesting a $2400 youth loan to install shelves and a door for the shop. He also wants to increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to install shelves and a door for the shop as well as increase his inventory.

loans.name: Deysi

texts.es:
Deysí, necesita un préstamo para continuar invirtiendo en el negocio adquiriendo frutas y verduras frescas para incrementar el inventario, se comprara tomates, chiles, cebollas, manzanas, uvas, papaya, su intención es darle continuidad del negocio, ya que es la ocupación que le genera las ganancias para su familia.

Ella tuvo un efecto positivo con la inversión de préstamo anterior, logrando mejorar la disponibilidad de frutas y verduras frescas, este negocio le permite mantener la subsistencia a su familia.
texts.en:
Deysi needs a loan to continue investing in the business of buying fresh fruits and vegetables. To increase inventory she buys tomatoes, chiles, onions, apples, grapes and papayas. Her intention is to continue this business as it is the occupation that generates the most income for her family. 

She had a positive effect with the previous loan investment, improving the availability of fruits and vegetables; this business allows her to keep providing for her family.

loans.use: buy tomatoes, chiles, onion, apples, grapes and papayas

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen is 23-years-old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past seven years, Allen has been working hard to manage her restaurant which sells posho, matoke and other local foods. 

To help expand her business, Allen has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a refrigerator so that she can sell chilled drinks, and it will help Allen to generate greater profits and pay for basic needs for her daughter because it is difficult to do as a single mom. Allen hopes that in the future she will be able to pay for school fees for her daughter and grow her restaurant. 

Allen is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator so that she can sell chilled drinks at her restaurant.

loans.name: Hernando

texts.es:
Hernando se encuentra casado y tiene 3 hijos de 2, 11 y 12 años de edad, y en la actualidad esta atravesando una gran dificultad en su vida, pues hace unos días se ha quedado sin empleo y por tanto los ingresos que requiere en su hogar se han visto fuertemente afectados. Buscando mejorar esta situación, Hernando ha encontrado la posibilidad de montar su propio negocio de venta de comida, pero como no cuenta con el capital necesario para comprar sus implementos necesarios para el trabajo, busca un préstamo para comprar implementos de cocina como ollas, fogón, mesas, sillas y los insumos iniciales para la preparación de las comidas. 

De esta manera espera poder iniciar su propio negocio y nuevamente generar los ingresos que requiere en su hogar para ofrecer una buena calidad de vida a su familia. Su sueño es poder salir adelante con su familia y algún día aspira a tener su propio restaurante.
texts.en:
Hernando is married and has three children of 1, 11, and 12 years of age, and currently is going through a great difficulty in his life, as it has been a few days since he has been without employment and because of this the income he needs for household expenses has been strongly affected. Searching to improve this situation, Hernando has found the opportunity to start his own business selling food, but as he does not have the necessary capital to buy the necessary tools for the work, he is looking for a loan in order to buy cooking equipment such as pots, cooking range, tables, chairs and the initial supplies for the preparation of meals.

In this way he hopes to be able to start his own business and generate income again that the household needs for a good quality of life for his family. His dream is to be able to get ahead and some day he aspires to have his own restaurant.

loans.use: to buy kitchen equipment such as pots, cooking range, tables, chairs and supplies for making meals

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has a retail shop in Ndunyu Njeru town. Besides running the retail shop business, he is also a cash crop farmer. He is married to Lilian and they have one child.

This being his second loan amount, he plans to pay school fees for his wife for further studies.

In the future, John hopes to grow his business and open a wholesale shop in Ndunyu Njeru town.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his wife for further studies.

loans.name: Plaxeda

texts.en:
Plaxeda is a married mother of four children; two go to school. She has  additional family members (grand children). She sells green bananas at the market. She sells her product on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last 10 years. She works seven days a week. 

She has applied for a loan of 600,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT - SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She is aspiring of buying a delivery van to transport bunches of bananas from the village to the market. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es: Eugenio es uno de los principales productores de café de la comunidad en la que vive. Desde hace más de 40 años el ha trabajado en las plantaciones de café, comenzando desde pequeño con su padre a quien ayudaba en la época de cosecha a cortar y conforme fueron pasando los años fue aprendiendo otras cosas relacionadas con el café y el trabajo en el campo. Cuando Eugenio tenía 19 años conoció a Efigenia con quien un año más tarde se casó y formaron una familia. Ellos tienen tres hijos de los cuales dos ya están casados y uno aún vive con ellos. Eugenio se encarga personalmente de sus fincas de café junto con su hijo. Entre los dos realizan labores de limpieza, de siembra y de corte principalmente mientras su esposa se encarga de las labores del hogar. Durante la última cosecha Eugenio produjo un total de 20 toneladas de café orgánico y para la siguiente cosecha el solicita un crédito porque necesita preparar sus terrenos, limpiarlos y quiere resembrar plantas ya que algunas de ellas ya cumplieron su ciclo de vida y es necesario cambiarlas. De esta forma logrará en tres años aumentar su producción. Eugenio nos contó que como sus dos hijos mayores ya están casados su mayor anhelo es poder brindarle a su hijo menor la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera universitaria para que tenga mejores oportunidades de empleo en el futuro.
texts.en:
Eugenio is one of the leading producers of coffee in the community in which he lives. He has worked on coffee plantations for over 40 years, beginning when he was young with his father, whom he helped with cutting during harvest time. As the years went by and he began to learn other things related to coffee and working in the field. When Eugenio was 19 years old, he met Efigenia who he married a year later and they formed a family. They have three children, two of whom are already married and one who still lives with them. 

Eugenio is personally in charge of his coffee plantations together with his son. Between the two of them, they carry out the tasks of cleaning, sowing and primarily cutting crops while his wife is in charge of the home duties. During the last harvest, Eugenio produced a total of 20 tons of organic coffee, and for the next harvest he is requesting a loan because he needs to prepare his land, clean it, and he wants to re-sow plants since some of them have already completed their life cycles and it is necessary to change them out. In this way he will be able to raise his production in three years. 

Eugenio told us that since his two older children are already married, his greatest desire is to be able to offer his youngest son the opportunity to study at a university so that he will have better employment opportunities in the future.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants and prepare his land for sowing

loans.name: Duo Xejul Group

texts.es: Dúo Xejul Este grupo está integrado por la señora  Ester, ella es originaria de San Juan Comalapa tiene hijos pequeños en edad escolar ella se dedica a la elaboración de güipiles típicos desde hace varios años y está solicitando este crédito para la compra de materia prima para la confección de tejidos típicos ya que sus clientes han aumentado y necesita capital para seguir trabajando.
texts.en: Dúo Xejul: This group has as a member Ms. Ester who is from San Juan Comalapa. She has small school-aged children. She earns a living making traditional embroidered dresses which she has done for a number of years. She is seeking this loan for purchasing raw materials for making the traditional weavings since her customer base has grown and she needs capital in order to continue working.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for making traditional weavings.

loans.name: Khuon

texts.en:
Khoun is 58 and a rice cultivator. She has lived in Kampong Chhnang province since 1979. She has a lot of experience in the rice crop business. From her current occupation, Khoun is able to generate an income about KHR 5,000 per day, so she always uses this low income to help support her family’s needs.

Her husband also assists her in the same sector, the farming business. Besides this, he also goes to catch fresh fish in and around his community for earning more profits in order to share responsibilities with Mrs. Khoun. 

Khoun will be using her loan to support her husband’s business to purchase more fishing materials.

loans.use: to purchase more fishing materials for her husband.

loans.name: Claudette

texts.en:
Claudette is 32 years old. She is married with four children aged between nine and fourteen years. She sells fruits and has spent three years in the business. 

She plans to request a loan for adding more fruits such as apples and oranges for sale. The profits from the business will be used for savings.

loans.use: to buy more fruits for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to place windows and doors and install electricity

loans.name: Rosendo

texts.en:
Rosendo is a hog raiser in the village where he lives. He is 53 years of age, married and has four children. According to him, all of his children go to school.

Rosendo runs and has operated his hog raising business for five years while his farming business for twenty. He is a person who, in spite of his age, still would like to maintain himself very well to be able to have a lot of energy to work in his rice field and livestock business. His main priority at this time is to obtain greater income to be able to educate all of his four children and improve his living conditions.

Rosendo is now asking for a loan amount of PHP15,000 to allow him to buy four sacks of livestock feed and vaccines to make his hogs healthier upon reaching their optimum growth. He hopes and prays that he could get this loan amount to be able to make his dreams possible and realistic.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of livestock feed and vaccines for raised hogs.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is now forty-four years old and is married to Mary with whom they operate a hotel. They are blessed with three children. Moses has been in this business for five years now earning an income of 16,650 shillings. 

This will be his first loan with KADET LTD and he will use the loan to buy furniture for his hotel business like tables and chairs. He plans to use the anticipated profit to buy land for horticulture farming, which is a dream of his.

loans.use: To buy more furniture for his business

loans.name: Claudia Maritza

texts.es:
Claudia comenzó a trabajar en la actividad de la confección desde hace 11 años cuando entró a trabajar en una empresa de confecciones, luego de 3 años trabajando, decidió con mucho esfuerzo montar su propio taller de confección en su casa buscando generar mayores ingresos para ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar. A pesar de que su taller lo inició con muy bajos recursos económicos, gracias a su esfuerzo lo ha venido sacando adelante y ahora tiene la oportunidad de generar empleo para una persona muy necesitada; y buscando generar un empleo más, Claudia busca un préstamo para comprar una máquina plana e insumos como telas e hilos para ofrecer las herramientas de trabajo a un nuevo empleo que generará en su taller.

Su sueño es poder seguir saliendo adelante con este negocio y continuar progresando junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos ofreciéndoles una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas.
texts.en:
Claudia began to work in the activity of sewing eleven years ago when she started work in a tailoring company.  After three years working there, she decided, with a lot of effort, to set up her own tailoring workshop in her house, looking to generate a greater income to offer her family a better quality of life and better economic opportunities in order to progress.  In spite of the fact that her workshop began with very poor economic resources, thanks to her efforts she has been able to get ahead and now she has the opportunity to generate employment for a person very much in need.  Looking to generate another job, Claudia seeks a loan to buy a tabletop sewing machine and supplies like cloth and thread in order to provide the working tools for the new job that she will create in her workshop.

Her dream is to be able to continue moving forward with this business and to continue making progress together with her husband and two children, offering them a better quality of life and greater economic opportunities.

loans.use: to buy a tabletop sewing machine and supplies like fabric and threads.

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es:
Roberto, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo ya que necesita invertir en una nueva siembra de maíz y frijol, se comprará los materiales necesarios para preparar la tierra y también pagar la mano de obra, la semilla y también el abono, todo esto contribuirá a que él pueda realizar la siembra sin inconvenientes.

Manifiesta que el préstamo anterior fue de mucha ayuda, ya que realizó correctamente el cultivo de maíz y hoy en día ha iniciado la siembra de frijol, todo con la mejor intención para tener más producción para el alimento de su familia, sus condiciones económicas se han mantenido ya que el cultivo sólo le permite cubrir lo más esencial a su hogar.
texts.en:
Robeto has decided on a new loan because he needs to invest in new corn and bean sowing, and to buy the necessary supplies to prepare the land and also to pay for labor, the seed, and the fertilizer. All of this will contribute so he can plant without cumbrances.

He says that the previous loan was a very helpful, because he was able to correctly plant corn and today he has begun to plant beans, all with the best intentions to have a larger crop in order to feed the family. His financial standing has been maintained since the harvest only covers the essentials of the household.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seed, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is still single and a mother of two children who are doing well in school. She was currently short on funds to pay their school fees and thus the need to apply for this second loan which she will use to pay the children's school fees. 

She is still paying back the previous loan since the current loan is a top up purposely to pay school fees for her children and she hopes to educate her children to a higher level of education.

loans.use: to pay the children's school fees.

loans.name: Joseph Maina

texts.en:
Joseph used his previous loan amount to buy more goods to sell in his shop. It was profitable and he was able to pay back the loan amount well and in good time.

Besides the retail shop business, he also has a grocery shop. This being his fourth loan, he plans to buy a motorcycle and start a motorcycle transport business in Naivasha town.

In the future, Joseph hopes to grow his businesses and make more income.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to start a motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, who is married to Joe, a teacher at the secondary level of education, just finished her second-year level of college. The couple is blessed with five children.

Since Josephine doesn't want to rely only on her husband's salary, she has sought ways to help her husband generate income. Because she has always been fascinated by animals, she has been involved in a hog-raising business for the past year, currently raising four pigs for fattening,

Josephine is now requesting a loan of PHP7,000 to buy hog feeds and vaccines, purchases that will result in healthier pigs who have achieved their optimum growth. Consequently, Josephine will obtain greater profits, contributing to an overall improvement of the business.

loans.use: to buy hog feeds and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is 33 years old. She is married and has three children who all go to school. She sells clothes and has been running this business for two years. With the loan, she wants to buy more men's shirts to sell. The profits from her business will be used to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Eva Devotha

texts.en: Eva Devotha, a 31-year-old single woman who sells milk, is requesting this loan to buy a cooler. She will reinvest her profits in the business.

loans.use: to buy a cooler for the milk she sells.

loans.name: Sov's Group

texts.en: Sov, aged 45, is a villager from a rural area of Krolanh district located in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She is married and blessed with three children, one daughter and two sons. Two are currently in school and the other is employed. To make a living, Sov farms on two hectares of farmland and raises seven pigs. She has been involved in this business for ten years, enabling her to earn about 28,000KHR per day and saving around 14,000KHR. Sov and a partner, who are both third-round clients with VisionFund, are applying for a new loan with VisionFund. The last two loans made her family’s life so much better and also increased her family’s income. She will use the new loan that she requested to buy fertilizers for her farmland and pig feeds for her pigs. Through her loan portion, she hopes to improve her family’s living conditions, strengthen her current businesses, and create a bright future for her children by sending them to good schools.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pig feed.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Kror Lanh district

loans.name: Deider Armando

texts.es:
Deider es un joven trabajador que gracias a que tiene 15 años de experiencia en la actividad de la agricultura, puede sacar productos de muy buena calidad que le permiten venderlos a muy buenos precios. La experiencia la ha adquirido de sus padres que se dedicaron toda su vida a la agricultura y desde muy joven se la enseñaron para trabajar a su lado; ahora que se encuentra casado, esta es la fuente de ingresos que le permite a su familia tener una calidad de vida digna. Debido a que no cuenta con un capital suficiente, el invierno ha deteriorado fuertemente sus cultivos, y es por esto que ahora que tiene la oportunidad de recuperarse busca un préstamo para comprar insumos como abonos, riegos e insecticidas y recuperar sus terrenos. 

De esta manera podrá sacar su cultivo adelante y ofrecerle a sus clientes una mejor calidad en los productos, obteniendo así mejores ingresos que le permitirán sacar su familia adelante.
texts.en:
Deider is a young worker who, thanks to having 15 years of experience in agriculture, is able to harvest very good quality produce that he can sell at very good prices. He gained this experience with his parents, who spent their whole lives working in agriculture; they taught him to work alongside them starting at a very young age. 

Now, Deider is married and agriculture is the source of income that allows his family to have a decent quality of life. He doesn't have enough capital, and winter greatly damaged his crops. That's why now that he has the opportunity to recover, Deider is seeking a loan to buy supplies like fertilizer, irrigation, and insecticides to get his fields back in shape. This way, Deider will be able to take care of his crops and offer his customers a better quality product, thus earning a better income that will allow him to provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies like fertilizers, irrigation, and insecticides to get his fields back in shape.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo ha tenido que pasar grandes adversidades que se le han presentado en la vida, pero siempre la ha acompañado una gran fortaleza y ganas de salir adelante para continuar progresando junto a sus hijos ofreciéndoles una buena  calidad de vida. Consuelo es madre soltera cabeza de hogar de sus 2 hijos de 17 y 19 años de edad, y desde hace 5 años que el padre de sus hijos los abandonó, las cargas económicas para el sostenimiento del hogar y todas las demás responsabilidades de su familia han caído encima suyo. Para generar los ingresos que requiere en su hogar tiene una venta de fritos, y gracias a su esfuerzo ahora tiene muy buenos clientes y espera poder seguir creciendo para mejorar las condiciones económicas del hogar, pues ofrecerles educación de buena calidad a sus hijos se ha convertido en todo un reto. Debido a que no cuenta con un capital suficiente, Consuelo busca un préstamo para comprar un carro de comidas rápidas y los utensilios necesarios para iniciar el negocio de venta de comidas rápidas.

Su sueño es poder sacar su familia adelante ofreciéndoles una buena calidad de vida en el hogar y mejores oportunidades económicas. Además, aspira poder ofrecerles educación universitaria dentro de los pocos años que ya culminan el colegio.
texts.en:
Consuelo has been through great adversity throughout her life. However, she has always had great strength and a desire to succeed to continue progressing with her children in order to give them a good quality of life. Consuelo is a single mother and head of the household for her two children who are 17 and 19 years old. Five years ago, the children’s father abandoned them. The economic load for household expenses and the other family responsibilities have fallen on her. In order to generate income required for her home, she sells fried food. Thanks to her efforts, she now has good customer. She hopes the business can continue to grow in order improve the household’s economic condition. Giving her children a good quality education has become a challenge. Since she does not have sufficient capital, Consuelo is looking for a loan to purchase a fast food cart and the necessary utensils in order to start the fast food business. 

Her dream is move her family forward by offering them a good quality of life at home and through better economic opportunities. In addition, she aspires to offer them university educations in a few years when they finish school.

loans.use: purchase a fast food cart and the necessary utensils for the fast food business.

loans.name: Mahdi

texts.en:
Mahdi is from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married, and has one child. One of his parents lives with him, and he is the only provider for the family.

Mahdi owns a shop that sells soft drinks, juices, and bottles of water. He established his business in 2010, and he has now one employee. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan to pay the annual rent for his shop. He aims to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent for his shop

loans.name: Nhoem

texts.en:
From the province of Kompong Cham, Nhoem, 30 years of age, is a hard-working woman who generates an income by cultivating rice on her own farmland. Her husband is also a rice farmer, and both earn a profit of about USD$4 a day to support their expenses. They are blessed with a child still in the public school.

To increase their revenue, Nhoem wishes to buy a plot of her neighbor's farmland, for which she is seeking a loan from Kiva leaders; she will use this land to grow more rice.

loans.use: to buy an additional plot of farmland to grow rice.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a 41-year-old woman with three children, ages 15, 17 and 19. For six years now, she has operated a sari-sari store to help her husband who is a carpenter. In it, she sells basic household needs like canned goods, noodles, detergents, seasoning and toiletries. This gives her an average income of 900 PHP. Aside from that, she is also making barbecue for more income. Remedios is asking for a loan to buy meat, soft drinks, charcoal and seasoning for her barbecue business. This will help her to be more productive and she can focus on the profitability of her business, too. 

In the future, she hopes to have a bigger business and to sell more merchandise in bulk for better profits. Her income will help her children's future through education.

loans.use: to buy meat, soft drinks, charcoal and seasoning.

loans.name: Vedaste

texts.en: Vedaste is 33 years old. He is married to a businesswoman. He owns a store where he sells different items. He wants the loan to buy more sugar, cooking oil and rice to sell. The profits from the business will be used for savings.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, cooking oil and rice to sell.

loans.name: Chneang's Group

texts.en:
Chneang, 42, is a married mother of six dependent children, three daughters and three sons. Some of her children are in school and some are working for others for a fee. Her family lives in a house with a thatched roof located in the Sangke district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has earned a living through farming rice for ten years. Low crop yields due to being destroyed by flood is the main challenge for her field of business. 

Chneang’s group consists of four members who are all female. She has been a member of VisionFund for two cycles and completely repaid the past loans which have helped her relieve her family’s burden and support her children’s education. Now she is leading her group to request a loan with VisionFund. Chneang will use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more healthy rice to increase her income from the current business so as to improve her family’s living conditions and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Laun's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in a rural area of the Sangke district of Battambang province, Cambodia, Laun is now 59 years old and widowed. She has four children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school. She has struggled to feed the family by being involved in rice farming for five years and sometimes working as a paid worker. Drought is a big challenge for her paddy-field business. 

Laun’s group consists of four members and she is a fifth-cycle client with VisionFund. She successfully repaid the past loans which have helped her to expand her business and support her children’s education. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Laun will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from the current business and also improve her standard of living and keep her child in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Channy's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in Kandal province’s Kandal Stoeng district, Channy is 33 years old and married. She has three dependent children, one daughter and two sons, who are still in school. She is a rice farmer and also a tailor in the local area, while her husband is a motor taxi driver to help support the family. She has been in this business for several years, earning about US $12 per day and is able to save about US $4 each day for future needs. 

Channy has been a borrower of VisionFund for two cycles and she wisely and successfully has used the past two loans to improve her family’s livelihood and was able to afford a water pump, while her member is just with VisionFund this cycle. Now she and her member are applying for a loan of US $300 each. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for labor. She hopes to grow her rice healthily and fruitfully and also hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Sreyvong's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village in the Banteay Meanchey province’s Mongkul Borey district of Cambodia, Sreyvong is aged 32 years and married with three dependent children (two daughters and one son). To sustain the family’s needs, she has been in rice farming on three hectares while her husband works as a paid worker in a local area to supplement the family’s income. Involved in this business for seven years, Sreyvong and her husband can earn about 25,000 KHR per day and manage to save about 7,000 KHR each day for the future. The main challenge is lack of working capital to support the current business.

Sreyvong has been with VisionFund for four cycles while the other members have been with VisionFund from two to five cycles. She has successfully used her past loans to improve her livelihood. Now she is leading her group of five females to request a loan. As the group leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of the loan to build savings. She expects this loan will enable her to earn more income from the current business so as to achieve her dream of buying a tractor for helping in the paddy-rice business and a motorbike for commuting for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Ruby Dalila

texts.es:
Ruby es madre soltera cabeza de familia de su hijo de 12 años de edad y con mucho esfuerzo ha buscado ofrecerle una buena calidad de vida y el acceso a una educación de mejor calidad para su hijo; para lograrlo, Ruby tiene un almacén de venta de ropa donde ofrece principalmente blusas para dama, las cuales con un gran esfuerzo confecciona por su propia cuenta en su hogar. De esta manera, Ruby tiene la oportunidad de obtener mayores utilidades por sus productos ya que no paga a un proveedor por la prenda fabricada sino que compra los insumos y las confecciona ella misma. A pesar de que su negocio lo inició con muy bajo capital y cuenta con muy pocos recursos, su esfuerzo le ha permitido salir adelante y ofrecer a sus clientes productos de muy buena calidad, y gracias a que esta teniendo unas buenas ventas, Ruby busca un préstamo para comprar insumos como telas e hilos para confeccionar blusas que requiere en su negocio para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.

Su sueño es poder sacar este negocio adelante y en un futuro generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas. Además, aspira a tener una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su hijo en el hogar y tener mejores oportunidades económicas para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Ruby is a single mother head of household, with a 12 year-old son. She has worked hard to provide him with a better quality of life and with access to a high quality education. To do so, she has a store where she sells clothing, principally ladies’ blouses, which she makes herself in her home. In this way, Ruby has the opportunity to earn greater profits for her products because she does not pay a provider for the manufactured items; she simply buys the materials and makes them herself.  

Despite the fact that she started her business with very little capital and she has few resources, her hard work has enabled her to get ahead and offer her clients very high quality products, thanks to which she is having some good sales. Ruby is requesting a loan to purchase supplies, such as fabric and thread in order to make the blouses she needs for her business so she can meet her customers’ demands.

Her dream is to be able to move her business forward and in the future generate jobs for people in need. As well, she aspires to have a better quality of life for herself and her son in their home and to have better opportunities to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy supplies, such as fabric and thread to make the blouses that she needs in her business so she can satisfy the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Denys Enrique

texts.es:
El señor Denys es una persona muy trabajadora dedicado 100% a su trabajo. Actualmente vive con su esposa y sus 5 hijos en el municipio del corpus departamento de Choluteca. 
Don Denys se dedica a su trabajo fijo como maestro de educación primaria. El préstamo lo necesita para la compra de láminas de zinc para techar su casa ya que el techo que tiene es un poco viejo y esta en mal estada.
Don Denys de esta manera mejorara su calidad de vida su deseo es seguir trabajando muy fuerte para poder ayudar a su familia.
Choluteca, Honduras - Agosto del 2012
texts.en:
Denys is a very hardworking man, 100% dedicated to his work. Right now, he lives with his wife and five children in the town of Corpus, Choluteca department.
 
Denys works at his regular job as a primary school teacher. He needs the loan to buy zinc sheeting to put a roof on his house, since the roof is getting old and in is bad repair.

This Denys will improve his quality of life. He wants to keep working very hard to be able to help his family.

Choluteca, Honduras - August 2012

loans.use: to buy sheeting to put a roof on his house.

loans.name: Edwin Erick

texts.es: El señor EDWIN y la señora MONICA son casados desde hace 9 años y tienen dos hijas, esta familia vive en la villa paraíso a unos 15 minutos de la zona del plan 3000 y a 45 minutos de la ciudad ellos viven de el sustento de el jefe de familia que se dedica al servicio de transporte trabajando con su propio vehículo como taxista y como sus hijas ya están en cursos superiores los gastos son cada vez mas fuertes y el ingreso de taxi no alcanza a veces para algunas cosas y así se tienen que privar de algunas cosas que comprar y gastos que tiene que realizar que se tienen que esperar y con el problema de que su vehículo que se ha dañado  la única fuente de ingresos se ve afectada para seguir sustentando a su familia  para poder arreglar su vehículo es lo que necesita y así poder sustentando a su familia y poder mejorara su calidad de vida de esta familia.
texts.en:
Edwin and Monica have been married for 9 years and have 2 daughters. The family lives in Villa Paraiso, some 15 minutes from the Plan 3000 zone and 45 minutes from the city. They survive on the earnings of the head of the family, Edwin, who offers transport services, using his own vehicle, as a taxi driver. Since his daughters are in secondary school, the costs continue to increase and the income of a taxi driver is insufficient, at times. They have to refrain from buying some things and postpone paying for other expenses.

The problem is that Edwin's taxi is damaged and since it is his only source of income, this affects his ability to sustain his family. In order to be able to do so, he needs to repair his vehicle, so that he can improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to repair his taxi, in order to support the family.

loans.name: Jacinta Wanjiru

texts.en:
Jacinta used her previous loan amount to buy potato seedlings and fertilizer for planting. She was able to plant and harvest and it was profitable. She was able to pay the loan well and in good time.

She plans to use this loan amount to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer as well as buy animal feed for livestock. With the anticipated income, she plans to pay school fees for her children.

In the future, Jacinta hopes to invest more in her farming business, make more income and be able to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and animal feed.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru: Светлана торгует в Центральном универмаге своего родного города, имеет достаточный опыт в работе, постоянно осуществляет поездки за товаром, следит за обновлением товара. Она торгует сумками, кожаной галантереей, головными уборами, также и текстильной галантереей, шарфами, платками, носочно-чулочными изделиями. Кредит нужен для того, чтобы закупить и привезти из Одессы платки, а также носочно-чулочные изделия для увеличения ассортимента товара и пополнения оборотных средств. На этот раз понадобился кредит для закупки вышеперечисленного товара поскольку пошел покупательский спрос на этот вид товара. Светлана торгует постоянно. Ее можно охарактеризовать как честного и ответственного предпринимателя.
texts.en: Svetlana is a salesperson at the Central supermarket in her home city. She has sufficient experience in her line of work, constantly travels to purchase her merchandise, and makes sure to keep it up to date. Svetlana sells bags, leather goods, headwear, as well as textile products such as scarves, shawls, socks and hosiery. She needs this loan to purchase and transport shawls and hosiery from Odessa in order to expand the range of her merchandise, as well as to increase her working capital. Svetlana needs a loan for this purchase due to high customer demand for the above-mentioned goods. She works full-time and can be characterized as an honest and responsible entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase and transport shawls and hosiery from Odessa in order to expand the assortment of her merchandise, as well as to increase her working capital

loans.name: Gelasio

texts.es: Gelasio se ha dedicado toda su vida a trabajar en el campo. Desde que tenía 10 años ayudaba a su padre junto con sus hermanos durante la época de cosecha y al terminar la escuela primaria dejo los estudios para dedicarse de lleno a trabajar en el campo. En ocasiones se iba de jornalero con otras personas y en ocasiones trabajaba en las fincas familiares. Gelasio se independizó de su familia cuando se casó con Julia con quien tiene un hijo a quien también ha inculcado el amor al trabajo en el campo ya que en la comunidad en donde viven no cuenta con muchas opciones de empleo. Parte de la producción de café de Gelasio es de café convencional y parte de café orgánico. El está realizando las labores necesarias para convertir toda la producción a café orgánico y está siendo asesorado por el personal de la “Unión Regional de Huatusco” con la finalidad de obtener mejores resultados. Para la siguiente cosecha el necesita comprar fertilizante orgánico para sus fincas y también quiere procesar su café ya que de esta forma lo puede vender a un mejor precio. Para llevar a cabo estas labores solicita un crédito el cual pagará al final de la cosecha. Aparte de cosechar café Gelasio también produce frijol y plátano para tener un ingreso extra para su familia. Una de las cosas que a Gelasio le gustaría realizar pasando la cosecha de café es pintar su casa para así darle una mejor imagen.
texts.en:
Gelasio has made a living all of his life working in the fields.  From the age of ten he helped his father together with his brothers during the harvest season and upon finishing elementary school he left his studies in order to dedicate himself full-time in the fields.  On occasion he was a day laborer with others and on occasion he worked on family farms.  Gelasio became independent from his family when he married Julia with whom he has a son to whom he has also instilled the love of work in the fields since in the community where they live they can’t rely on many employment options.  

Part of Gelasio’s coffee production is conventional coffee and part is organic coffee.  He is doing the necessary work to convert all of the coffee production to organic coffee and is being advised by the staff of the “Unión Regional de Huatusco” with the purpose of obtaining better results.  For the next harvest he needs to buy organic fertilizer for his farms and he also wants to process his own coffee since in this way he can sell it at a better price.  In order to carry out this work he is applying for a loan which he will pay back at the end of the harvest.  

Apart from harvesting coffee, Gelasio also produces beans and bananas in order to have extra income for his family.  One of the things that Gelasio would like to achieve from the coffee harvest is to paint his house in order to give it a better image.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and to process his own coffee.

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es: Desde que era un niño Ignacio se vio involucrado en la producción del café pues su padre lo llevaba a las fincas para que lo ayudara y aprendiera a trabajar en el campo mientras combinaba estas actividades con la escuela. A los 15 años comenzó a trabajar de lleno como jornalero, algunas veces con su padre y otras en las fincas distintos productores. Actualmente se dedica a producir su propio café y es socio desde hace algunos años de la “Unión Regional de Huatusco” que es a donde vende su café para que sea procesado y exportado. El café que él produce es convencional y con la asesoría del personal de la “Unión Regional de Huatusco” tiene planeado hacer la conversión a café orgánico. Este proceso le tomará aproximadamente 3 años ya que debe ir renovando por partes sus plantas y por eso necesita un crédito para poder arrancar con este proyecto. Durante la última cosecha tuvo una producción de 8 toneladas y para la siguiente tiene como meta entregar 10 toneladas ya que hace tiempo adquirió un terreno el cual ya está sembrado y va a comenzar a dar sus primeros frutos de café orgánico en unos meses. Ignacio está casado con Jocelyn y tienen 3 hijos a los cuales les han enseñado a trabajar en el campo y en un futuro les gustaría poder brindarles la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera universitaria.
texts.en: Ever since he was a child, Ignacio has been involved in producing coffee. His father used to take him to the farms so that he would help him and learn to do agricultural work, all the while combining these activities with school. At the age of 15 he began working full time as a farm laborer, sometimes with his father and other times in different farmers' lands. He currently grows his own coffee, and for the past few years he's been a member of the Unión Regional de Huatusco, which is where he sells his coffee for processing and exporting. The coffee he grows is conventional, and with the support of the people at Unión Regional de Huatusco he plans to make the transition into organic coffee. Since he must renew his crop one step at a time, this process will take him approximately three years, and for that reason he needs a loan so he can get this project started. He got 8 tons of produce from his last harvest. His goal for the next harvest is to deliver 10 tons, because a while ago he purchased a plot of land that's been sown and will begin to produce its first organic coffee beans in a few months. Ignacio is married to Jocelyn and they have three children, whom they've taught to work on the farm. In the future they would like to provide them with the opportunity to get a college education.

loans.use: to renew his coffee crop.

loans.name: Pramila

texts.en:
Pramila is a 48-year-old widow lady living with her daughter, age 19, and son, age 16. Her son is studying and her daughter runs a small tailoring shop where she does repair work on the dresses of her customers. Pramila owns and manages a variety store where she sells sarees (traditional Indian dress), bangles, cosmetics, talcum powder, fashion accessories, etc. She has a plan to enhance her business by bringing in more stock of what she sells and adding some more products like wafers, nail colours, falls (used to attach to the bottom of sarees), shampoos, hair oil, etc. She says that doing so will improve her family’s economic condition.

Pramila has requested a loan of 30,000 Indian rupees (INR) to purchase the above products. She has a dream of giving a good education to her son and saving some money for her daughter’s marriage.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing bangles, cosmetics, talcum powder, wafers, nail colours, shampoos, etc., for her variety store.

loans.name: Cenovia

texts.es: Desde que era una niña Cenovia ha estado relacionada con el café pues su padre era productor y ella lo ayudaba durante la época de cosecha recolectando los granos de las matas y poco a poco fue aprendiendo todo lo necesario para poder llevar a cabo esta actividad. Cuando ella se casó comenzó a ayudar a su esposo quien también se dedicaba a esta actividad y enseñaron a sus hijos para que los ayudaran. Actualmente Cenovia vive con 3 de sus hijos y 3 de sus nietos y entre todos han hecho del café un negocio familiar, repartiéndose las actividades. Sus hijos son los que se encargan principalmente de las fincas, sus nietos ayudan durante la época de cosecha y ella se encarga de administrar el negocio y de repartir los recursos económicos. Ella ha hecho crecer su negocio a base de créditos que ha obtenido a través de los años y en esta ocasión quiere aprovechar la oportunidad que brinda KIVA para obtener un préstamo ya que necesita sembrar planta de café y comprar fertilizantes para sus fincas. Ella está muy entusiasmada con la idea de trabajar con KIVA y para la próxima cosecha sabe que su producción podrá mantenerse si realiza las labores antes mencionadas.
texts.en: Cenovia has worked with coffee since she was a little girl, as her father was a grower and she helped him during the harvest season by collecting the beans from the plants.  Little by little she learned everything she needed to know to be able to do it on her own.  When she got married, she started to help her husband, who was also in this business, and they taught their children so they could help.  Cenovia currently lives with three of her children and three of her grandchildren and together they have made coffee a family business by splitting the duties among themselves.  Her children are the ones who are mainly in charge of the plantations; her grandchildren help during the harvest season; and she is in charge of managing the business and distributing pay.  She has made her business grow with loans she has received over the years and, currently, she wants to take advantage of the opportunity Kiva is offering her for a loan, as she needs to plant more coffee and buy fertilizers for her plantations.  She is very enthusiastic about working with Kiva and she knows that, come next harvest, she will be able to maintain her yield if she does the aforementioned work.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants and fertilizer

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hever Alexander

texts.es:
Hever, está decidido por un nuevo préstamo para el fortalecimiento del negocio, se comprara materiales para la compra de mercería y repuestos para la reparación de celulares, por ejemplo mochilas, llaveros, carcasas, baterías, teclados, para los celulares, esta inversión le aumentara la mercadería para sus clientes.
Con el préstamo anterior, realizo la compra siempre en materiales para la venta de mercería, con estos fondos ha trabajado hasta el momento de manera ordenada, con la intención de seguir trabajado.
texts.en: Hever has decided to take a loan to strengthen his business.  He will purchase supplies and cell phone accessories.  For example, backpacks, keychains, cases, batteries and keyboards.  This investment will increase the amount of merchandise available to his customers.  With his previous loan, he was able to purchase materials to sell at his store.  That loan helped him establish his business with the intention of moving forward.

loans.use: to purchase backpacks, keychains, cell phone cases, batteries, and keyboards.

loans.name: Nhanh's Group

texts.en:
Nhanh, age 49, lives in a rural area in the Ponhea Krek District of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has four children, two of whom are dependent on her and still in school. To support the family, she and her husband have been rice farming on 2.5 hectares, cashew and cassava planting on 2 hectares, and complement the family’s income by raising pigs. They have been in business for 25 years. Together, Nhanh and her husband can earn about 23,000 riels (KHR) per day to meet the family’s needs. Lack of capital to support the current business is the main challenge for her.

Nhanh has been with VisionFund for three cycles, while the other member is just in her first cycle with VisionFund. She absolutely repaid the past loans which have helped relieve her family’s burden and improved their livelihood. Now she is leading her group asking for a loan. Nhanh, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it on furrowing the paddy field. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income so as to achieve her dream of having her own rubber field to manage in order to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan practices farming in Nyahururu town where she plants cash crops. She has been in the farming business for the past 12 years. She is 54 years old, married to Simon, who is also a farmer, and they have seven children. This will be her first loan and she plans to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer, farm chemicals and seedlings. In the future, Susan hopes to improve her farming methods and thereby make more income.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Bopha's Group

texts.en:
Bopha is 19 years old. She is married with two sons who are dependent on her. To make a living, she has been selling sweets while her husband works as a paid worker. The current business earns them approximately KHR 9,000 per day and they manage to save about KHR 4,000 each day after deducting daily expenses. Lacking of working capital is the main challenge for her business.

Bopha’s group consists of three members who live in the same village of the Pursat province's Kror Kor district, Cambodia and she is a first-cycle client with VisionFund. She and her group members are requesting a loan with VisionFund of KHR 1,000,000 each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy more sweets for resale and use a portion of it to buy chickens to raise to earn extra income. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income from the current business so as improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more sweets for resale

loans.name: Kea's Group

texts.en:
Kea, 32, lives in a rural area located in the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia. She has two dependent daughters, one of whom is a student and the other who is still too young for school. She has been farming rice for ten years. To complement the family’s income, her husband also works for others for a fee. Their current businesses earn Kea and her husband about 15,000 KHR per day and they are able to save about 7,000 KHR each day for the future. Kea's main business challenge is drought. 

Kea is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer for her rice farm. She is the leader of this group loan and has been with VisionFund for two cycles. He fellow group member is on her first loan cycle with VisionFund. Kea has wisely used her past loans to better provide for her family and her children’s education. She expects to plant her rice healthily and increase her paddy field income to set aside some money to build a decent house for her family and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her rice farm

loans.name: Baltazar

texts.es: Baltazar se ha dedicado a producir café desde hace más de 40 años. Sus comienzos fueron con su padre y sus hermanos pues desde pequeños iban a las fincas a realizar tareas de limpieza y durante la cosecha los llevaban a cortar el café. Ahora Baltazar trabaja en su finca junto con sus 4 hijos y también lo ayudan las esposas de 2 de ellos. También cuentan con un vivero de planta de café y de esta manera aseguran la calidad desde el inicio. Para la siguiente cosecha Baltazar necesita comprar fertilizantes, realizar labores de limpieza y preparación de sus terrenos. Para llevar a cabo estas actividades necesita de un crédito y considera que KIVA es una excelente opción. Baltazar entrega todo su café a la “Unión Regional de Huatusco” asociación a la cual pertenece desde hace muchos años y la cual se encarga de procesarlo y exportarlo. Para la próxima cosecha tiene planeado comprar una camioneta para transportar su café con las ganancias que obtenga. Dos de sus hijos ya están casados y a él le gustaría poder apoyarlos para que construyan sus casas y se puedan independizar por completo. En la fotografía podemos ver a Baltazar en el vivero que tiene con su familia y nos muestra las plantas que ya estan floreciendo y en poco tiempo podrán ser sembradas.
texts.en:
Baltazar has been making a living producing coffee for more than 40 years.  He started with his father and brothers when they would clean farm homes and then they would go harvest the coffee.  Now, Baltazar works on his own farm with his four sons and two daughters in law.  They also rely on a coffee plant nursery so that they can monitor the quality from the very beginning.  The coming harvest will require investment in fertilizer, manual labor, and preparation of the land.  To cover these expenses Baltazar needs a loan and he considers Kiva to be an excellent option.  

Baltazar sells his coffee to the "Unión Regional de Huatusco", an association to which he belongs and that has been processing and exporting his coffee for many years.  With the income of this coming harvest he plans to purchase a truck that will transport his coffee. 

Two of Baltazar's sons are now married and he would like to support them so they can build their own homes and become completely independent.  In the photo above Baltazar crouches in his family's coffee plant nursery and shows us the leaves of the plants which will soon be planted.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and tend his land.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Doub's Group

texts.en:
Living in a thatched roof house in the Dambae District of Kampong Cham Province, Doub is 34 years old and she is the married mother of two sons, both of whom are dependent on her and still in school. To meet the family’s needs, she has been growing cassava on 1.5 hectares for almost ten years. The current business earns her 30,000 riels (KHR) per day to support the family.

This is the first loan for Doub’s group with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. Now she and her group member are applying for a loan with VisionFund of 500,000 KHR and 1,000,000 respectively. As the leader, she is going to spend her portion on labor costs. She hopes to increase her income from the current business so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to cover labor costs for a cassava farm

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is 50 years old and single. She takes care of her sister's five children who are orphans. For the past three years, Teresia has sold second-hand household goods. She earns 180,000 KES each month. Teresia has good credit history with KADET LTD and she is applying for her third loan.

Teresia is requesting a 100,000 KES loan to buy more goods such as sofa sets, fridges, and utensils to sell. She will use her anticipated profit to pay school fees for the children she takes care of. In the future, she hopes to continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy goods such as sofa sets, fridges, and utensils to sell

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
La señora Estela tiene más de 20 años dedicándose al comercio de venta de ropa, anterior mente ella y su esposo quien ya falleció se dedicaban a vender en diferentes partes de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo. Actualmente su negocio lo maneja desde la comodidad de su vivienda así es mas fácil y seguro para ella. 
Solicita el préstamo para invertir en el negocio ya que sus clientas le están solicitando que tenga más variedad de mercancía, y no quiere descapitalizar el negocio. Con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio pagar el crédito, ya que los gastos familiares se encargan dos de sus hijos que viven con ella. 
Desea contar nuevamente con su cooperación, ya a tenido crédito el cual ha sido para mejor de su negocio el cual le ha servido mucho en su negocio.
texts.en:
Estela has been selling clothing for more than 20 years.  Previously, she and her late husband used to sell in different parts of the city of Nuevo Laredo.  Now she manages her business from the comfort of her home, because this way it's easier and more secure for her.

She is requesting a loan to invest in her business, because her customers are asking her to get a greater variety of merchandise and she doesn't want to take money out of her business.  She will repay the loan with the profits she gets from her business, because the household expenses are paid by two of her children who live with her.  She would like to be able to count on your cooperation once again.  She already took a loan to improve her business, and it was a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her clothing business

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en: Nicholas is 26 years old and practices mixed farming in Nyahururu town. He is married to Sabina, who is also a farmer, and they have a 9-month-old child. This being his first loan, he plans to use the money to buy a dairy cow and thereby increase his livestock. With the anticipated income, he plans to improve his farming methods. In the future, Nicholas plans to invest more in his farming business and improve the standard of living of his family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Keb's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area in the Kror Kor district of Pursat district, Cambodia, Keb is a 33-year-old married man with two children, both of whom are dependent on him and still in school. He has been in paddy farming for almost ten years and he also works to supplement the family’s income as a paid worker in the local area. He can earn approximately 15,000 KHR per day to meet his future needs. However, drought is a big challenge for his field business.

Keb’s group consists of two members who have been with VisionFund for two cycles. He completely repaid the first loan which has supported his children’s education. Now he and his group member are applying for a loan with VisionFund of 500,000 KHR each. As the leader, he will use his portion to spend on buying fertilizer for his farmland. He hopes to plant his crop and get a healthy and good yield and sell it for a higher price in the market so as to earn a good living and keep his children in school.

loans.use: To spend on buying fertilizer for his farmland

loans.name: Nonvignon 6 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NONVIGNON 6 est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Gisèle Opportune est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Gisèle Opportune est âgée de 40 ans et est mariée à un certain Patrick. Le couple a un enfant qui est scolarisé et qui vit à leur charge. Gisèle Opportune vit ensemble avec son enfant et son mari. Le couple supporte ensemble les diverses charges du ménage. Gisèle Opportune a peu fréquenté l'école. Il y a une vingtaine d’année environs que Gisèle Opportune mène comme activité la vente d'oignons et de la farine de manioc dans un marché du Bénin. Gisèle Opportune s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. La demande de sa clientèle devient de plus en plus grande et compte tenu de ses moyens limités, Gisèle Opportune n'arrive plus à bien répondre à leurs exigences. Eu égard à cela et compte tenu de leurs ressources limitées, Gisèle Opportune et les autres membres du groupe NONVIGNON 6 sollicitent ensemble un  premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The NONVIGNON 6 group is made up of three members who live in the same neighborhood.  The group's representative, named Gisèle Opportune, is the woman raising her hand in the photo.

It is the first time that this group is requesting financial assistance from  ALIDé, in order to raise the level of its activity.

Gisèle Opportune is 40 years old and married to a man named Patrick.  They have one child who is their dependent and who goes to school.  Gisèle Opportune lives with her husband and child.  The couple jointly takes care of the various household expenses.

Gisèle Opportune only attended school for a short period of time.  For the past twenty years or so, she has been selling onions and cassava flour at a market in Benin.  She buys her supplies from a market in Benin.  However, the demand from her customers is increasing, and she can no longer adequately meet all their needs because of her own limited means.

In view of this situation, and because of their limited resources, Gisèle Opportune and the other members of the NONVIGNON 6 group have come together to request a first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy bags of onions.
